review_body: This hotel is great in terms of location and I do think that New York has so many things to do and see that it isn't necessary to be in your room that much. That being said, there is no insulation between the rooms. As an example, I could hear the person in the next room flicking through their TV at 1am. Also, any movement in the corridor is very loud, such as the cleaning staff at 8am the next day. If you can sleep through anything/are ok with earplugs then maybe you will be ok. The bedroom isn't large and the bathroom is tiny but it will be fine if you're by yourself. Personally, I would advise spending an extra $25 for a better hotel.

this is a nice little hotel very close to the subway. the downtown 1 train will have you in times square in no time at all. the hotel is clean. rooms are small which is normal but adequate. beds are really comfy and lots of extra bedding and pillows. the big problem is the shower. the shower itself is brilliant, hot and powerful. however the shower curtain is rubbish so when you have a shower the floor is covered in water.staff were friendly and check in very quick and easy. brilliant location and good value. however you cannot get any food in the hotel but lots of good restaurants around the area. will stay here again.

Got bedbugs from there. The extermination took months, and my entire home taken apart and put back together.: $1000 The desk clerk said nothing upon notification and never heard back from the management. Do not be fooled by the recent renovation and the great locale. Stay somewhere else

Excellent location and excellent service. The room is very comfy and very clean, also nicely decorated and very spacious. Staff is very gracious and helpful. One of the most convenient and reasonably-priced hotels in NY, also very close to the subway on one of the most beautiful districts of NY. Will definitely choose to stay here again and would recommend it to everyone for a pleasant and relaxing stay, while in the city.

booked a room here last minute on a saturday night. what an adorable little room. it was spotless and served our purpose of somewhere to comfortably sleep. would definitely recommend! the only thing is i wish they offered some sort of breakfast, like muffins or bagels or something along those lines.

I needed a placed to stay on the Upper West Side for one night. The location was perfect. I had the option to stay with friends but preferred the privacy that a hotel would offer. It was clean, room 410 was renovated with new linens and a large screen tv. Like other reviews mention, the room is the size of a shoe box. I got a Queen bed which took up 90% of the floor space. Fine for one person, but I wouldn't stay here as a couple. They leave space under the beds for your suitcase. There was a tiny bathroom and closet. The whole room was smaller than my baby nursery at home.I think of it like a single dorm room in college, or a spiffy Youth Hostel, with no place for a desk or any furniture besides a bed. The bed was fine, it is clean and comfortable. Something to note of is that there is a staircase at the entrance. I had to drag my luggage up that and struggled a bit. The front desk reception were courteous. A friend had left a gift basket which was waiting for me upon arrival. I am happy I chose this hotel, and if I needed to be on the Upper West Side again I would certainly choose the Belnord.

If you don't feel claustrophobic in small places, then surely you can choose this place if you aren't spending a lot of bucks but don't want to compromise on the NYC experience. This hotel is located at a walking distance from the Central park, MET, and a lot of prominent places. The location was the reason we chose this hotel although the rooms are super crampy - you can't twirl in it, I am serious. But if you plan to select a hotel only for sleeping and want to roam around the city all day long, then it's a good place for you, also some amazing restaurants at a walking distance.P.S. tripadvisor isn't allowing me to select the travel date beyond Jan 2019, I actually stayed here for 4 days in May 2016.

If you want the New York tourist experience, this is not it. This is located in a neighborhood, walk to local eateries, and markets and stay in a small space. It is steps from the subway, uptown and basic. The check in staff are hospitable, not overly friendly, yet efficient. The walls are fairly thin so you hear conversations in the hallways pretty clearly and bags rolling down the wooden floors. I stayed alone for a night, two people might find it a bit tight, I enjoyed my stay here.

Very nice clean hotel, well situated for getting about, would come again. Very comfortable bed, rooms small did not matter has we were only in it to sleep spent all our time exploring NYC. Brilliant time. Recommended xx

A return visit after a couple of years. This small hotel continues to be an ideal spot for tourists. The front-desk crew are always cheerful and extremely helpful. The rooms, although smallish, are clean, warm with good hot water supply. Kitchen-room has good breakfast coffee.Tea and hot water at other times. The location is perfect for downtown on the metro line 1 (fast) and slower bus 104, both almost on the doorsteps. For the ‘museum mile’, the crosstown 86 bus is only a few steps away.Plenty of food stores and restaurants/take-aways are very close. Telephone use is free; can print boarding-passes

We arrived mid afternoon and the room was at the back on the third floor.It was basic but clean and the bathroom was small but clean and fresh towels every day. There was no tea coffee in the room but there was a coffee and water macine in a tiny kitchen like cupboard in the corridor which was ok. It was not to far from bus or subway and had some lovely restaurants/cafes near by.Reception staff were ok

We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in October. I knew the rooms were small...I read reviews on this site...I also read that it was clean, which was the most important. The price was right...we had stayed at the Lucerne 2 months before, but their price doubled. Well...this was the smallest room I have ever stayed in...we had to turn sideways in order to get around the bed. It was clean...but never again!

THEY STEAL thing from your bedroomWe had a good stay until we figured out that some stuffs were stolen in our bedroom.We were not the only one, we passed by the lobby a day, and a guy was mad because his ipad disapearred.The guy at the reception was really rude and non sympathic at all.They do not have an appropriate customer service, they steal and yell at you Stay away of this hotel !!!!

Really overrated on here in my opinion. The hotel reminds me of what they do to you when you go skiing - ie they know demand is high so they can over price and under deliver on all aspects of the service. I think people are willing to overlook this because it’s New York but there is absolutely no value for money to be found by staying here.There is no double glazing so the default temperature in the rooms is freezing. This can be made up for by using the air con / heating system but this is very loud and causes problems if you are a light sleeper (which I’m not but my partner is).It’s also incredibly noisy outside and you can hear the sirens, people screaming in the street, the clattering of who knows what and the homeless going through the huge piles of rubbish outside on the street.The decor hasn’t been changed for something like 20 years, there is minimal investment into the appearance of the rooms and cheap furniture throughout.It’s just a bit grim - it is fine if you are spending all day outside exploring New York but at the same time you will want some value for money which you won’t really find here. Really not great.

We stayed here for 5 nights and had a mixed experience. Lots of reviews mention how small the rooms are but on arrival we were told we’d been given a large room due to the length of our stay which was good. The room was clean and had good facilities and the bed was comfortable. It’s located in a nice area with close subway stops (86th Street) and we could easily access all the main tourist spots within 30/40minutes.Unfortunately the room was freezing cold due to the windows being very thin; there was a constant draft coming into the room to the point where it felt like the windows were open. There is heating but it’s a very noisy fan system so we slept badly as it was either the fan noise or the cold keeping us awake. The windows meant all outside noise was really amplified too. It’s a basic hotel which was good value for New York and we didn’t spent much time in the room but it could be better.

Don’t expect service of any kind, as front desk staff (especially the older lady called Maria) is rude and not service-minded at all. They will sigh loudly at any question or request, and are not bothered to say either hello or goodbye. Nothing to do with the American friendliness and hospitality we’re used to. Note: we didn’t have any special requests, this was just their general behavior that other guests were also subject to.That said, it’s alright, rooms are small but sufficient, nice and clean. Cleaning staff is polite. Good bathrooms and comfortable beds but the AC is noisy and there’s a lot of noise from the hallway too - people, doors slamming ect. so bring earplugs.

I was in the room very little except to sleep and shower- I did not want amenities so this was perfect! It was marathon weekend so rates were crazy high, and I was glad to have this place. Great location- very pleasant staffs and a very quiet building and area. The next night I was in a different hotel for $350- slightly bigger but not spacious room and amenities that were charged $45 but I never utilized . For the money I liked the Belnord!

Clean facility with minimal frills and fluff, but efficient. Extremely small rooms, but well kept and tidy and most folks don't go to NY to hang out in the room anyway. Overall it is satisfactory, particularly for shorter stays.

Hotel between 87th and broadway, way too far for visiting the city.The room i was given was a hole, not even big enough to open my luggage on the floor. Wifi doesn’t work well, which made it rather hard for me to work at night.No breakfast, no vending machine, no mini bar.The price was aroun 150 per night which was not cheap. I would definately not reccomend it

While yes, the rooms are tiny with about 2 feet walking room between the bed and wall/bathroom, you cannot beat the location and price! The bed was very comfortable and the hotel itself was cute with the blue shades and sparkly walls! Take advantage of the free coffee in each kitchen because they remove it in the afternoon. The location is amazing! 10 min walk and your in Central Park, plus the subway is literally 1 street down from the hotel. Getting to Times Square is a piece of cake, just hop on the red line 1,2, or 3 trains to downtown and in about 5 stops you’ll be in Times Square ,42nd. This location is nice when you want to unwind from the hectic loud Times Square area. But if you’re wanting the loud (like I did my very 1st time in NY) then this area may be too quiet and chill for you. You will see many homeless folks in Times Square, I recommend giving them your leftovers if you have any on hand. Always pay it forward when you can! Also, don’t get roped into the sidewalk shows where they hassle you for money, that’s never fun lol. Enjoy your stay!

We like this hotel a lot. It's not luxury by any stretch. BUT, it's comfortable and well-placed. And it's clean. And since they've reimagined the inside, it's quite nice. Again, I rate on a scale of what you should expect from a hotel on this level. It's NOT 4 stars because it's THE RITZ. It's 4 star -- b/c you get exactly what you expect. And rooms are small, yes. But it's NYC. You are very close to Central Park. You are close to quiet places to eat. We like the UWS b/c it gives a true taste of NYC -- not Times Square, etc. That's overplayed. And so far, Belnord hasn't gone to ridiculous RESORT fees like most other hotels in NYC today. I would suggest a TWIN room at the very least -- we've done the bunks, too.. but it truly is hyper small. Good enough for a weekend.. which we do often.. but if you want a bit of space -- a twin room is good enough. We've stayed here a few times now, it we are still not disappointed. Beds are comfy, showers are hot, and the AC -- works.You really cannot ask for more in NYC for a weekend of fun -- that won't break your bank.

We love the Belnord. We've stayed here four times over the past 10 years or so. Rooms are quiet and clean (although very New York small). Just across the street from one of the main subway lines that goes to mid-town and downtown. You can easily get almost anywhere you want to go on the subway. A 10 minute walk to Central Park, the Museum of Natural History, and a right in the heart of a huge variety of great restaurants.

Two things necessary for a solo traveler.. but another thing you need is water presser... they got none..it’s hard to get wet. Cheesy little envelopes of shampoo and rinse .Staff is friendly enough a plus.. new wi Fi pass code every day is a pain .. it’s kinda slow .. hallways are so narrow I wonder if in emergency it would be safe.. I mean really narrow.. maybe 3-0”..Room and bathroom adequate as previously mentioned but.. really small for two folks ... price is too high to recommend this place unless convenience to certain parts of upper west side is needed..

Rooms are small, but who wants to hang around a hotel room while in the city?! Clean and efficient, these rooms are in a quiet neighborhood (even Broadway, around the corner is quiet here). The 123 train is one block away to get you most anywhere you need to go.

My wife, son and I shared a bunk bed room with a separate full size bed. The rooms are (almost comically) small, as are most things in this hotel, but overall we had a wonderful experience. The room and hotel are immaculate and newly renovated and the price is extremely reasonable for the area. In addition, the staff was all extremely friendly and accommodating and we all had a great experience. Highly recommend this hotel!

Spent overnight on the Upper West Side of NYC. I booked two single rooms at the Belnord Hotel, which turned out to be perfect for my adult son and myself. The rooms were very reasonably priced. Each had everything essential (comfortable double bed, side tables with phone and alarm clock, closet, mirror, and excellent lighting. Bathrooms had ample plush towels, toiletries, etc.). Best of all, everything was wonderfully neat and clean! However, be aware that the rooms and bathrooms are very, very small. OK for one adult each. If you wish more space, you will want to book a double. We parked our car in a garage just a block away where the hotel arranges a discount. It was very convenient. The hotel has a small but adequate elevator and a very nice, bright staircase. The desk staff was a bit curt but overall helpful and efficient. It was a great help to be able to leave our suitcases in the storage room for a few hours after checking out. The hotel's location is around the corner from the Broadway subway and buses, an easy walk to Riverside Park, Central Park, and lots of restaurants and shops. All-in-all, a delightful stay.

A great location on the Upper West Side giving great access to the subway and local bars and restaurants. The hotel is situated on a relatively quiet side street compared to staying on Broadway itself. It was clean upon entry and the staff were helpful when needed. Room was very small but perfect for a short stay when you drop your bags and get out to explore the city. Room had been recently renovated and was clean with useful places to stash luggage under the bed with a few drawers if you wanted to unpack properly. Some great bars and restaurants around the local area and a handily placed Starbucks just around the corner. Would definitely recommend a stay if you’re looking for a budget option in Manhattan.

Everything in the suit was new, looks like after renovation. Room was clean and fresh. Complimentary coffee in the morning in common area. No fridge and microwave in the suit. There was a free safe in the room. Hairdryer in the room. The Reception staff was nice. The cons: the room is very tiny, it was a bit noisy from the outside (AC), the chair was aluminum and cold. Overall it was very good and nice hotel!

The Belnord Hotel is conveniently located on Broadway, a block from the IRT subway station, the M104 bus and the 86th st. crosstown bus. The rooms are also affordable relative to the ongoing New York City hotel rates. Our room was small (the bed took up a majority of the room's space), yet had all the necessary conveniences; a bathroom, television, telephone, enough outlets for several devices, wi-fi, air conditioning and storage under the bed. As a clean and comfortable place to come back to after enjoying the city, it more than fulfilled our needs. The staff was courteous and knowledgable. And location-wise we were a few blocks away from many Columbus Avenue restaurants including the delicatessen Barney Greengrass (a NYC experience all by itself). So if you enjoy the ambiance of Manhattan's upper westside, I recommend staying at the Belnord Hotel.

Best thing about the hotel is the location, no doubt. Close to a metro station, Central Park, 14mins from Time Square etc.The (renovated) double room is a matchbox and I do question the decision of putting a double bed in. I had lukewarm/cold water in the shower but very hot water from the sink... Very strange but the reception staff were pretty useless.The breakfast offer is in partnership with a restaurant around the corner. It's cheap but cheerful. The reception staff is not customer focused and borderline rude. The two ladies working there when I tried to procure a breakfast voucher were nonchalant and not interested in doing their job. The despicable attitude I received was very surprising for a hotel.I wouldn't go back, nor would I recommend. There are other hotels with similar location and price.

The location was great for my needs and the price was comparatively reasonable. The room was small, claustrophobically small. The room looked recently updated and the floors were some type of faux wood which is preferable to carpeting. The bed was built in with one side touching the wall. I am 5'7" and, at times my feet scuffed the bottom wall. I would not recommend this room for 2 people, despite the double bed. There was no AAA discount and no discussion, despite my efforts, regarding my room: floor, layout, etc. I see some pictures with double beds that appear larger but the woman at the desk ignored my requests.

The things that makes this hotel such a good choice are price, cleanliness, location, recent renovation of the rooms. While it is not the sort of hotel you choose if you want luxury and endless amenities, or one where you plan to stay in your room for most of the day (but why would you?), I have stayed here several times and never been disappointed. Downside: very small rooms--a bit like European hotels (not international chains), but the other positive things make up for that, especially for a single. One block from the #1 up/downtown subway; 3 blocks from Central Park West; lots of affordable restaurants nearby; a real sense of neighborhood in the surround. No restaurant in the hotel, but that's probably smart of them, given what is available a few steps outside their door.

My friend and I stayed here for 5 nights and had a bunk bed room on the 4th floor. The room was small, a bit like being on a cruise ship. This was as expected after reading previous review and not a problem, we just packed smaller suitcases had plenty of space. The rooms were cleaned daily, there is coffee and filtered water available at every floor, the area felt safe and had lots of cafes and restaurants (we had breakfast at City Diner on 90th street twice). The only negative part about this hotel is the loud noise from the air-condition. The air-con is built into the ceiling which means that when the air-con is on downstairs the whole floor vibrates and there is a loud deep rumbling sound. Add that to our own air-con running and it feels and sounds like you are close to the engine of a ship (adding to the feeling of sleeping on a cruise ship). We had earplugs so it was no problem! So for future residents, bring your earplugs!!

I know rooms in NYC are smaller than most, but this one was so small you could not open the closet or bathroom doors fully without banging into other furniture and the toilet was sandwiched between the shower and wall so your body touches both when you sit (and I’m not that big a person!).It’s clean and good location—and cheap. But ultimately I cancelled out my reservation and went somewhere I could at least move around the room without banging into furniture.

I'll be honest: the rooms are tiny. There is storage for luggage underneath the bed and a couple of drawers at the bottom of the bed. There is a small nightstand with drawer and a closet w/ safe to hold a few belongings. There was a private bathroom (again small -- the sink was very tiny) with tub/shower. No desk. No refrigerator. If you need to work in your hotel room, you might want to check out other options. That being said, I enjoyed my 5-night stay. The rooms were clean (immaculate) and housekeeping changed the bed linens and brought fresh towels each day, The front desk staff was helpful with nearby places to eat. The location on the upper west side of NY was perfect. You can walk or take the subway nearly anywhere.

You cannot walk directly into the hotel lobby and book a room. You have to go through Expedia. Also, the hotel does not tell you that if you leave early you need to call Expedia to notify them of the cancellation and get a refund. When I asked the hotel staff to call a taxi, one arrived quickly BUT...2/3 of the way to my destination I noticed not credit card reader. The driver told me he only took cash. This is not an acceptable way to travel in New York City and I had to use almost all my remaining cash which I had needed for my trip home! The room itself was rather nice and recently refurbished but the bathroom is tiny and the shower entry is extremely narrow. If you are a large framed or overweight person you simply will not fit through the opening. The shower leaked but instead of near the shower it formed a dangerous puddle directly in front of the sink. The toilet seat was loose and not repaired during my visit. The ice buckets are kept in the basement atop the quite tall ice machine (very difficult for a short person like me to reach) and the first one I chose was dirty! There is no ramp, the stairs make a heavy suitcase hard to manage, there is no doorman, and you are on your own getting in and out. The television is quite high on the wall which at first seemed nice but the angle does not make for healthy viewing (your neck will not be happy). The bedding and bed were VERY comfortable and towels soft. Shampoo, conditioner, and soap were provided. The shade does a good job of blocking out light but the curtains do not reach the wall on both sides! There is a distinct gap on either side. If you are on a low floor this is an issue. Safety was never a problem, vending machines with snacks and water are downstairs, and while there is a computer for guest use BEWARE! The computer indicates 20 cents per minute with, I believe, a $10 minimum but during the sign-in process you are informed that it is actually 35 cents a minute! I told the hotel lobby staff that, "I respectfully request that you change this immediately." You will have a 24 hour hold for a $10 deposit but my hold took 3 days to come off my bank account. Also, since I used a debit rather than credit card to pay for my room I had to pay a $200 deposit but there was no problem with that financial aspect. Once I called Expedia and asked for a refund, the process will take at least 5 business days and possibly longer. Therefore, since the hotel failed to notify me to call Expedia to start the refund process, it is about 10 days since I checked out the refund process is just now starting. The neighborhood has lots of nice places to eat including Kirsh on Amsterdam and 87th, less than 1 block away, and an Indian restaurant right around the corner with very good food and lovely staff. Kirsch is now my favorite place to eat in NYC!

Many tiny rooms per floor so it is easy to hear others talk in the hallway. This is due to the guests' ignorance not the hotel. Very nice area. I will come back with ear plugs. Close to Buses and the Subway.

Just stayed at the Belnord Hotel, and we plan to return. It is less expensive than most hotels on the Upper West Side. The room we had was snug (imagine a cabin on a ship), just big enough to accommodate a queen-sized bed. But it is clean, very well organized, with cubbies everywhere. The staff is friendly. The bed was very comfy, and the room was quiet. The overall atmosphere is simple but well thought-out. Just around the corner is Barnie Greengrass, legendary NYC Jewish deli. The hotel is one block from the subway and the crosstown bus. Highly recommended!
user_name:
jony246
New York City, New York

review_body: Another really good stay at the Belford. The rooms are small but the bed is very comfortable and all the amenities work well. The hotel is also extremely close to the 86th metro stop and the general area has plenty of nice bars and restaurants. The staff could be friendlier (and don’t seem really happy) but maybe they are used to difficult guests, who knows. They do an efficient job though and there’s always someone covering the front desk . Overall I really like this place and would definitely stay again.

Have been staying at Belnord for a few years now and this is still best value for money in Manhattan. Staff are exceptional and have to commend staff for great service and help. Rooms are functional, although small, and bathrooms clean and shower great. Love closeness to Subway Line 1. Happy that there is consistency in quality and service.

Jasonleg
Cape Town Central, South Africa

review_body: Yes, the rooms are small and feel even smaller with separate beds. We had a choice between a larger room (towards the street, close to the elevator) and a smaller room and opted for the smaller room as it was much quieter (back side). Service is good, free Internet slow but working, communal kitchen (one per floor) convenient with fridge, free water and free coffee/tea in the mornings. If you are exploring NYC all day and need a convenient, clean sleeping place at a reasonable rate and in W87th St (Upper West Side), this place is yours.

Pros:1) Great location, close to subway and Central Park2) Recently renovated, everything is in excellent condition, heater is super silent 3) Very comfortable bed, probably best I've ever slept4) Reasonably priced for New York CityCons:1) Very tiny room, but for New York City it's typicalThings to consider:1) They have discounted parking: forty something bucks for 24 hours, but on Sunday you might be able to find day street parking

The entrance to this hotel is welcoming although you have to negotiate steep steps to get into the lobby. The desk staff are efficient and helpful and dealt very quickly with the two small issues we had during our 5-night stay. The rooms are nicely decorated and the beds extremely comfortable. It was obvious from the photographs that the rooms weren’t going to be large, but the price we paid for the location of this hotel was very reasonable so the size of the rooms and the bathroom did not come as a surprise, and the underbed storage for the suitcases was helpful. The room was cleaned each day to a high standard by helpful maids. The small kitchenette which had excellent coffee and tea available each morning was very welcome. The hotel is in a great location on upper west side, and is just a few minutes walk from Broadway, the subway and Central Park. If you just want a quiet hotel to sleep in during your stay in New York I can recommend the Belnord Hotel.

Hotel is locating on the corner Brodway street Nearby Cenral Park. Very small rooms, but sufficient equipment. Quiet hotel. On the first floor is coffee automat, but in the afternoon was box with the coffe and tee empty.

Good value for a hotel in NYC. The rooms are tiny, but this is NYC and you probably will not spend much time in the hotel. Well located, near Central Park, 86 Street Station and lots of restaurants, coffee shops and banks. Keep in mind that if you have large luggage, you will probably have trouble finding where to leave it (there are two places below the bed that can accommodate medium luggage). There is a small wardrobe with a safe inside and a multi-channel TV. I do not know if it was an isolated case, but the floor of my room was extremely dirty and sticky, it was 6 days without stepping on the floor barefoot. The walls are also quite thin, so you hear a lot of the other rooms (mostly spirited couples). I did not need much help from the front desk, just to arrange airport transfers and the clerk was courteous.

Pros : i) The room was quiet, newly redecorated,the bed was comfortable (with TV) and warm (freezing outside), the bathroom with shower was clean and convenient, ii) the location near 86th Str. subway is great and the area is good with a lot around, iii) The room was small with no view but not a problem for the price. Cons : i) front desk guy slapping at your face to hand out your passport and credit card before anything makes a terrible first impression, ii) the hotel wifi has a problem since connexion through MS browser triggered security issue and denial to access the internet - something must be very wrong with their wifi (monitoring?). When I asked the front desk how to fix the problem to reconfirm my plane, the front desk guy said I could pay to use the computer in the lobby, so elegant ... iii) coffee and tea is only available between 09:00 and 12:00 only.Conclusion : we stayed for several days the room was fine but guys from the front desk have a very unpro. attitude and we will not come here again, since there are better choices around. Would be a really WOW hotel with proper service.

The Belnord is completely refurbished, and our double room had an extremely comfortable bed. Warning: there are only about 4 inches between said bed and the wall on one corner, so larger folks might want to steer clear (or get a larger room). There's nowhere to sit but the bed. That said, the room had everything we needed for a short stay, including toiletries, hairdryer, and ample towels (shower was good, too). The staff is friendly and they'll hold your luggage while you sightsee (remember that museums like the Met don't allow suitcases to be checked!). We got a great deal via bookings.com and would certainly stay here again. West 87th St. is very convenient not only for the Upper West Side but also for the cross-town bus at 86th St.

Very neat and appealing facilities. Lobby and hallways are bright and attractive. Rooms are not large, but we had plenty of room for the two of us and our things. The bathroom is small (OK for one person at a time), but everything in the hotel was immaculately clean and modern. The lighting in the room was excellent. Loved the small kitchenette down the hall that provided hot drinks 24/7, with a refridge. The staff was helpful and friendly. Obviously, the location (steps from subway and Broadway and 86th st. buses) is excellent. If handicap accessibility is an issue, check with hotel, since we only saw steps up into the hotel. Plenty of nearby eateries. For groceries, we loved the Broadway Farms, down Broadway, which had an incredible selection at reasonable prices. This upper west side neighborhood is lovely and very pleasant. We loved our 3-day stay.

All (?) rooms are now modernized - and QUIET (even ones over the street) - they've made the most of their small rooms. Mattresses comfortable. Good shower. One short block to the subway and/or crosstown bus. Two things - if it's very cold out, ask for extra blankets ... their new windows need caulking! And I'd wish for a microwave in their little kitchen on each floor.

I was not expecting a huge hotel room but...the queen size bed took up most of the room. I had only one small suitcase and I had to put it in the space on one side of the bed. No chair, no desk, no closet. Two hangars. The bathroom was adequate but had no counter, just a very narrow shelf running above the sink and toilet. The bed was on a platform so there were two small drawers available. That's it. There is no way two people could share this room comfortably. I saw a couple come into the hotel one day as I was leaving. They had two small and two large suitcases. There was no way that would fit in the room and leave space to walk. There was a small coverlet on the bed at the end. It had a quarter size black stain on it. You would think they would change it after I checked in. They didn't. Just disappointed all the way around.

My husband and I booked The Belnord through Expedia last minute and for a great price! The hotel is fine, clean and quiet with a comfy bed after exploring all day. The rooms are slightly small (like most in New York) but they have been thought out well. Hanging space, safe, drawers in the bed and the bed is high enough off the floor so cases can go underneath! It is right around the corner from a subway station and a few stops takes you downtown to Times Square! We didn’t use a taxi once only the subway as it was so close and saved us a fortune! They also have a deal with a diner/bakery round the corner for breakfast which is ideal for a long day exploring! This hotel is great if you just need a break from the busy New York tourist attractions in a good location and big TVs to relax to! If you’re going to New York to sit in a hotel room (which some reviewers seem to do) then you may want a bigger room!!

The room I was given is definelty the smallest room I have ever stayed in. However it was clean and comfortable. There was very little noise so I was able to get a good nights sleep. The area is very convenient for getting around Manhattan and there is loads of nice bars and restaurants in the area. I though the guy who checked me in was not very friendly, but maybe that is just the way he is. A good place to stay if you are travelling solo to NYC for a long weekend.

Nice, clean, basic, teeny tiny room. No coffee, no frills... definitely not a luxury hotel... but suited my needs just fine. I found the staff a bit lacking in skills, but I got a good price, so whatever. They did promise me to “try to get the maid to leave coffee”, which is a lie they say every time. They shouldnt lie to guests like that, so I took off a star. They dont have coffee. There’s a shared refrigerator in hall, and a coffee maker with no coffee. Seriously, what hotel does NOT have coffee? The Belnord. Maybe they are worried about guests attracting bugs with the coffee? Who knows. You get a tiny bathroom and a bed in a room the size of the bed. I could barely get my luggage in the room, LOL! So small! There was a tv that worked. I ordered food to my room from nearby. The #1 subway train is one block away, on 86th St & Broadway. The security at this hotel is good. Nothing gets past the front desk without their knowing it. I liked staying here, despite how tiny the room was... but all I needed was to sleep. Don’t stay at The Belnord if you are claustrophobic. (Seriously.). Otherwise, a good, basic hotel room for slim people.

This hotel was a perfect location for me - on the Upper West Side of Manhattan. This is not a luxury facility. My room was fine but the large and comfortable bed took up most of the room so if my husband had been with me it would be too tight a fit. The room & bathroom were scrupulously clean. The staff was very helpful and though I was on the first floor I heard nothing.

If you are looking for a good location, reasonable price (for NY) and a clean room, this is the place. We stayed here three nights and were generally pleased. Loved the location on the upper west side close to subway and Central Park. The room was very small but we were aware of this from previous reviews and did not find it a problem but have to admit that the sink was the tiniest I have ever seen. We had daily maid service and the whole hotel appeared clean and well maintained. The room was tastefully decorated-no flowered bedspread or nasty carpet but sound proofing was lacking. Thankfully we had no noisy neighbors. Individual heating control was nice as the windows were a bit drafty. The major airline departure times located in the lobby was a nice touch. I found the front desk staff not very personable or friendly but we had no problems. We would stay here again.

The hotel is has been newly renovated but rooms are unbelievable small -- it makes some of the places I've stayed in Tokyo look like castles. We had a full sized bed. There's enough room on each side for one fit adult to move around. The bed is well designed, with cut-outs in the base for suitcases. Bathroom similarly tiny but had everything a person actually needs.

Nice little room. Very small, but it’s nYC. Want to love it, but our heater is very very loud. We can’t sleep with it running and it’s in the 30s outside. They said they could move us but the room would be smaller. Coffee station out of regular coffee and creamer this morning as well.

My partner and I laughed when we opened the door to our room for the first time and were met with a bed. Manoeuvring our suitcases proved challenging because it really is as small as humanly possible but this was really the only issue. The room was cleaned daily to a high standard, towels, good shower, hairdryer, heating, air con, a safe, small area for hanging some clothes and coffee tea and water available in the hall. Really good location for links to transport and tonnes of local places to eat. Central Park just a short walk away. Would recommend staying here if you need somewhere that you won’t be spending much time but just to sleep. Beds were very comfortable too.

Very nice location. 3min from the subway station and 6min to Central Park. Room was clean and everything was working. The only negative thing is that the room is quiet small. We had a new room and the lobby is also new. Free water and coffee are available at each floor.

The location is great. Just a block up from the subway stop at 86th and Broadway.No problems with check in but it’s the first taste you get re: how cramped everything in this hotel feels, especially at first. There isn’t much space. People traversing the lobby need to squeeze between the reception desk and the people who are usually sitting down inches from it.On the room floors, the hallways are teeny. I was given a room next to the community kitchen, which is a closet with hot coffee, tea, and water provided on every floor. There were also ironing supplies in there. I was concerned about noise but the other residents on the floor were quiet and respectful during my stay.I had a room with a private bath. The rooms are small and the in-room bathrooms are teeny! Tiniest sink ever! Nice complementary toiletries but nowhere to put your stuff.The rooms are not as small as The Jane, but small. I’m not a tall person but my feet were hanging off the edge of the bed. (My boyfriend is over 6 feet tall and would have been miserable here.) The room felt recently renovated and the decor was nice. Everything seemed clean except the bath mat. The room had a TV, mirror, alarm clock, phone, and safe (thank you!!!) No fridge. No natural light with a view facing a small alley and brick wall.Good, safe neighborhood on the Upper West Side. Recommend at the right price, which is under $100/night.

Fourth visit staying at the Belnord. We have always been pleased with the cleanliness of this hotel, along with the location. The kitchen with the coffee machine was an added treat. The rooms are very small, but all we need for our visits.

Every time I stay in New York I aim for the Upper West Side - get away from the Hustle and Bustle from Midtown and downtown.The Hotel is just off Broadway (subway is on 86th Street) so easy to access. You walk over Columbia and Amsterdam and there you are to Central Park so near.Hotel room are small - there are a few bigger one - gives you a little bit of room. Unless it is very tight. They have designed the rooms so cases can be put away under the bed. They are nicely decorated (think they had a make over) and done very tasteful. I think some of the bathrooms could do with a bit more work. A stronger Shower curtain is a definite! On each floor there is a kitchen which has a coffee/tea station which is great. Room are cleaned everyday - clean towels etc.. However, they can get to your room late, but they will take wet towels and give you clean. There are so may restaurants, diners and bars near the hotel.I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friend. If you are looking for location, this is it.

I enjoyed my two nights here and for the price, would definitely recommend. Pros: Quiet neighborhood, recently renovated rooms, well priced, beds are comfortable and rooms appear to be clean.Cons: First floor rooms seem to be above either a boiler room, heating unit, or something else that you feel vibration and noise while trying to sleep. Once I moved to a higher level floor, it wasn’t an issue. It’s definitley a no-frills hotel with very basic amenities. You can hear your neighbors each time doors are open and closed and there’s poor noise insulation. White noise app seemed to remedy this a bit though.Rooms are very VERY small. I was fine as I was by myself, but it could be very tight for couples.

We made 1 reservation for 2 rooms. 1 of the rooms had been paid for in advance.We arrived at the hotel and 1 room was ready, the other was not. This was no problem, because we arrived before noon. We asked for 2 rooms next to each other and they told us this was arranged. The receptionist swiped the creditcard and told us the payment was okay. We went to do some sightseeing and were at the evening back at the hotel.Suddenly, the rooms weren’t next to each other anymore and another receptionist said, they didn’t receive the payment of the second room. It was quite late in the evening and we were there for more than 1 hour to discuss this matter with her. She was absolutly not helpful at all and we couldn’t give us the keys to the second room. We asked if we could pay by giving in the pincode but apparently the payment device didn’t work. In all our fuzz, another tourist asked if they had any rooms available and she treated the tourist very rude! He left angry.Thank God, we finally got the keys to the room and the payment was done.The rooms were very small but okay. They had everything they needed and was clean enough. Expect no high luxury, but it’s good for a city trip. There is also a small kitchenette (more of a big closet) with some coffee or tea. There was also only room for one suitcase.The rooms are okay but the staff is not helpful if there is a problem of any kind.

Tiny room but very clean and just what is needed for sleeping in. Impressed with the kitchen, but normal tea bags would have been good for additional choice to green tea. Our toilet blocked twice whilst here but once reported was rectified the next day, slightly frustrating as we had to use a blocked toilet overnight until it was sorted the next morning. The maids are very friendly and attentive, the was one night when walking back into the hotel roughly 10pm a man on the desk who wasn’t as friendly, that when we said ‘good evening’, he looked up then then returned to his Facebook profile on the desk computer. Good location to Central Park and subway stations. Would stay here again.

The Belnord was a charming hotel in an excellent location. The room was small, but had all the necessary comforts. Every area of the hotel was spotless. Complimentary coffee, tea, and water were available on each floor. The desk assistants were friendly and very helpful. I can't wait to stay here again!

I stayed here about 5 years ago and it has really improved in terms of cleanliness and decor. It feels as if they had a European consult to maximize value with limited space. My daughter and I had bunk beds which really helped in terms of space - had more floor, could pack things under bed, had separate light and tv. Felt you could be up later without disturbing roommate. Bathroom larger than last time. I liked the coffee station down the hall, too. Location is fabulous - easy access to metro and buses and Central Park. One BIG problem was the awful wifi. You HAVE to have decent WiFi these days. Only good time was early morning. I wouldn’t return unless the had better wifi.

This is a good deal if you just need a place to sleep. And there is just one of you. The rooms are tiny. But clean and comfortable enough. The A/C works. The WiFi is terrible and cell coverage nonexistent. That was a bigger issue than room size for me. Impossible to work from the room.

Tiny but clean and well-maintained rooms and corridors in this upper West Side traveler's (not bus tourists) hotel located in a nice neighborhood. Note that the hotel has no restaurant and no handicapped access (which I and my handicapped wife didn't know until we arrived.

Cute hotel walking distance to central park and the MET and many other places. Area felt safe. Restaurants and little stores close by. Hotel was renovated and looks new. Parking just around the corner.....hotel guests get a couple bucks off and it's 24hr parking. We checked out the next morning but still got our 24hr parking. Hallways and rooms tiny....like on a cruise ship but it's NYC and you are not there to hang out in your room. Own bathroom. Wasn't noisy. Bed was a bit soft but comfortable enough. Didn't make use of coffee/tea at hotel as Starbucks was just around the corner. Hotel staff very helpful. Pointed us to a great dinner place as we arrived in the evening. NYC is very expensive but found this gem on travel site and the price was right. Free baggage storage the next day as we explored the city! Would absolutely stay here again!

Hotel is very good located just around the corner of the tube station. Room is small but clean. I was given a refurbished room which is lovely and stylish though I had to laugh when looking in to the bathroom to see that it was missed on the list for refurbishment - no lye, room was refurbished no mentioned of bathroom too lol. Unfortunately the airconditioning main unit is very loud and seamed to be right next door or ourside my winder and I could not change my room to a more quieter room when I inquired if that would be possible. The airconditioning unit did make my room vibrate but i think it was switched of during the night which i was very pleased about. The staff is not very friendly and prefere chatting to each other than attending a guest. It was nice to get free coffe, tea and water in the little kitchen unit in the hall.

This hotel was perfect for what we needed. It was clean and in a decent location. Yes the rooms are small, and there are not a lot of amenities. I did not plan on spending a lot of time in the hotel so this was perfect for what we needed.

I stayed here in July 2018 & was very happy with everything. Yes, it's small, but I was a solo traveler, and thought they did a very smart job of utilizing the space. I had all that I really needed- comfortable, clean & new looking, exceptional staff, quiet & in a good neighborhood, very close to subway & bus lines, and nearby choices of good places to eat. I did have a remodeled room & really recommend that these old pictures that I'm seeing online be removed- this is why I never came here before, as it looked so depressing. So if you're thinking the same, just make sure that you get a new room- in fact, I didn't see anything that looked like these old pictures, as I think the entire hotel has been remodeled. I did get a great price, and plan to stay here again.

This is a good hotel to stay at if you are pretty much only going to sleep there. The rooms are very small. Our room had one double bed with about a foot of space on either side. I had to put most of my belongings under the bed. The bathroom is very small as well. On the positive side, it was clean and quiet. The bed was fairly comfortable. It's in a great location, just one block from the subway and two blocks from the Milk Bar.

i never coming back .personnel no proffesional . and not polite .desagreableno answer at mails .no refund .quelle arnaque de vouloir garder les taxesthe rooms and bathrooms are smallworst hotel ever .

Economical choice hotel with six floors in a residential and safe neighborhood of Manhattan. Within walking distance to the #1 train that runs north and south making it easy to get to all the places you want to visit. Twin beds were comfortable, air conditioning worked well, water pressure was good, and smooth elevators. Small lobby, no restaurant or bar but complimentary coffee/tea/water in closet kitchenette on each floor. Staff were polite when spoken to and checked our luggage until we departed the city. Not for people who need a lot of amenities, concierge services or luxury. Great for independent and self-sufficient visitors. I would choose to sleep here again.
user_name:
Gr8LakesGirl
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This is within a couple of blocks of a subway stop. Room is small but we were out and about during the days; only there to sleep anyway. Comfy bed, very clean, coffee station conveniently located on same floor to make great a.m. coffee or nighttime tea. We slept well. It is close to Central Park too. Friendly, helpful staff. Would definitely stay there again; affordable too. Highly recommend.

We stayed at the Belnord Memorial Day weekend. What a great location, metro caddy corner to the Hotel when headed southbound, which is where most of the good stuff is anyways. One block if you are headed northbound or when getting off to head to the Belnord. Lots of cool spots nearby within waking distance. You have a Starbucks, you have a CVS pharmacy, then you have the hip and happening Jacob's Pickles (restaurant), not far on Amsterdam Ave. And it's in a very safe place on a quiet residential street. The hotel has everything you need (no pool), but a great little kitchen nook on each floor, with coffee, tea and water, done in a cute and functional way that is a nice touch for each guest. The rooms aren't wow, this isn't the Plaza. But the decor is nice and you have everything you need in the room. Small refrigerator, functional bathroom, a desk to work out, flat screen TV. And the hotel was clean, with no dirt insight.The hotel customer service was great and did a wonderful job of meeting our request for as big a bed we could have as my wife was 7 months pregnant when we were there and they did just that, we were very thankful. Thank you Belnord.The bed was very comfortable and the wifi worked great. Great price considering memorial day weekend and the location, 3 blocks from Central Park (awesome)!!. We would for sure stay here again when visiting as a couple, if you are going to bring your kids, you'll need 2 rooms. Only critic, it would be nice if there was a shower curtain, but we had handicap accessible shower and room (thus no shower curtain), I am sure the other rooms have them, so nothing big, just felt weird, but just a minor detail that doesn't impact my willingness to stay in the future time and time again. Belnord Hotel you are a great find in the great city.

This is the hotel to book If you are going to be spending a lot of time in the city and not a lot of time in your room. We booked a bunk room for my son and I are as we visited Columbia University. The room was mostly clean. His television and light did not work on the upper bunk but my reading lamp and television were fine. I tried contacting the desk but just got a busy signal. Since he wasn't into watching television and didn't need to read it did not wind up being an issue. There was hair in my bed when I tucked in for the night. It was too late to bother switching rooms when I discovered it. But pretty gross. The room itself was Tiny and clean. The bathroom is so small my tall son's knees were one inch from the wall when he sat down on the toilet! He could put one hand on the back of the shower wall and one hand on the back of the bathroom door. Super tiny! There was convenient Copy Service located on each floor. The hotel is steps away from bus and subway stations and just a couple of blocks away from Central Park. It is a lovely, walkable area and felt very safe. Since we were there to explore the city and not hang out in a hotel room, it was perfect for us. Strongly recommended but make sure you check your bed before you leave for the day so they'll have time to change your sheets if need be.

Roos in this hotel are very small. We couldn't leave suitcases open which was mildly inconvenient. Other than that this hotel was great. In a nice area, convenient to the subway, clean, staff were super friendly. Would definitely stay here again.

My daughter and I shared a Bunk Bed room here for six nights in early July. We actually loved everything about it. Yes the room and bathroom we're small but everything else was fab. Great location... clean... secure.. good service and great value. There was a free room safe and free tea and coffee making facilities. Would highly recommend if your looking for exceptional value in New York.

We didn't want to pay the outrageous NY prices... just needed a place to sleep and the Belnord fit the bill. The room was incredibly small... maybe a foot around the edges of the bed, but what the heck - it worked. Clean and the front desk was courteous. Very conveniently located for our events. You gotta love whoever you are rooming with to stay here, but it worked for us.

The rooms are small, but that’s not a problem. It’s clean and affordable. The staff wasn’t that helpful when my girlfriends glasses and contact lenses where suddenly disappeared from our room. Strange that glasses disappear. But this hotel is ok to stay, nice neighbourhood.

The hotel is located within walking distance from the Central Park, and the Museum of Natural History. It's a safe, quiet neighborhood. You hardly see any people on that street.The hotel is updated, clean and nice. Everything is tiny, though. The room is 2 feet bigger than the bed itself. There is hardly any space to store big luggage. There is a bed and two night stands in the room. It's okay for a solo traveler, or someone who spends only night in the room. My window was facing the other wall. So, it was no daylight in my room the entire time. Also, when you check in, you have to sign a paper that the hotel is not responsible for any stolen items, or your injury. The bathroom is also small. They provide shampoo and soap.There is a coffee maker in the hallway. For dining: There are a lot of dining options on the Broadway street. There are some nice bakeries one block from the hotel as well.They charge for the first day at the the time of booking. I had to cancel two weekends that I booked in advance. The girl at the front desk told me to email them, or call their reservation department. It made me worry a little bit. I thought I would have a hard time of getting my refund back. However, the entire amount was refunded within 4 business days.

LanaFom
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is literally off Broadway and near 86th Street subway and few blocks from central park. The hotel itself was adequate as a place to sleep, though the term compact and bijou is right, particularly the bathroom. The facilities were OK and suited our needs.
user_name:
A2384GFricharda
Tyne and Wear, United Kingdom

review_body: This weekend we stayed at the Belnord Hotel and we really enjoyed it...! Great Price and Excellent Location in the Upper West Side which a really nice neighborhood. It is only one block from a station of the Subway Line 1, 3 blocks from Central Park, 3 blocks from the Riverside Park and the Hudson River, and also lots of nice restaurants to choose from close by at a walking distance...! Even though the room was tiny (as in most hotels in NYC these days), it was absolute comfortable and cleaned and it seemed to be recently renovated. All the staff was really nice and friendly with us, particularly Michael Ordoñez who was very helpful with our questions or requests at all times. We traveled all night from Virginia, arriving to NYC and to the hotel at around 5 AM, and the staff, very kindly, allowed us to leave our backpacks at the hotel luggage storage room while we were going out in the city before checking in at 2 PM.We definitely recommend the Belnord Hotel and would come back again...! Thanks for a nice staying...!
user_name:
emejiamx
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The hotel was a nice surprise.To be in manhattan it is quite cheap, the position in great, near 1 subway line.The hotel is very clean and renewed, it is located in quiet place so is possible to sleep very well.I didn't gave 5 star for 3 reason:- the bed is very little, double bed is like one and a half bed on european standards- they shall put some hook on the wall in order to put dresses since room are tiny- AC was very noisy (but since I switch off during night was not big issue)Anyway highly suggested

Lovely hotel in the Upper West Side. Really nice location close to plenty of places to eat, close to subway, close to central park.Yes the rooms are small but really who goes to NYC to stay in their room?! The rooms were of really good quality, nice and clean.Absolutely excellent value for money.My only complaint is we asked the hotel to arrange a car back to JFK airport for us at the end of the trip. The hotel staff were clearly friendly with the driver and the journey cost more than we would have expected - felt like we were being a bit ripped off and would have been better off organising transport ourselves.
user_location: East Riding of Yorkshire, United Kingdom
user_name:
Rebecca T
East Riding of Yorkshire, United Kingdom

review_body: The hotel is quite basic with rather small rooms but it suits travellers who are planning on being out and sightseeing in the city. The staff here in my experience were all very helpful and friendly. The place is well kept and very clean. My only concern was that the WiFi sometimes dropped out and our WiFi code sometimes didn’t work, but the staff were able to help us with that. I would recommend this hotel, the upper west side is very residential and lovely if you are looking to stay somewhere away from the hustle and bustle of midtown.

I liked the Belnord Hotel. The rooms are small, but equivalent to what you would find in Paris for the price. It is close to the subway and the Upper West Side is a lovely neighbourhood. The reception staff have no interest in their clientele. I couldn’t even raise a ‘hello’ from some...but that was OK as it is really only the sort of hotel you sleep in; it doesn’t have a restaurant. I found the room very clean and functional. I would happily stay there again. Though note, if you like to sleep in, forget it...the walls are paper thin and the bathroom pipes from your neighbours will wake you...but it is New York so you’ll be up early anyway.

I've been staying here at least once a year for years and now that's it's updated with fresh decor throughout and the rooms outfitted with new wall coverings, contemporary lighting and new beds and mattresses, it's even more appealing. Of course the rooms are still small with bathrooms that are completely fine but that's what thsi hotel is, and the value lies in that. It's clean, friendly and convenient to transportation, Upper West side acitivities with a neighborhood feel. NOT in a tourist zone.

This is a bare bones budget hotel with very little charm or warmth and scant attention to details. Its strengths are: price, location in a quiet residential neighborhood and proximity to the subway and Central Park. The rooms are small even by NYC standards - on one stay the clearance between the bed and the doors to the bathroom and entry was about two inches. Bathrooms are a bit downtrodden but clean. WiFi is unreliable and there are no “bars” once you are inside the hotel. Pillows are NOT comfortable / even at budget prices ownership cd spring for a higher quality pillow! Just soap and shampoo in rooms, bare walls, but the price is right.

You should pay an additional attention on its booking policy. I booked a room via a 3rd party and didn't click on the 'booking policy' to read through the instructions. It was my mistake that didn't realize there's hotel that wouldn't allow you to cancel or change the order. As within 24 hours of the booking, I found I was wrong with the trip date and contacted the 3rd party to cancel the reservation. The staff at the 3rd website tried to help me, but the hotel refused the refund. It was a lesson to me. Anyway, this hotel lost me.

I visited NYC for a long weekend and stayed at the Belnord Hotel. It is small, but very neat and clean. I loved the location. I had trouble with the air conditioner, and they fixed it right away. When I needed a taxi they got one for me. But they use a car service, so it was more expensive than a taxi would have been. But other than that I would stay here again, and recommend it to others.

Great location. Nearby Central Park and close to some great museums. The people at the reception were really nice and helpfull.The room wasn't that big but for us it was more than ok. The room was very clean. Just 2 little things. We were on the grounfloor and heard a lot of noise from the streets and it was located close to the luggageroom. Also the room wasn't that dark so we used our eyecovers. But all by all can recommend this hotel

There were hairs on the bed when we arrived. The room is TINY (literally the size of the bed). There's a few inches on each side of the bed where you can wiggle by. Smallest hotel room I've ever seen. The wifi they provide is HORRIBLE. I did a speed test, and it was less than 1 MBps. It made streaming Netflix impossible. We had to set up a hotspot on our cellphones to be able to stream Netflix on our tablets. The shower goes from hot to cold every 15 seconds or so, which makes showering pretty miserable as well. A few nights into our stay, our air conditioner started making super loud noises, like a diesel engine was running in our room. When we called the front desk, they said they would see if they could open our windows to keep it cool in our room, so the AC didn't keep us awake at night. The maintenance man arrived with a screw driver, and was unable to open the window. The front desk told us their tool box was locked up and they didn't have access to the necessary tools to open the window for us. Needless to say, we had a sleepless night. When we spoke to the supervisor on duty the next day (Chris), he told us he spoke with the manager, and they were unwilling to compensate us at all for the previous night in which we had no air conditioning and were unable to sleep. The only positive thing I can say about this hotel is it's in a good location in Manhattan. I wouldn't suggest this hotel to anybody.

Just got back from an amazing 5 days in NYC. We stayed at the Belnord which was lovely. The reviews about size couldnt be truer, the room was very compact as was the bathroom. But for what we needed, it was ideal. We didn't spend much time in our room to be fair, we were out and about all the time. The room was very clean and comfortable. The tea and coffee facilities were a bit disappointing...green tea or coffee were the only options. I am glad we took hot chocolate. Apart from that the location was great, subway close by and a 10 min walk from central park.

My room was like something out of Tiny Houses: really small, but with clever design that makes it more functional than you'd expect the tight space to allow. There is barely enough room to sidestep around the double bed, but there are two little nightstands, and the bed is raised up on a platform with two drawers and large openings for luggage storage underneath. The bed was comfy (nice sheets, even!), the decor was fresh and bright, and the room was squeaky clean. My only objection is to the strong smell of cleaning products/air "freshener", especially in the hallway. It was definitely the smallest room I've ever stayed in, and there were no creature comforts such as a mini fridge or a coffee maker, but this is Manhattan, and a clean room for about $200 is hard to find. I would definitely return.

The Belnord represents a rarity in NY; an excellent hotel in a good location (safe and largely residential) and at a reasonable price. My room, though somewhat compact, was well decorated, clean and with all the facilities one generally needs. Internet was fast and reliable. Subway stop 5 minutes walk away (right outside hotel and then left at the main road). 10 minutes or so journey to Time Square and 5/10 minute walk to Central Park (left outside hotel). Airport departure display in reception - very useful.

This was our second time in New York, and we were on budget so we chose The Belnord Hotel. Staff was friendly, room was clean and big. There were multiply restaurants nearby and a little store right around the corner. The metro was around 2 minutes away, and with the metro you could reach Times square in less than 10 minutes. There was also a fridge and a coffee machine we could use for free. Excellent if you're on a budget. All in all 5/5

well the face lift is nice. It looks trendier now. The check in was terrible as I had some in the early morning (the day after) checkin date. I had emailed explaining I had booked for the day before so i could get into room right away in the morning since i was arriving on a 6am flight and didnt want to wait til 2pm to check in. I needed a shower stat! They sent me to a room that had people sleeping in it! The rooms look even smaller than I remembered. But the renovations are trendy and smart in terms of use of space. There are drawers built into the bed now and storage space under the bed. I like that they can hook you up with a SIM. Otherwise, I would probably still come back again to this hotel. It is convenient in the UWS neighborhood i always stay in.

I booked with them for 10 nights. But the day of the flight I got very sick at the airport so they had to call an ambulance and bring me to the hospital. We called the day after to explain what had happened and to ask if with sending the doctors note we would be able to change our reservation (the flight company give us all the facilities to do it). They were very rude. In the end, after five calls, I managed to talk with the manager. He says as we booked through "Booking.com" we are not their problem so they won't help us in any way. And he hang up without saying anything else. If this is how they treat their clients, I'm more than happy to never book again with them. It's a shame how some people can be so unempathetic

My husband and I booked into the Belnord after an AirBnb experience fell through. So we booked same day. This resulted in a great rate and it was also a time of year when rates are lower overall. As other reviewers have noted, the rooms are small and not luxurious. However everything is clean and tidy, maid service is attentive, and the Upper West side location just off of Broadway and one block from the subway is ideal.But it was the added thoughtful amenities that were amazing for a hotel of this size. Each floor has a mini kitchen with a coffee/espresso machine, teabags, creamer etc. And a small fridge where guests can keep leftovers. This saved buying breakfast out most days -- a true savings. This was better than in room coffee makers because there was no running out of supplies or clean up involved. There is also a basement area with ice machine and vending and a luggage storage room where you can store your bags until your flight time or until check in. The staff were unfailingly friendly and helpful.We will definitely stay again and recommend to others.
user_name:
Betsy D
Marina del Rey CA

review_body: Well designed postage stamp size room with drawers and room for luggage storage under the bed. Shared coffee and tea area with fridge was an excellent amenity. Staff mixed, some very friendly but the guy on night shift was gruff.

Room was extremely small, as all the reviews already suggest. But what was important is that it was clean, smelt good and was a warm, comfortable place to put our head down after a busy day in NY. We were literally getting back to the hotel and heading straight to bed.Easily accessible via the 1 (red line) from all tourist destinations such as times sq, ground zero and the Statue of Liberty. Well connected to other lines for access to JFK, Empire State, Rockerfella etc. Also walking distance to Nat His museum and Central Park.If you want a break from the city centre, some really good, cheaper than central, independent restaurants to the hotel, incl all different cuisine from Thai, Japanese, Italian, Southern food etc. Hotel let us securely store our luggage due to late night flight. Also free coffee / green tea.Stayed in rm 111

We enjoyed our stay at the belford.. The staff was accomodating and helpful It was close to the subway, so we got around easy. The rooms are small but for the price and where we were it was worth it. I would stay here again.

Although a little further out from mid town there is a subway right outside which takes you straight down to Times Square or as far as South Ferry. Plus the walk down Broadway or through Central Park only takes about 30-40 minutes. Hotel is clean and warm. Free coffee on each floor and free wifi. Hotel rooms have TV and bathroom some have sofas but nothing else. Plenty of food places close by ( Hot n Crusty offer a breakfast deal for guests). Thete is also Starbucks, City Diner and Big Daddy's Diner in walking distance and a CVS on the corner of 86th Street. If looking for cheap and basic but safe and clean then this is a good option.

The price was pretty high, so likely I wouldn't stay here again. The rooms were nice quality though, just small, but that's normal for the city. I liked the location. Close to many restaurants and shopping.
user_name:
MowMia
New York City, New York

review_body: Me and my partner traveled here in January for a 7 night stay. Was a little bit worried as we had seen a few negative reviews. However, the hotel was brilliant! We had a bunk bed room and was a lot bigger than expected. Also there is space under the bed to leave cases which is handy. Also think that it is great that there are tea and coffee making facilities on every floor. Staff are very friendly and helpful. One night the floor in a room was vibrating so told staff and they explained that it was because of airconditiong which would stop shortly, but still offered us the possibility to change rooms which was a big help! Great location, 24h shop and subway on corner. The only negatives I could say would be that sometimes the buildings aircon is noisy but tends to turn off after a while. Also, pillows are a little soft and we also had a few bug bites, which is what other reviews have said so not sure if from hotel or not... We would definitely stop here again, thanks to all the staff at Belnord!

We stayed at the Belnord for a quick weekend trip to NYC. I love the fact that it is renovated. The rooms are small and quaint. The room size didn't bother us at all as we spent our time enjoying the sites of the city. Besides, its NYC! A lot of the hotels have smaller rooms unless you are willing to pay several hundreds of dollars for space. The hotel is located on a quiet street just off of Broadway and is within walking distance to shopping, dining, an AMC movie theater, and the subway. It is a 2-3 star hotel so don't expect a whole lot of amenities outside of the free water, tea, and coffee located on every floor. The wifi is free and available in every room. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. We will definitely be staying here on our next trip to NYC.

We stayed four nights in a bunk bed room, the hotel was very clean, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the neighborhood was lovely. Be warned the the room is approximately the size of, or smaller than an interior cabin on a cruise ship, but the price is right for a hotel room in NYC with a private bathroom. We would definitely stay here again!

2 of us Stayed for a week in a bunk bed room! Beds were really comfy and had a good nights sleep! Room is small but there is a plenty of storage under the bed for suitcases etc. There is tea/coffee facilities on each floor which is a nice touch. Reception staff are usually friendly , maybe except an older man which always seemed grumpy! Overall excellent quiet location, with 2 mins walk to 86th subway, clean and cheap ! Would definitely go back !

Belnord is a small, European style hotel on Broadway and 87th. The subway for up and down town is at 86th, which makes getting around NYC easy. The staff were courteous and helpful. Rooms are quite small. We had a queen size bed with bathroom. The bathroom is definitely made for one person. It was very clean and quiet. There is an agreement with a restaurant across the street for breakfast. Ten dollars gets you a hot breakfast of eggs, a variety of toasts, hash browns, coffee, and juice. We have stayed twice now and will certainly stay again.

This hotel was a great find at a great price. We stayed in the twin room with a private bathroom. The room was clean with good heating, comfortable beds and the bathroom, while small had a good shower. Due to the small size of the room, there is no coffee maker but communal kitchen facilities down the hall. Traffic and street noise could be heard in the room but it wasn't overly loud. While not in the main tourist area of the city, the hotel is well located with the 86th St station minutes walk away and only a short train ride to downtown. The area felt safe, with a few grocery stores within walking distance. The staff were friendly and the free wifi was very helpful. I would definitely stay here again if I am ever in New York.

We arrived and booked in, after travelling fro South Africa, 16 hours on the plane. We were sent to our room which was small but clean and functional, so we thought. However the idea that the staff are helpful is a misnomer. When we had unpacked, I started looking for a suitable plug to charge my cellular phone, the two prong round type which is a standard fixture in every hotel room that I have ever stayed in. There was nothing in existence, so I went down to the reception to ask for an adapter. They dug through a couple of drawers and said that they had run out, but I could buy one from the hardware store just down the road. Sorry, but I find it unacceptable that a hotel expects to attract visitors from overseas, and then tells you that you have to buy adapters for the most basic items. So please be warned that the rooms are small, but the management are not prepared to invest what must be an insignificant amount to make sure that your stay is enjoyable. I have come to New York City for the first time in 20 years and this hotel makes me wish that I hadn't come.
user_name:
Roger Paul M
Johannesburg, South Africa

review_body: It's my second time at Belnord hotel within a three months period. I was quite impressed by the front desk employees as they remembered my previous stay and gave us a very nice room on the sixth floor. The location is great as you literally walk out of the hotel and in to the subway. We have chosen to use the bus to get and leave N.Y. and the fact that you take the 1 line from Port Authority right at the hotel is very convenient. Withing walking distance to Central Park and to major museums, great restaurant around and 24hour store around the corner. Coffee, Tea, Water is complimentary provided at each flour and the most important of all free unlimited Wi-Fi usage. We feel like being hosted by good friends. We recommend it to all and will be back for sure. Thank you!

Great location. Rooms are small but very comfortable and clean. The staff is helpful and very pleasant. I love the variety of room that are offered (Bunk bed Room, Twin Beds Room, etc...) I will stay here every time I visit New York!!

We stayed there 4 night.Perfect location,very helpful staff,nice and clean room.we had a little room but comparing we are in NYC it was fine .Really reasonable prices We would definitely going back at some point,love that

First of all the hotel is perfectly located just off Broadway on the Upper West Side, with the 86th Street subway station just a minutes walk away. The room was clean and well-kept, but very tiny. The bed was big and comfortable, air condition worked beautifully. The free wifi was fine during the day, but very slow at night and in the mornings. Bathroom and its facilities was clean, but extremely small. Staff was very nice and helpful!Overall I was happy with my stay here, especially since it was my wish to spend as little money as possible. Would definitely consider staying here again, if I ever were to visit NYC on a low budget again.

Great location we like Upper West Side, clean, only 1 elevator but it's a small hotel so no problem, staff was nice. But room was very small, bathroom was smallish hot water took a while to get there but there was plenty when it did, so room was small but clean and we weren't there except to sleep- so overall very nice. Oh- you do have control over the ac/ heating unit which was very nice as I like to sleep cool, and I could open window some.

Excellent location, clean hotel and helpful staff. Rooms are super tiny - just a bed practically, but there is a bathroom and shower. Everything is tiny, hallways are narrow - they made use of every inch of the space. Hot water/tea and coffee are available on the each floor - this is very nice.Overall, it is a good budget option on Upper West side, especially for a short visit.

Super small but clean and well kept rooms. Awesome location, in a safe neighborhood (traveling as a single female). I love that they have a fridge on each floor to offset some food costs. I would stay here again for sure.

We were here at this hotel for a quick trip meeting friends for 3 nights. Rooms are smaller in size but we were only there to sleep and change. So much to see in the city that we were not there to sit in a large room. Very clean, very quiet and staff was very helpful. Wifi works good. Location was near a subway station, 2 blocks tops and a Starbucks just around the corner. It's all about location, cost and cleanliness when we travel. Otherwise, you are just there to enjoy the city.

This was our second stay here, it is around the corner from a subway station giving you access to anywhere in Manhattan, there are some great bars on the Upper West side, like the "Dead Poet" on Amsterdam, giving you plenty of choice for locations to eat and drink. Just around the corner is a great place to have breakfast "Café 82" - 2282 Broadway, fantastic service, tasty food (the corned beef hash is really tasty) and lots of locals eating here with good prices.
