We stayed five nights at this hotel on the Upper West Side. Our main reason for chosing it was location, proximity to transport links and price. The rooms are comfortable but very small. Fine for a place to lay your head, but not to linger or relax in. Having said that it was easy to access most tourist attractions and the nearby Amsterdam Avenue was full of reasonably priced bars and restaurants.Also when we had a problem with Wifi, we were moved to another room where it was better. Good customer service

Hidden away on the north side of the street between Amsterdam and Broadway on West 87th Street, the Belnord Hotel has been renovated to a fare-thee-well. It appears that the renovation is fairly recent, and all stylish finishes were used. The room was small, but had most of the amenities. There was a coffee machine and refrigerator in the hall lounge. I had a single room with queen bed. There was no desk, dresser, or chair. There were drawers in a small cabinet under the bed. Closet and bathroom were small, but well appointed and adequate. Front desk was courteous and helpful. Building interior was clean and new looking. Location was great, near American Museum of Natural History, Central Park, shopping on Broadway. local Broadway #1 subway at 86th Street, and express stop for #2 and #3 subways at 96th Street and 72nd Street, and Columbia University and Barnard College at 116th Street. The nightly rate during mid-November was about one third less than the other large hotels in the area. The Hotel calls itself a "boutique hotel," although it has around 120 rooms. I understand that the hotel is managed by personnel of Greek heritage who have attractive pictures of Greece on the walls and a Greek directory of New York in the hall. The Belnord has apparently been discovered by young, visiting foreigners since I heard several languages while there. All-in-all a very pleasant stay.

Hotels in Manhattan are expensive, so finding a hotel in a good location in New York City which is clean and of a decent quality standard at a reasonable price is going to have some trade-offs. The Belnord Hotel location is an excellent in that regard, it is located in the middle east side of Manhattan (Hudson river side), which is a good standard and safe residential area and the hotel is surrounded by of variety of shops and decent quality restaurants, and most importantly access to the New York Metro 1 line (Underground), which for $3 can take to you the tip of Manhattan's financial district, to Times Square/Penn Station or into Harlem and Bronx in the other direction. The hotel is a few blocks walking distance to central park and is perfect for you are into exploring and experiencing NY by walking the city streets.I found the Hotel staff to be friendly and helpful, the hotel can arrange fixed rate taxi service and a considerably cheaper shuttle service from the hotel to the NY airports. Used the shuffle service, the driver was friendly and funny, The latest room checkout is by 12 noon, however, you can store your luggage securely at the hotel should you have a late flight.So the location is spot on for tourists, staff are friendly, the trade-off with the Belnord is the size of the hotel rooms, which are tiny, but thankfully the rooms do come with their own bathrooms, and we found our room and bathroom to be perfectly clean, with linen and towels changed daily. For us this is an acceptable trade-off given price and location, as all we needed the hotel for was for a bed and shower for our sightseeing visit of New York City, but if you are after a larger hotel room, perhaps you need a desk to work at for business, you should consider other hotels but you'll pay considerably more per night if they are within the Manhattan borough, or alternatively you take a trade-off of staying outside of Manhattan Island and getting more bang for your buck hotel wise but be willing to commute in. The Hotel provides free Wifi, the access code changed every day, it worked fine. Just on the lack of desk for business users in the hotel rooms, there is a small business centre in the hotel which didn't look practical to work at, however, it is worth noting we saw many New Yorkers using their local Starbucks as a mobile desk to work at, so that could be a good alternative if you are visiting on business.As I said earlier in this review, within a couple of blocks of the Belnord Hotel are a good variety of restaurants and shops, I recommend the Han Dynasty for good quality Chinese meals, Big Daddies for American Dinner food, French Roast for quality French food and Mermaid Inn for seafood. Baked by Mellisa and Hot & Crusty do a decent pizzas, sandwiches, and cakes as well. With the Metro station being located within a block of the hotel, it means you can travel anywhere in Manhattan for $3, Hell's Kitchen is the best area to find quality places to eat in New York, but avoid eating in or around Times Square.These days New York is a perfectly safe city, even Harlem, thanks to the army which is the NYPD. There are chancers knocking around, esp. in tourist spots like Times Square and Battery Park, but just walk with a sense of purpose and never show any weakness, and you'll be just fine.

The Belnord is a clean, functional hotel in a decent location for getting around Manhattan. Close to the park, and just around the corner from a subway station, this is a great place to stay if you don’t need luxurious accommodation but just want somewhere reasonably priced in NYC. Cafe 86 around the corner on Broadway does great, cheap breakfasts too.

We would definitely stay here again, it is located in a perfect area steps from a ton of awesome organic restaurants, so many we could not try them all. And some fun shopping also and a quick walk to Central Park for a beautiful stroll. The hotel is immaculate, both the room, bathroom, and even the basement. The staff is nice and helpful. Only downside is the room is very tiny, basically a comfy queen bed and a sideways walk around it. And ours had a view of a brick wall but that was fine because we were not there to spend time in the room. But for the price it was worth it. The bed was high enough where you could easily scoot your open suitcase under it like a drawer. There was also a small closet and safe. We were in town for the marathon and chose it for it's easy location walking distance from the end.

Average for New York, small full bedroom with tiny attached bath. It was very clean and small doesn’t bother me because I’m out on the town. Only need a bed, bath and heat/AC when in the city. Very close to the park. Friendly service.

With a limited budget but still want a hotel room with en-suite bathroom, I chose Belnord Hotel. I stayed here for 8 days alone for a 2-people room. It is a small room but fair enough given the price. The place is clean with helpful staff. It's located in a residential area but still close to tourist attractions as the subway station nearby. Every morning, I could choose whether I'd like to do jogging at Hudson River greenway or Central Park. It's surrounded by coffee shops, restaurants, Barnes and Noble book store, convenient stores, Tj Maxx, Banana Republic, etc.

I wanted an inexpensive hotel room just for me to sleep in for two or three nights and I was interested in experiencing the upper West Side. The Belnord turned out to be a great choice. I stayed in a bunk bed room. It was very clean with a really big, marble-tiled bathroom. I slept in the bottom bunk, the mattress was fantastic and the bed linens were of good quality. There was a small flat screened TV and electrical outlets for charging / using devices in each bunk. I would not have enjoyed the top bunk, it was too close to the ceiling and the ladder would have been a pain in the middle of the night. I'm sure it would be perfect for a child or teen. It's close to the subway and there's a very nice bakery one block away called Kirsh, on Amsterdam.

My husband and I stayed at the Belnord, it's located with-in walking distance of major attractions and subway stations to get you to the places that are farther out. Our room was very clean and very quite. The room was small but comfortable. We would definitely stay at the Belnord Hotel again.

A little bit small but okay for one person.The price is pretty high but at least it's clean and comfortable. The location is super! Metro-Station is 50m near the Hotel and a lot of other facilities like Banks, Starbucks and Restaurants nearby.

Excellent place to stay. Small but very clean and excellent place. Conveniently located, walked to all major attractions. Highly recommend this to anyone, especially those without kids. Will definitely stay there again.

I really liked my stay at Belnord Hotel. My modern double room was small, but perfect for one person with a back-bag, quiet, very clean, and with a small private bathroom and a comfy bed. The hotel is situated in a very nice neighbourhood in Upper West Side, one block from a subway station and 3 blocks from the Central Park. Grocery shops, cafes and restaurants are close. If you need a basic hotel mainly for sleeping in NYC, it's perfect for you.

It a nice Hotel. The price its good. Its good ubícate if you what to stay in the upper side of Manhattan. The rooms are so small, it its the only bad point that we have for the Hotel. The service is good.

I live in Houston and my trip was scheduled for August 30 it was exactly the week that we had a hurricane Harvey here in Houston. Because of the hurricane my flight was canceled not one but two times I try to buy tickets to fly another day even knowing that I was losing one or two days in New York but it was impossible because the airports were closed and It was not possible to complete the purchasing even through here through Expedia. I was not able to drive to Dallas or Austin to try to get a plane from there because I live in the area here in Houston that was completely flooded so unless I had a boat to go out of my house I could not leave my house we had 3 to 4 feet of water in the street. So I received back my refund for my plane ticket, I received back a refund from a ticket (non refundable)festival that I bought to go in New York . But Expedia wasn't able to give me a reply saying that I would receive my refund from the hotel, not even partial refund or not even a credit to go in and either weekend. it was the first major situation it was a hurricane I was locked inside my house and I have nothing as a possibility to go out I did not cancel my trip my airline cancel my trip because of the hurricane so the minimum that I was hoping from up hotel expensive like this one is understanding the situation and help me to receive something back because this was not cheap. So yes I am extremely disappointed.

The location is perfect. Really close to the Central park and the main attractions. Rooms is not big but equipped with all necessary things. They have no one cafe but around you can find a lot of it. The staff is friendly and like to help.

I picked up friends from this hotel. There are 2 staircase into the hotel. Initial observations, it was recently painted. Room was small, limited space for suitcase. Closet, reminded me of school locker. Shower and toilet in one are, very small.Location, 87th street, near Broadway, one Street from the 86th street Subway (train) station, the M104 bus, and the M86 crosstown bus. Within walking to the Museum of Natural History on Central Park West.
user_name:
Ita49
New York City, New York

review_body: Bad: The hotel is on a busy street so sleeping after 8.00 was difficult due to noise from construction and transport. Air conditioning in the hotel corridors made the temperature really, really cold. The personnel was not smiling and not very friendly. Good: Free coffee/tea, free water, free wifi. Safe in the room. Good and free room service. Good spacious shower. Good television. Very clean.

I have travelled for business and pleasure for over 30 years,both in the USA and internationally.The room in the Belnord the past 4 nights was by far,the smallest i have ever stayed in!!!It was soo small that we had to turn sideways to get around the bed.Seriously!!!For small,the bathroom out did the bed room.The sink was tiny and to spit out my mouth wash,i had to turn my head sideways,otherwise it would hit the floor.Crazy!!The only thing the Belnord has going for it is: it was very clean and its location on the West Side near the 86th st station.If you have to pay more for a room,i would suggest you do it,because there rooms are dreadfully small

The Belnord is a boutique style hotel that looked like it had been recently renovated. The desk clerk was cordial and efficient at my very late check-in. The room as well as the bathroom was very clean and the bed was comfortable. The room was extremely spartan - absolutely no extras and only the essentials. No microwave, fridge, coffee maker, or ironing board. Not even any informational literature about the hotel, available services, or the businesses in the area. Not even a bible for those so inclined. Wooden floors with a very narrow desk table and a bedside table. Good-sized TV with plenty of channels; but no channel guide. The room wasn't spacious; but large enough for 1 or even 2 people. The Belnord I thought was very affordable for New York City with good value and is located in the quieter Upper Westside where hotels are few. Two subway stations are close to the hotel - the Broadway line just around the corner and the 1,2, and 3 lines a 2 1/2 block walk to Central Park West. Plenty of restaurants and stores on Broadway and especially on Amsterdam. Nice area to stroll around and I found it to be safe to do so even at night. The desk staff were all courteous and helpful. Michelle spent about 20-25 minutes trying to help me print off a boarding pass from the IPAD in the lobby and when that was unsuccessful she phoned the airline for help. A computer terminal is available for a $2 an hour charge; but WiFi is available in all rooms. The hotel has no restaurant or bar. Overall would I stay here again? - yes I probably would as my stay was pleasant and the hotel provided good value - somewhere between budget and mid-range.

Stayed here for a week earlier this year for my birthday. The hotels in a perfect location in a nice neighbourhood. Far enough away from the business of time square but only a short subway ride from any where you want to go! Only a very short walk to the subway too! Some great bars and restaurants in the area and not too pricey! The rooms are a little small but for just sleeping and getting ready its ideal. Room was very clean and the maids came in every day. Perfect place to stay on a budget!

The Belnord is a great hotel for its price. With Central Park on one side and Riverside Park on the other side only a short walk away, it is located in a relatively calm area while still being very close to downtown (only a 10 minute subway ride). The staff was very kind and the hotel has everything you need if you are the kind of person that loves exploring the city. I would definitely go here again.

We were so impressed with this little gem! The location is perfect and the room is more than enough for a few nights in NY. Very clean and coffee and water and fridge avaliable on your floor. Room is sufficient size, bathroom clean. Overall wonderful stay!! Will definitely recommend and would love to stay there again!!!

Spent a week here. It's not cheap but is probably one of the cheaper Manhattan options without sacrifice to cleanliness or opting for a hostel proper. For the same money elsewhere in the world you could say the hotel was under average due to the small room sizes, lack of storage space, the fact there's only a vending machine for food or drink, or the inexperienced staff. However, for Manhattan this does the job. Locationwise it sits on a quiet street within the safe, Jewish area of Upper West Side, one block from the subway station on 86th street (red line - fantastic for trips downtown), and in close proximity to a number of delis and pizza joints and the larger chain stores on Broadway. The staff generally had a poor grasp of English and gave vague responses to questions however other than trying to get them to order us a cab (just hail one instead) there were no real concerns. The rooms were clean and the cleaners were friendly, just remember to tip at least $2 on your bed each day. The view was typical; a dark alleyway, but what can you expect? There was wear and tear on the bathroom fittings but no functional issues. The cramped room was not too unbearable thanks to the superb AC and a large TV. If you can bare staff facetiming their friends whilst using naughty words rather than greeting you or holding the door open for you with your suitcases, then I think you'll find this place does the job, nothing more nothing less.

Booked for 3 nights. Had heard a lot about how small the rooms are but didn't realize how small they REALLY are until I checked in! The receptionist greeted me with "Our small rooms are very small but they are upgraded".Other than the tiny rooms, everything else is great here. Clean, updated rooms with clean bathrooms. Room service is prompt and courteous. They have a free coffee machine. Subway is just one block away and you can get to midtown using LYFT or UBER for $5. If travelling alone or with just one more person, this place fits the bill. Otherwise, I would look elsewhere. Oh, and Wifi is VERY slow.

I wanted to stay in NYC for 3 nights and i didn't want to spend a fortune. The Belnord fit the bill for me. The room we stayed in was on the first floor and was 8"x10". Small, but it had the essentials for us- a bed, a bathroom with a shower, cold A/C, a TV and night tables. What else could you need? There was one window- but it didn't provide any light or view of the outside. It was in close proximity to another building. The hotel is clean and nice. They were actually painting portions of the lobby when we were there and our room was clean and nice. It is very close to the subway, the entrance to the downtown subway was right across the street. I think we used this "1" subway to get everywhere we needed to be!There are may restaurants and shopping nearby. It's a great location if you want to be away from the crazy busyness of Times Square. There was a 24 hour CVS right around the corner, so very convenient. It is also very close to Central Park. We walked through Central Park to get to the Guggenheim and it was a nice walk. I highly recommend this hotel and we would stay here again.

Location of this hotel is very good. Around the corner on Amsterdam Ave. are great restaurants with outdoor seating and good food.Should you bring your car ask the clerk for a discount ticket for a underground garage around corner. Finding a street parking space is very difficult. The hotel it self is typically NYC. Our room was very small and so was the bathroom. But it was very clean, the beds were comfortable, the pillows nice and soft.We and a lot of other guests had issues with the room keys. They would not unlo k the doors. They would give us new cards which did not work either. We were on key card #5 when we gave up. A maintenance man came and opened the room for us. The hotel loony is in the middle of being renovated. It's a bit of a mess.But they had a "kitchen" on each floor were we got free coffee, tea etc. Should I ever go to NYC again I probably will stay there again. Not bad at all.

We have visited NYC every few months for many years, usually staying at an in law 's apartment. This time we stayed at the inexpensive Belnord and we were not disappointed. Very clean, great location near the 1 subway, it was surprisingly quiet with extremely comfortable mattress es. High volume and popular hotel with good reasons. Recommended as you wouldn't spend any time in your room other than sleeping and showering.

Great little hotel with a wonderful location. Close to major subway lines and a Citi Bike dock out front. Room was clean, tiny, but adorable. Will recommend this hotel to friends and family looking for an NYC hotel!

Located in a nice neighborhood on the upper west side, the Belnord is a small hotel with VERY small rooms. It was clean and the bed was comfortable BUT the room is tiny, the bathroom is even SMALLER. Miniscule closet is just wide enough for the built in safe, so nothing can hang down very well, no iron or ironing board, and even the hallways are so narrow - almost like being on a small boat. Outdoor noise was a sleep factor.

The Belnord is a modern hotel, the rooms are redecorated. The mattresses are very comfotable. But the rooms are very small. The bathroom and the room are very clean. The bathroomtowels are soft and cosy. The hotel has a very good location, just arround the corner you 'll find the subway.

The hotel has been totally refurbished. The chraming staff are very helful;we had a great stay. The roms are small, clean and excellent supply of hot water. Every floor has a small kitchen, delicious coffee pods and quality teas are free. The location is absolutely superb, just one block from the metro, cross-town 86th street buses, in particular to 'museum mile', and buses almost at the door. Plenty of cafes and restaurants in the area. Excellent value indeed, will certainly book next visit

The Belnord is the best of the many rehabilitated single room occupancy hotels that once were common on the Upper West Side. It has been thoroughly renovated but the outlines of its former life are plainly visible: very narrow hallways, one elevator, and tiny rooms. But the rooms have been cleverly designed to pack a lot into a small space:Comfortable platform beds feature storage drawers, closets replaced by wall hooks, well-equipped bathrooms with fluffy towels, etc.For a short stay in NYC,It is a good choice if you're trying to save money. Location is terrific at 87th and Broadway, one block from the #1 Subway line and all Broadway buses. If you can get a room on the back of the building, you will have no view -- but will enjoy a pretty quiet night. One drawback: the plumbing is all new, but you can hear toilets flushing throughout the place if you're a light sleeper.
user_name:
Gardensalot
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The hotel staff did not manage to locate and keep safe for me my iPad charger during the 9 hours between my check out and the time I came back for it before leaving the city. I checked out at 8:45, when for a meeting, realized I left my charger behind, called the hotel, received assurances that everything will be taken care if. I returned 9 hours later, before catching my train back home and ... my charger was not at the reception desk and no one knew where it was. 9 hours were not enough to accomplish this task! After waiting for 20 minutes I had to leave for the train station. Later that evening I received a call from the hotel, informing me that the charger had been found. Now I have to send a self-addressed prepaid envelope to Belnord to get my charger back! I have no words to express my rage. I have never seen a level of service that low.

Finding a double room under $200 in manhattan raises some concern, but the belnord had good reviews so I gave it a shot. I'm glad I did. Staff was so friendly and accommodating, rooms were impeccably clean and the updates were spectacular. Even had a filtered cold water dispenser right on the floor. Yes the room is small, but good luck finding a bigger one without costing an arm and a leg. Plus I go to New York not to spend room in my hotel room so as long as there is a bed and is clean that is all I need. The Belnord was this and then some. Will be staying again and even refer them to my friends and family.

I was there alone and I had a big surprise. Even if the room is pretty small, it's clean and nice. Shower is good and the staff are very friendly and willing to help you. Specially a young guy on the front desk that I forgot his name (Starts with T) is so attentive and kind...they help you with recommendations around the hotel and deal with you about transport to the airport. I'd like to say thank you to this guy...

Our room was very small. You had to close the door to get around the foot board of the bed. Perfect location to walk to the park and subway. Hotel staff was friendly and rooms are clean. Had a cute drink on outside patio.

My sentiments reflect those of many prior posters. These rooms are small, probably starting at around 250 sq ft, with little space for hanging clothes. There are drawers in the closet and under the foot of the bed, and there's a safe. There is AC, which works very well, and surprisingly for an older building such as this, it's not a wall unit, it's central air/heat with an electronic thermostat. There a nice HD TV, but no radio or interface for a phone or Ipod (if anyone still has an Ipod). It's in a residential area on 87th St., so it's away from the Midtown energy. This may be a positive or negative depending on what one seeks in NYC. The 1 Train is a short block to the south, and will quickly get you to the Times Square/42nd St. stop, where you'll be in the middle of the action! For you runners out there, one lap around Central Park is 6.1 miles.Hotel is very clean, newly renovated, and the staff is very polite. Wi-fi is a bit slow, if that's important, but I'm an old bloke who doesn't really care about that one way or the other. The basic room may be cramped for two, but for a solo traveler it works fine. Many restaurants are close by, and again, if you want more, the subway is but a short walk away. It's also just a few blocks west of Central Park, and east of the Hudson, both with many great monuments.Tip: If flying thru JFK, use the Long Island Railroad to Penn Station, connecting to the 1 Train. LIRR is fast, reliable (this summer check their site, construction at Penn Station may severely impact schedules) and clean, and $7.25 off-peak to/from JFK with only one stop between. Subway is fun, but LIRR is more direct (18 minutes vs. 38 for Metro).Enjoy your summer, fellow travelers!

The rooms are small, but very clean and updated. For such a low price, it was perfect for what we needed. We drove into the city and were able to get the discounted parking rate at a garage they are affiliated with. Staff was friendly and the location was walking distance to everything we needed.

Small unpretentious hotel with very small rooms and baths. Even the hallways are unusually narrow. The room was tidy although the TV was mounted on the wall near the ceiling. Staff was friendly. A decent value for a simple night's stay.

Basically it's all in there, rooms are small but nice and very clean. Staff is helpful until there is a problem. Location is great for the Upper West Side which basically has no regular hotels above 66th Street. Wifi is completely unpredictable. Worked great the first night (a Friday, used Netflix ). Worked fine Saturday afternoon (VPN to work network) Late Saturday - too slow to work, too slow for Netflix, can't post pictures to Facebook etc.First call - answer was wifi is working. 2nd answer was reboot your device. Went downstairs to show the Speedtest app results on iPhone and iPad. First answer - it's working for me. 2nd answer - there is a problem on the 2nd floor ( I am on 5th). 3rd answer - We called in the problem they are coming in the morning. Last answer - its a complimentary service, you don't pay for it so we don't guarantee it.I suspect the staff streams themselves and uses up the bandwidth. I've never seen test like this so skewed to better upload than download speed. April 22nd tests
user_name:
Scarborough_nyc
New York City, New York

review_body: The rooms are really small - - you can hardly find space for a couple of suitcases on the floor. But staff is friendly and rooms are clean. Belnord is located in a quiet street. Good location - close to subway.

Rather late on the review, but figured a late review is better than no review. The rooms are indeed small, but are clean and well kept as well as the hotel itself. Easy check in and check our with friendly and attentive staff. Great location-- quiet and very nice area in the upper West side and only steps away to the metro with a short 10-15 min trip down to times square area. Would definitely stay here again.

I was delighted with my stay. True,the spaces are small (I had a bunk bed), but it was very clean, the bed was comfy, the covers just right. It is just off Broadway. Very convenient. I highly recommend it.

Driving down from New England we arrived at the hotel . i was pleasantly surprised . The room may be small but it was fully renovated from floor to ceiling . the check in was quick and professional. A couple of blocks away from central park and museum of natural history . In the other directions is broadway with many restaurants and the Famous Zabars .Great area and a easy commute to midtown either by subway or buses . Will i stay here again OF COURSE This hotel is affordable and very clean. there was a area on each floor that had coffee mini frig open 24 hours

It has been a longtime goal of ours to go to New York. We finally managed, but with an expensive trip like this we made sure to find a fine hotel at a nice price.The room was a bit small, but not too small. Very New York'esque from what we gathered. Comfortable bed and stay, good service and above all very easy to reach. Just what we expected from the pictures.Thank you Belnord Hotel!

This cute hotel is well situated on the Upper East Side, close to Broadway and all its lovely shops and restaurants, with in walking distance to Central Park and many Museums.The rooms are small, but very clean. The staff are friendly and most accommodating.We really enjoyed our stay, prices were very reasonable.
user_name:
Pat P
Kempton Park, South Africa

review_body: I've stayed in small room hotels before and so it wasn't the size that annoyed me it was the fact that there was no real storage space. Imagine a room with a bed in it...the bed has approximately 18 inches around it...and that's it...two bedside tables. Suitcases go under the bed and clothes go in the cupboard without any real shelving...it's all a bit haphazard. Toilet and bathroom is small. So if you're staying any length of time you'd better get organised. I rolled up my jeans and put them on the window ledge...it served as a shelf. No coffee or tea making facilities. The coffee machine in the lobby was broken for all 6 days of our stay but thankfully there was a 24 hour deli across the road that could provide drinks. The hotel is nicely situated near the subway and it's a wallk to the park. The staff were friendly but the rooms often didn't get done till after 3.00 which is rather late if you get back early and find the maid in the room. This hotel is not cheap...it's less expensive than the opposition but if you buy a metro card you can go uptown and get better value. Airbnb is where I'll go next even if it means a bit of extra travelling from uptown. This was not a pleasant stay...it was functional and nothing more. The wifi is free but was dreadfully slow. On one bright note the room is clean...so if alll you want is a clean bed in a tiny room you're OK...but if you want more than that you'll need to go elsewhere.
user_name:
F5070GNtomb
Cape Town Central, South Africa

review_body: I recently stayed at Belnord based on reviews & pricing. Well you get what you pay for. This hotel is horrible!! Out of a four night stay my hotel room was cleaned twice. When I asked to get my room cleaned the maid complained about not having lunch??? I then asked for clean towels & sheets at least. When I checked in the clerk said he was giving me an upgrade to a double room...ummm my reservation states I paid for a double room. I will NEVER stay here again nor do I recommend this hotel....look at HOTEL NEWTON.

This was a very good, limited frills hotel for not very much money on the Upper West Side. Pros: nice renovations, comfortable bed, nice staff, clean, inexpensive for Manhattan, great location--close to subway & easy to get to everything. Cons: tiny window looks out onto a brick wall, you can hear your neighbors, the closet doesn't have a space that will let you hang a dress or full length pants. In-between: very small space. I'm a fan of the Yotel chain with their tiny rooms, so I wasn't put off by the size but it is SMALL. I liked it a lot, though, and would definitely stay here again as long as I was by myself, or with someone I could stand a whole lot of togetherness with.

I absolutely loved the hotel.Even though I booked the not-renovated room, when I arrived to do the check in I was offered the renovated room complimentary as I was staying 8 days. I was pleased with the services offered, with the size of the room and the restroom, with the design of the hotel, the fact that they have a kitchen at each floor where you can get complimentary coffee, tea and water. The hotel is located in a very safe area on 87tst, just one minute away from the 1 subway. I came from the airport with the subway so it was perfect. The hotel is just 3 blocks away from Central Park and you can find all the shops you need in the area - pharmacy, grocery shop, banks, etc. I loved loved loved it! I would definitely go back to this hotel and recommend it to my friends.
user_name:
Diana Alis P
New York City, New York

review_body: Cons- very smallPros- awesome staff, inexpensive, safe, close to subway, good location - easy access to everything, Clean. My 10 year old daughter and I stayed for 4 nights. It was perfect for our needs. We shared a queen size bed. They also have rooms with bunk beds and 2 twins. I wish I had known that - I wasn't a fan of sharing a bed as my little girl kicks in her sleep.

I spent one night here in January 2017. Just needed a place lay down my weary head for the night on the Upper West Side. Couldn't believe I found a room for under $100, and when I did, I had low expectations that were wildly exceeded. The front-desk was friendly and efficient. The property was clean. The room was immaculate. The mattress was comfortable. The bathroom was spic-and-span with up-to-date fixtures. There was a kitchenette in the hallway with a machine that made a good cup of coffee. Make no mistake--the room was small; just enough space to navigate around the bed. And the hallways are narrow. If you're prone to claustrophobia, I'm not sure I would recommend it. But if you want a safe, clean, comfortable night's sleep at a budget price, I would highly recommend Belnord.

We stayed at the Belnord Hotel between 4th and 7th of December 2016 on a short trip to New York City. The hotel is situated roughly in line with middle of central park, so about 1 mile from the start of all the main attractions, it is close to subway and also not too far to walk. Transfer time was about an hour, we used super shuttle which we paid for in u.k. when booked trip. The hotel itself was ok, it was quite basic with no bar or restaurants, rooms were quite small but clean, also as it was away from main area it was quiet so sleeping was ok. But to be honest this type of basic hotel is all you need as you will spend most of your time out and about, so why over spend on hotel, as the savings you make can be better spent on seeing the sights of the city. Would recommend this hotel for a short city trip.

Myself and a friend stayed at The Belnord Jan 13-16, 2017 in a bunkbed room. I arrived very early (around 9AM) so couldn't check in. I could, however, check my luggage which was great. On the downside, the guy at the desk just gave me a key to go back and check the bag myself and there was no ticket so I'm not sure how secure that is. In any event, the room is VERY SMALL so brace yourself. You will not want to linger around the room but who goes to NYC for that?!? More importantly, though, it's also very clean and the bed's are comfy. The curtain blocks the light well so no early rising unless you want to. The bathroom is average size but quite large relative to the size of the room. The hot water was good and so was the water pressure.The location can't be beat either, just a block from a subway stop so you're just minutes from downtown. There are also a lot of diners, bars and restaurants near the hotel to enjoy and you're just a short few mins walk to Central Park.The price was about $315US for 3 nights, taxes in, which was fantastic given the overall quality and location. Enjoy your stay!!

We reserved there for 2 nights during canada's thanksgiving so we can visit the city. Room was nice and just large enough for a couple. Clealiness was good. District is quiet (for New York) so we were really able to sleep well. Proximity to subway station 86th street is really good to have a direct line into Time Square and central Manhattan. Close to good coffee shops and walking distance to Central Park.

Very close to subway in a delightful neighborhood....staff friendly and helpful... shuttle you can purchase to the airports...Uber less expensive.....if you are planning to stay only in the room you will want to look elsewhere...small rooms but clean and appropriate for some place to lay your head to rest after a hectic time in Midtown...would recommend and stay again.

This hotel is located 2 blocks from Central Park and one from Broadway Avenue. Is a cheap hotel with small bedrooms but very confortables and clean. If you decide to go o NY with a small budget, choose this hotel!

This is located in one my favorite pockets of the UWS. I used to live in this neighborhood when I was based in NY and always try and stay in this pocket of the UWS when I am in town. The Belnord staff is very friendly and accommodating. The rooms are small but always clean. The rooms are quiet as well, which is nice break from the blusterous city.

The Belnord is exactly as advertised. The rooms were small, but clean and functional. The bed was extremely comfortable and I slept great while there. My room was much larger than my family's room and we paid the same prices. Luck of the draw. There was a "kitchen" across from our room with coffee and tea. We weren't told about this amenity, but when we asked we were informed it was for us guests. My only issue was with the front desk personnel. They weren't overly friendly, which is fine, but they also weren't overly helpful. The wifi wasn't working at all and when we called the desk to inform them, they wouldn't offer any ways to fix it or make it work. As it turns out, they had given us the wrong password. I have stayed in many hotels in the northeast and this one was by far the least friendly or accommodating. That being said, it was still a nice stay and I would consider staying here again.

We had a great stay at this hotel in October. Position is great - a 1 minute walk from the subway. Rooms for the price although small were clean and well serviced. As far as New York goes this is a winner.

The room for 2 is just tiny. We can't even walk around the room. The noise of the AC did not let us sleep. Bathroom is a size of a cage. on top of that, the receptionists were not that nice.Only the location is good.

Nice and very clean rooms, well equipped. Very close to subway station, Central Park and many cafes and shops.The only issue..noisy elevator and air-condition. But If you are as tired as I was by walking around all day in NY, you don't have a problem!A bit expensive, but getting a clean room with private bathroom in such good location is not that easy in New York for this amount of money.

The room was very small but everything looked nice and clean. Tahir and the rest of the staff were friendly and helpful. If you don't want to spend too much money and don't mind the small room this is the place for you! After all, we spent majority of time exploring NYC and the hotel had everything we needed for our night stay.

This was a trip of a lifetime for us. A big birthday and a dream booked a year ago. Belnord hotel was clean well presented and the rooms were modern. It was a great touch having USB plug sockets. The room may have been small but there was plenty of storage space and a very comfortable bed!! The TV was great and the coffee machine too!!! TAHIR and KAREN and all the staff were so helpful, polite and friendly people. The location is fab in a beautiful part of New York five minutes from central park and it's just been brilliant!! There's even a luggage room and a spare shower room. Don't bother with an over priced hotel I'm so impressed and it's been fabulous thank you.

The hotel is good value. We were visiting Columbia university and it is in striking distance. The rooms are very small. Basically we had a wall tightly around our bed. But the room was cheap for New York and if you only stay there for a night or two, overall a very good deal.

After reading the reviews prior to booking we knew the room would be small so no surprise there. The hotel is spotless, front desk staff very friendly and helpful! My only concern was WiFi, we had it the first day and couldn't connect again. We were the last room at the end of the hall and were told that was the issue. Our room was a modern queen, it was fine for 2 people for 6 days. Huge modern flat screen TV with a hundred channels. You are so close to so many places to eat and the 1 train is a block away. We'll be back next year!

We are from the UK and booked The Belnord for 6 nights as our son was running the marathon and we wanted to spend some time in New York. From booking in until we left we were made to feel welcome the staff are very pleasant and helpful, lots of comments say the rooms are small. They are adequate always kept lovely snd clean with clean towels every day. Would I recommend it absolutely, a taxi was organised for us, it was on time with a very helpful driver as well. This is a room only hotel but there are so many eating places around you will always find plenty of places and the hotel is near the subway.

As others have noted, the rooms are small but charming, especially the bathroom, but (unlike my last AirBnB here) my luggage and I actually fit. The location, eight blocks north of Zabar’s, is excellent, and the view over 87th street is of a fine old building, and matches the decor. The WiFi is a drawback; the access code changes as 9 AM, and my iPad (though not my MacBook) was unable to reconnect after the transition. Speed test said the bandwidth is only half a meg per second, and longer downloads seem even slower. Disclaimer: TripAdvisor is giving me an Amazon gift card for booking and reviewing this hotel.

booked a room online, took a long taxi ride all the way up the upper west side there, arrived and they would not honor my booking saying only bunk bed rooms were available. super unprofessional and rude kids working from desk did not even offer an apology or solution and instead went back to playing videos on cellphone. will not use budget places or this hotel again.
user_name:
M. G
West Palm Beach, Florida

review_body: Disappointing stay at Belnord, NY. Unfriendly front desk manager, no beverages in the room, coffee machine at front desk never working nor any attempt to get it fixed in the three days we stayed there. Tiny rooms tinier bathroom. Definitely not worth the price tag......but location compensates

I stayed at the hotel from 22nd - 26th Oct and then again on the 28th Oct. My first stay I had a modern twin room which was great. The room, although small, was very well designed and their was a separate alcove that you could put your suitcase so that it was out of the way. My second stay I had a modern double room and I barely had enough room to move around because there was nowhere I could put my suitcases that they were out of the way. Thank heavens it was only for one night as it could of proved very problematic. The rooms were very clean and the beds very comfortable. The hotel is one one block away from the subway which was great for getting around. I would definitely stay here again but not in a double room.

For New York, this hotel was cheap, but we barely fit in the room. However the room's design is very ergonomic. Plugs, mirrors and lighting are very well-place and the bed is extremely comfortable. The staff was extremely accommodating and friendly. I choose this hotel for it's location on the Upper West side. It's within walking distance to all the important sites, esp. Central Park and Lincoln Center.

Small basic room but meets all of your needs. Very clean place. Neighborhood is quiet and very safe feeling, and near everything you could possibly need. No complaints about anything, except if you are tall the bed is maybe a tad short. My feet threatened to hang over the edge if I slept at the bottom of my pillow. Highly recommend this place! Overall excellent experience.

Close to the subway into midtown Manhattan, one block to the 86th street cross town bus and all the museums of Fifth Avenue, at least six or seven excellent restaurants in walking distance, on a quiet street, this hotel has a superb staff, the rooms are immaculate. As a person who is slightly handicapped I was delighted to find absolutely state of the art walk in showers, replete with grab bars, and every other handy device. Chris and Daniel on the front desk were constantly helpful, set up transportation around town and to the airport. It was like being in a small European hotel except the absence of even morning breakfast coffee was a downer.

The hotel looks like a tipical house of New York, that we see in movies. The room is brand new and fine. I not liked of the sound of the air conditioner, it was a little loud. All of the employees were very kind.

Following renovation, we found Belnord to be better than our previous stay (2014). Rooms are still small, but the reno has made storage of luggage easier (under the bed). The double bed was VERY SMALL for two adults. Staff is friendly. Housekeeping staff kept the room clean. Amenities are a joke (sliver of soap). Very convenient to subway and variety of stores, restaurants and even movie theater.

It was what and where we needed it. The Belnord is not a stay in hotel. It’s only a place to rest and shower as you visit New York. This hotel is perfect for a short stay in New York while visiting the main attractions of the city. We would definitely recommend the Belnord Hotel if you just need a place to sleep, not a place to hang out in.

We booked four nights at the Belnord Hotel and arrived very early. As they were unable to do an early check in Karen very kindly offered a shower in the downstairs bathroom as well as a secure room to store luggage in.The hotel is on the upper west side and is nice and quiet. The rooms are typical New York size but that is all I need. There is no closet but hangers for clothing. As the rooms have been updated there is a new look which is very pleasant. There are many restaurants in the area for breakfast. Two blocks from Central Park and one block from the subway. Will stay here when I come back.
user_name:
Jasonleg
Cape Town Central, South Africa

review_body: Wonderful place, but there was a girl in my room that was snoring :). I really appreciate the quality of the room, very little bed considering that I am tall. The staff was rude and not very friendly!

The hotel room was very tight for two people, very small bathroom and closet. No more than two big luggage per room or you'll feel trapped.Anyway, it's a quiet hotel. The neighborhood is friendly, two blocks from Central Park and the subway.Well located.

The Belnord Hotel is in a great location. It's one street from the subway (Red Line), it's in a very safe neighborhood, and it's located near a variety of dining/drinking choices. The rooms are clean and the staff is very friendly and helpful to answer any questions. Will def stay there again for future visits to NYC!

It's the second time I chose this hotel and I was pleasantly surprised to see that the rooms were renovated. I'm not sure if they've all been renovated already, but two years ago I slept in a room which was considerably older than this new one with bunk beds. Everything was very clean, so no complaints there. A bit small perhaps, but if you're not staying in the hotel room a lot that's no problem. The location is good as well. Very close to Central Park and Broadway and very close to a Red Line subway station. There's a very wide choice of restaurants in the neighbourhood and it's also very quiet there.My main complaint with this hotel is the complete lack of sound isolation in the rooms. You hear everything in the corridor and even in other rooms as if they're happening in your own room. Also, the rooms are a bit small, especially for that price. But perhaps that's typical for NYC. One other thing was the noise of some kind of generator (or perhaps the AC?) below my room. Not only a lot of noise, but you could feel the vibrations throughout the room.

I booked the Belnord because the other two hotels I like in the immediate area were full --even though I made my reservation 2 months early (but it was for the Columbus day weekend). The previous reviewers are right on: the Belnord has the smallest rooms I've been in outside of Paris. No room for even one dresser or a single chair--so you have to leave your luggage on the floor and sit on the bed (unless you want to stand). You do get 4 hangers, two for each "hook" that protrudes from near the mirror. The bathroom is not bad--but the soap provided is a joke--barely enough for one shower. The bed is very comfortable, the TV is fine, and the internet WiFi connection in the room is adequate--but I expect this of any hotel that I pay $250 a night for. I guess the price per night (I booked two rooms for 3 nights) is a pretty good deal for NYC, but I've stayed in much better hotels within a easy walking (4-5 block) radius for the same price or better. To sum it up--the room is very small but comfortable, but the "value" is on the low side.

Great hotel in a pretty quiet area. Small rooms but comfortable and clean and looking rather new. Nice employees.Restaurants and Starbucks in the neighbourhood.(try the small Indian one just around the corner. Excellent food and very nice people. Indian Janpur.) I'll be back!

I booked the hotel based on price and advertised pictures. When we arrived we was given room 108.... SMALL is not the word, teeny bathroom, claustrophobic, view outside was of a wall... Had to used borrowed ironing board on the bed! We initially asked for a different and bigger room, we was told there was none available... So we persevered, quite noisy and can hear others in their rooms and bathrooms.We again asked for a different room... Again told none, we subsequently advised we would have to leave hotel to find a more comfortable/suitable place. We was contacted very quickly after this and shown by the lovely hectar two other rooms on the 4th floor! MUCH BETTER, comfier, bigger bed, bigger bathroom and Somewhere we was happy to stay in ( comfort is required due to all the walking and busyness of your day)The room we went too was modern and clean and tidy. Lovely domestic staff cleaned and changed towels daily! Excellent location , about 2.2 miles from time square... Underground couple of blocks away, lots of deli's and other places to eat. Starbucks around the corner.Short walk to Central Park and local bars of all tastes. Try Es bar and the one next door! Also try prohibition....If you want a nice meal try the restaurant in Central Park!The area is quiet and in easy reach of all the hustle and bustle of New York.... But far enough away to enjoy some calm. Great place to stay, great value for money!If you want just a bed space then the first room is suitable for that and value for the money also, it just wasn't what we had in mind but we got there in the endDEFINATLY recommend this hotel

The room was clean and newly decorated but as many have said and as the hotel mentions, the rooms as small. It's in a great location with loads of really nice places to eat and drink all within a few blocks, staff are friendly and there is not much that you can fault.

The only room available was one with a bunk bed. I was desperate and I couldn't find anywhere else close by for a similar price. It was actually good. The bed was very comfortable and there was a flat screen TV on the wall at the bottom and an effective reading light. Yes the room was very small but it's NYC and par for the course. The bathroom was excellent! I'd give it a 3 and 1/2. And if I need to be in that area in the future I'd definitely consider it again.

It's newly made, it's clean, it's tiny. Smaller are only the cells in prisons. Ok, sorry, one shouldn't compare that, but more brain used would have helped to optimize the round about 80 square foot (8qm) room including bathroom. The statement "it's small, but cheap" is amazing when you pay 262 US a night for a party of two. I appreciate that they tried to give each of us a beside table at each bedside, but I had larger rooms with only on of em which should be an acceptable compromise when you have to be economically with the available space. We had to push the bed left or right, whenever we wanted to open either the bathroom door, the wardrobe or the room door. My girlfriend scratched her leg about 5 times at the drawer handle, which had sharp edges. Rounded ones wouldn't hurt so much. But it she would not have scratched her leg, we would not even have recognized, that there was a drawer under the bed. So every evil has a good aspect ... does that help to accept the price? Find out yourself or try another one.

Stayed only one night before leaving the USA. Really small room though clean and recently refurbished. Dodgey internet and plumbing. Good quiet location but not sure if I would return. Staff were pretty helpful.

I agree with the majority of the reviewers: if you are looking for a spacious luxury room this is not your hotel. However, if you are looking for a great location and clean environment at the reasonable price then you are definitely at the right place. I don't know about the others but we had great experience with the staff. Particularly Tahir and Mario were very helpful

The Belnord is on the Upper West Side, not far from Central Park and a short subway ride to Time Square. The room was very clean and the staff friendly. The gentleman on the desk organised a shuttle for me to get back to JFK which was really helpful. The only thing that was a little annoying was the shower, you had to run the shower for 5 minutes before you could get any hot water. Also no tea/coffee facilities in the room, not a big deal but I do like a cup of tea in the morning as I am getting ready. There is a coffee machine in the lobby (which you have to pay for the coffee).

The Belnord is on upper west side and well located two blocks from Central Park . The first room we had was so small that we could not get our cases in without manoeuvring round the door and was noisy at night from machinery down below. There was not more than a foot round the bed . We requested a change and the second room was better but still very small. Staff friendliness was patchy. Reasonable value for New York.

Booked 3 nights, on the second night the bathroom door locked it self so they offerd us to use the bathroom of another room on another floor... Luckily they re-funded us for the last night and we managed to leave earlier.Smallest room I have ever been to! We took turns only to stand because there was no room for both of us on the floor. Same thing in the bathroom, I had to take few steps to the side just to close the door. There was no noise isolation at all, we heard the other guests showering and watching TV across the hall.The bed linings seemed pretty used and not quite clean, yellowish color.The air conditioner kept turning on and off the whole night and made a terrible noise.The bath tub was cloggedThe entry of the hotel smelled like pissLong story short, go to anywhere else.

My wife and I stayed here on our way home from our honeymoon. The rooms were small but very clean. And the staff were very helpful and friendly. They helped us to set up a shuttle to get back to JFK and recommended some great cheap places to grab a bite. It was great having central park so close and time square is a short subway ride away.

Tye is the man. He's exactly the type of guy you want in charge of the front desk at any hotel: courteous, knowledgeable, and considerate, with great energy and sense of humor. He got me checked out in no time and helped me find the best-priced airport transportation at just the right time I needed it.Yes, the Belnord Hotel is small (as other reviewers point out). But its price point is solid value-for-money, considering the neighborhood and other competitors. Public areas are kept clean and organized and the comprehensive camera security has the desired effect. I'll definitely be back! Thanks again Tye (and Carmen)!

The hotel is clean, bed comfortable  It was in a convenient area for us.There is free ice but no other extras. There is a charge for machine coffee and no in room coffee We had a double bed. Barely any extra room. Miniscule bathroom and luggage had to be pushed under bed. There is a baggage room to store bags before or after checkout.Our view was the brick wall of another building.Luckily, we were only in the room to sleep and that's all I would recommend it for.It is lower price than hotels in the area, although probably the accommodations are less also

It was our first trip to NYC and we stayed here for 8 nights. The rooms are tiny but very clean nice beautiful décor. No noisy traffic. the subway is less than 5 minutes away. Marshalls is not so far away. The location is very good. Friendly staff. I definitely recommend this hotel. we got it for a good price also.

I spent 2 weeks in this hotel. I agree with all comments: the rooms are really small and essentials, but really really clean. THe bathroom is coming directly from Lilliput, but towels are changed daily and the service is impeccable. The staff is friendly and helpful, very discreet and I loved the area. It's 20meters from Broadway, so food and drinks are available 24/7. 50m meters from Metro station and very close also to Central park.

Room is extremely small, but if you go in knowing that, it is fine. I stayed in a room with a double bed. There was about 1 foot of clearance between the bed and the door/wall of the outside hallway. It is very clean with a cheery light blue color scheme. The staff had always cleaned and replace the towels and bath amenities before I returned for the evening. Location is about 1 block away from the metro 1 line - it is the only line I needed to use to do much sight seeing. There are also bus stops nearby at 88th street. Location is a well lit, quiet street. Wifi was slower than I am used to. Room included TV with cable, bathroom with large shower/small bathtub depending on your perspective, small cutout closet and one side table. Comfiest bed I have ever slept on in my life.

It is a good hotel and rooms are nice and clean. Hotel is about 5 minutes walk away from station. There are few good shops around if you dont want to travel far. Also had some good cafe's around for breakfast.

This hotel is located near the 86th stop of metro 1. It is in a nice and quite area of Manhattan. Importantly it is clean and not so expensive as other others in Manhattan. Wifi is well working. You can't expect a big lobby but all you need is in this hotel. For me the most important thing is the cleanliness and this hotel it is. Rooms are a good surprise about their dimension. We had a room in the 6th floor. The bed it was not a King, but a queen. Fine anyway.

I must say, that I was looking forward for our trip to New York City for YEARS, so my expectations were unreasonably high.The hotel is pretty easy to reach via subway, just a short walk to the closest station. THe location is therefore pretty nice. It was really quiet and neat. We have not spend too long time in the room anyway. Bed was comfortable, and that was all that mattered. Yes, the room (and bathroom) are tiny, but we did not matter at all. We came to enjoy the city, not to be in the room:-) The time we have spend in the room was reasonably comfortable - it was warm, quiet and internet was working well. What more to ask for?Recommended for budget trips ;-)

We come to the city to visit family and always book a room here at the Belnord. Great price for clean, comfortable room with good air conditioning. The rooms are very small with no view but we never care. We use the room for sleep.The staff here are always friendly and helpful. Towels are changed out each day.The hotel is a short distance from train stations. There are lots of little places around to grab good cheep food as well as expensive too.

The word is "cramped ". However, even though there is barely 1 foot to walk around the bed, and even though you can barely turn around in the bathroom, this place is a bargain compared to the many other overpriced hotels in the area. Belnord is efficient, clean, and 1 block from the subway 1 line.

Our room fit a full size bed and only enough room to walk on either side. The bathroom is also small. That being said, this is NYC and we only needed a room for sleeping and showering. The room was updated and very clean. The room was also cool (in August) and quiet. We were in walking distance of great restaurants south on Amsterdam. We would stay here again.

We stayed at the Belnord Hotel in New York for 7 nights from 14th of July 2016. Nothing is as hard as finding a good hotel, at a good location, in New York for a reasonable price. The Belnord is that place you are looking for. We stayed in one of the renovated rooms with aan bunkbed. The rooms are small, but big enough for 2 girls with suitcases and lots of clothes. The bathroom is clean, there's a shower and full bath. The rooms are cleaned daily en new towels are also provided.The only thing the room didn't have was a view, but who needs one when your only there to sleep. And the ventilation and aircondition were really noisy in our room.The staff is very friendly and helpfull. They were more than willing to show and tell us all about the neigbourhood and events going on. Belnord is situated on 87th Street West on the Upper West Side. It is only 1 street from the subway, that's just a minute walk from the hotel. The neigbourhood is very pretty, a lot of trees, brownstone and townhouses, spacious sidewalks and many restaurants and bars. We really loved it.

I stayed at the Belnord about a year ago in August 2015, been wanting to make this review for awhile but kept forgetting. It was an awesome hotel on the upper west side and it was not too expensive. Of course you can expect expensive in New York but this hotel was comfortable. My mother and I had a room together and it was such a cute size. 2 twin beds, a closet, and a bathroom. Really all you needed and would expect in New York City. The rooms were very clean and so stylish. (We had the updated modern room). Close to the subway, cute shops, eating places, can walk to Times Square (but I recommended subway), and there is an awesome restaurant near called Jacobs Pickles! I completely recommend this hotel to any one trying to find somewhere to stay in NYC!

Location was perfect as we were 2 blocks from out friends! As expected, the room was very small. However, it was squeaky clean with all the amenities we needed. Every bit of space was utilized in order to offer a bathroom with shower, 2 bedside nightstands, a closet to hang clothes with shelves for extra storage.The bed was very comfortable. The staff were accommodating. One of the staff described it as "our little boutique hotel". I think that is a great description.

Location is the best Part about this Boutique Hotel.The lobby can fit one person at a time.Rooms and Washrooms are clean but honestly there no space to walk around in the room or to even stand and change.I used to stand on top of the bed to change.We visited New York in the month of June without much planning thus most of the Hotels were booked for the summer.The hotel is def a value for money but if you like me cannot stand a small washroom where the Pot and half bathtub and next to each other ,this not the hotel for you.

Warning! The hotel rooms are actually closets. We booked a queen room for two nights. When entering the room, we found the queen bed took up NINETY percent of the room. You could not stand in the room side by side between the walls and the bed. No place for luggage, no dresser, desk. The "closet in a closet" is literally 3 sq. ft.We could not stay in the room and left and went to the Hotel Newton for a lower cost, larger room, better location. When a refund for the deposit was request, it was denied by the hotel. Went through Booking.com and the photos on the site of the room did not accurately depict the minuscule room.

The hotel was clean and neat, but the rooms are very small. They are, "open the door and hit the bed" small. If you are looking for a place that is in a great location and may have affordable prices, and you don't mind the size, then go for it. No closets. Very tiny bathroom.

Made reservations here because of the super affordable price tag and did not leave disappointed. The room was tidy and simple and the bathroom was pristine. It's located within short walking distance of bars, restaurants, stores and the subway. The two young men working the desk, Ty and Chris I believe, were super accommodating and helpful. Will definitely be staying here on future visits.

Great value! Located in quiet upper west side neighborhood. Units are very small with everything you need. Hardwood floors. AC. Safe in closet for valuables. 24 hour friendly staff. Simple. Basic. Not the hotel to lounge around in the room.
user_name:
M P
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Our room was pretty small but that's okay since the room was so cheap. But the view from the window was awful: it was to another apartment (and the apartment's building was old, part abandoned and not too good-looking). And the windows were also dirty - seriously, you should wash those sometimes. But overall we enjoyed it: most of the staff were super nice and helpful. The hotel is located in a nice and safe neigborhood and it's also very near to the 86th subway station. Would stay again.

We recently spent the weekend at the Belnord Hotel and consider it one of the hidden gems of the UWS. Location is close to both Broadway and Central Park, subways nearby.We chose the upgraded double room which was compact but very cleverly designed. Quality of towels and bedding was same as you find at luxury hotels

Great location near central park west and absolutely clean. Room is so small but workable. Good value for the money. Subway station 1 block away for the 1. Need to go on Columbus Ave for bars and entertainment.

Good:-Nice safe area. one block to subway (1,2,3 trains) and 3-4 blocks to A,C,B,D trains-4 blocks to Central Park.-Clean room.-Front desk open 24/7 pleasant enough customer service. Not so good;-I've been in many small rooms (NY,Paris, London)...this may have been the smallest.-They will store your bag after/before check in/out, however it is serve yourself and unsecured.This place works fine for NYC if the price is right.

I booked this hotel as it was cheap for NY and close to subway and Central Park.The room was Really small - litterally 1 foot on the side and 2 feet space at the end of the bed. No closet. Not much room for luggage. We are on a 3 month trip and glad we packed light! There was room under the bed for storage ...but thats it.The room was very clean.Comfortable bed - we had double which wasnt a big bed but that the size we booked for the cheaper rate.Many coffee shops around the corner - and great restaurants down Amsterdam Ave.We loved Jacobs Pickles! But portions are huge so dont order too much like we did.If i came again to New York i would stay here - as the price cant be beat!And i loved the neighborhood restaurants.Pack lightly! Though some rooms may be larger than the one we had.

My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary trip. We mainly booked this hotel because it was one of the cheaper options we found. The room was very nice, we got the upgraded room, and the location is great. Very close to a subway, central park, and plenty of food. I definitely recommend this hotel.

The rooms and bathrooms were SPOTLESS which was important to my fiancé and I, and the bathroom was a private bathroom which was exactly what I wanted. The best boutique hotel I've stayed at in NYC. Ty at the front desk was very helpful and courteous!

The hotel is located on a nice quiet street in the upper west side. The staff is friendly and check in was quick. There is subway access across the street and Central Park is a short walk away. The rooms are small but have everything you need. The bathroom was a good size and very clean. This hotel is perfect for a short stay in New York. I would definitely return to the Belnord Hotel.

I stayed here with my 16 month old son and the staff was incredibly helpful. They went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable. The room is small but who comes to NYC to spend time in their room! The bed is very comfortable and the bathroom was great. I will definitely stay here again.

The Belnord is a smaller boutique hotel in the upper west side of NYC.It is affordable and central to everything you want to do in the city. Be prepared for small rooms,but that is the norm in NYC. Our room had drawers in the foot of the bed, and the bed was open underneath to allow us to stash our suitcases. Pack light, as closet space is at a premium! The room on the fourth floor was clean and quiet at night. Front desk staff are friendly and helpful. We got a Hop On Hop Off Big Bus three day pass and it was great to see the city on top of the double decker.Restaurants are steps away, as there is no dining or bar in the hotel. I can't comment on parking, as we flew in and got a shuttle to the hotel. WiFi is slow, but available.Note the hotel was under redecoration, and our floor was primed and being painted. No fumes to speak of.

Spent 6 nights at Belnord Hotel in May to explore Manhattan. Selected Belnord based on a friend's recommendation and the price. Very pleased with our experience! Room was small but very clean and comfortable. Staff was helpful and considerate. We will absolutely stay there again if we return to Manhattan. The Upper West Side is a great residential neighborhood. The hotel is close to subway, Central Park, and Natural History Museum.

The staff went the extra mile. We are not city dwellers. They provided recomendations for breakfast, livery service, and worked with us on food delivery. The room was small but very clean. The bed was very comfortable and if you looked around there was plenty of hidden storage. Our flight was scheduled for 6 pm. They saw us with bags and volunteered to place our bags under lock and key until we were ready leave the city. We will be back!

We enjoyed our stay at the Belnord. Our room was not as small as I anticipated from reading other reviews, the location is excellent, and the neighborhood is relatively peaceful. The twin beds were comfortable, but not convenient for this married couple. The room was very clean, but smelled strongly of some type of cleaning fluid. Given the price and the location, we will likely stay at the Belnord again.

This is a spotless, highly functional hotel in a great location on the Upper West Side. We stayed (our third visit) for five nights in May, and our only quibble is with the wi-fi (you have to log in a new code each day, which was finicky.) The rooms are indeed small - they are well planned, however, and well - set up: ie, there are file drawer like cubbies under the bed, for example. In each of our stays, we've been in newly or recently renovated rooms and the bathrooms are tile or marble, and also highly functional. Housekeeping and front desk staff are genuinely enthusiastic about making the stay comfortable.For the price and the location, this is a very good alternative to the other more 'full service' hotels in the area - and for travelers interested in being in a more residential, cafe-chocked area instead of the bustle of Times Square, this is wonderful. There are two nearby subways - at Broadway and at Central Park West - and the area is safe, well populated by locals, and has the bonus of being near Central Park.No review of this hotel will NOT mention the size of the rooms - yes, they're small (we stayed once in a room with bunk beds here - it's real, it's a bargain and for one night in the city, perfectly servicable) - but if you have a room to put your luggage, sleep, shower, get ready to go and enjoy the city, this is a very suitable place. We have returned for our third time, finding the price and the location outweigh the modest challenge of a small room. For international visitors, this can be a GREAT base from which to effectively explore the city - a safe, bucolic (for NYC) area with great access to the rest of the city - including, for example, a 20-25 minute subway ride to Brooklyn, and 20 mins to Yankee Stadium, 20 mins to the museums in midtown and a beautiful walk to Central Park, to the Natural History Museum, the New-York HIstorical Society, etc. Great restaurants, too.

Give this hotel a try. We chose it for value, location and reviews. We weren't disappointed. Actually I reported to the hotel that it exceeded my expectations. We booked the modern superior which is near their top of the line. Yes, it is very small, but all the reviews say that. (15" between end of bed and wall) What needs to be stressed is it is a pleasant room...freshly painted white, fine bed and linens...even the towels are a notch above basic. Most appreciated were the two lights bedside so we could each read. The room seemed very european except for adequate lighting! There is a narrow table and a closet w/ a safe. The bathroom is small but was beautifully tiled. Plenty of hot water and good pressure. The hallways are not narrow and dingy...at least on the 5th floor they were freshly painted white w/ adequate lighting. The stairways are actually worth using. They are lovely. The hotel does offer discounted parking, but expect to be challenged to find it. We never did locate it until we located it on foot because the numbers do not seem to be displayed. (it is on 88th and is the garage immediately on the right after Broadway. I believe the address is 214 88th) There was a "kitchen" closet type room off the hallway. Appeared to have a coffee pot and small refrigerator, but we did not use it or check it out closely. The weekend that we were there it was a quiet environment. There was no annoying traffic or hotel noise. Perhaps the air-conditioning could be said to be a bit annoying, but we found it tolerable and it certainly wasn't constant.

We had a very nice vacation and we were satisfied with the room. It was a very good bed and the room was big. But the shower was bad. Too hot or too cold. The showerhead sprayed water all over the bathroom... The hotel was very clean and the room too. The receptionist wasn't welcoming us every day, like we are used to at hotels. Good experience though. We would stay there again.

A great choice based on the location right next to 86th Street Metro and with Central park as your (almost) next door neighbor. The housekeeping was very good, but unfortunately there wasn't the same quality in terms of lobby atmosphere. The receptionists almost never greeted us, which was a bit of a shame. Nevertheless a great hotel! We got a pretty great room and the location was perfect for our trip to the city.

There are other budget hotels in NY, but I always check with the Belnord first. The rooms are small (no desk or furniture other than a bed, small) but impeccably clean and comfortable and there is a reliable internet connection! They have recently remodeled and they have done a really nice job of freshening and brightening up the place! The big thing for me is that the rooms are quiet. In New York, that's a big commodity when you want a good night sleep! The hotel staff are really nice and helpful and the location is easy access to subways / restaurants / shopping / a Starbucks just around the corner. I highly recommend if you are traveling on a budget!

We like staying on the upper west side but it's hard to find something economical to spend one night. The Belnord provides a room, albeit small, in a very nice neighborhood. Everything in the room and bathroom is tight so if you have a lot of luggage, it won't fit. Quiet neighborhood and great places to eat in walking distance.
user_location: Saratoga Springs, New York, United States
user_name:
Cheryl G
Saratoga Springs, New York, United States

review_body: We were there for our daughter's graduation. The hotel is close to subway station for uptown & downtown travel, restaurants and grocery stores. Rooms were clean and staff was helpful. There is a fridge on each floor and hot & cold water was available 24/7. We enjoyed watching TV after a tiring day. Best of all we enjoyed 50c coffee from the coffee machine at the reception level. We recommend this hotel to all on low budget travel.

An elegant and beautiful hotel with amiable and hospitable staff. The rooms are compact and clean with grand windows that overlook the idyllic city streets. The beds provide the twofold perfection of crisp white sheets and a soft, yet firm, mattress to collapse into after a long day of exploration. The bathroom beckons you inside with bright golden lighting, paired with excellent modern plumbing. Each floor has a small, pristine, well-stocked kitchenette to use at your leisure.A few steps from the 86th Subway stop and a brisk, pleasant walk to Central Park. And just around the corner, bustling with diverse restaurant and bar options to kindle the flames of celebration.Upon check-in and check-out, the staff will allow you, free of charge, to store and lock your luggage as you arrange for transportation. Safe, relaxed, and down-to-earth.Thank you, staff of Belford Hotel, for making each trip to NYC feel like home.

Good location. Clean room. Nice staff.We had a small room with two beds a small bathroom and small closet. Good storage for suitcases under the beds. Our room was near the elevator. The elevator beeped a lot of the time and woke us up late at night and early in the morning.Hot and cold water was available in a general room on each floor. I didn't know until the last day, that there was a refrigerator on each floor.

It was a nice stay there, close Metro station , stores and groceries.I love to try different hotel on my travels and I could repeat Belnord Hotel. Two blocks from Central Park and walking distance from American Natural History Museum, Strawberry Fields ( John Lennon ), Central Parking Boating Lake, Belvedere Castle, ... Cafe Lalo ( You've got mail with Meg Ryan and Tom Hanks).I love Upper West Side Neighborhood!

Hotel was clean and seemed recently refurbished. Front desk staff were helpful and friendly. You know the rooms are very small when the person checking you in says-"all of the rooms are small but you have your own bathroom." Good no frills hotel in good location.

Great location just off Broadway at 87th St. Excellent transportation and restaurants close at hand. It is clean and the staff is very pleasant when you can get ahold of them.
