However the Belnord facilities are limited in space and service is "if you hit it right". We are older and it was not right for us. Those stairs you see have to be climbed with suitcases, no ramp, no one at the door to assist those who need it. The halls are so narrow that one has to stop to let someone going in the opposite direction go by. The rooms are extremely small. You enter a double bed room and there is a bed taking up about 80% of the space. No chairs no desk. you literally have to hop on the bed to get out of the way of the other person. The bathroom is also barely turn-around space. The tub is half size. Although the bed is quite comfortable and you can find bedside tables and window sills to put your things, it is very cramped. We were in transition from living in NYC and moving to NH and needed a restful place to wind down after packing, etc. This was NOT a restful place and not a place for anyone who is uncomfortable in cramped quarters, and certainly not comfortable for older or physically disadvantaged people.It is good for people who will be spending almost the full day out and come here only to sleep, but little else.However there was one very upsetting policy issue. That is upon registering they request (demand) a $200 deposit for possible damages. When I was checking in, a young man, obviously from Europe, was questioning why he had to put down this $200 deposit and would he really get it returned to him at the end of his stay. Personally, I think that for the few people who may trash the room, (a very small percent, I am sure), the Belnord antagonizes those people who are respectful of property and will do no harm. It is insulting and, I think it sets a bad tone right up front about their stay at the hotel. Why should I trust you if you don't trust me? Bad policy.

Was here for a job, needed a place to stay, I loved the look of the Hotel and the Staff were professional and helpful. I'll definitely be making this my number one option next time I'm in the City, which will be soon. The price was affordable considering the last minute reservation that I made. A must visit Hotel for anyone looking for a Stylish laid back establishment. Stephen Abang

Having read the reviews on this place, we decided to take a gamble and book it because it was very reasonably priced. Big. Mistake.Upon arrival, all the negative reviews came to fruition - the wifi is painfully slow, verging on defunct. The room is SO small, you can barely make it around the bed and opening & closing the bathroom door was tricky to say the least because of it's proximity to the toilet. God help any guests who are pregnant or generously built. The walls are paper thin as is the door which means you can hear EVERYTHING and so can everyone else - which made it difficult to relax. When we went to bed, inevitably we were kept awake most of the night by a neighbouring guest who came in drunk, swearing and then proceeded to have several telephone conversations and watch TV into the early hours (this was in the room opposite and we heard EVERYTHING!). We reported the noise to the front desk who did absolutely nothing about it.The other 'feature' of this hotel was the loud humming of some kind of generator. It would come on and off throughout the night and when it did come on, it made the bed buzz and vibrate under our heads, which made it feel like we were sleeping on top of an engine.Suffice to say, we got zero sleep and so our first day in NYC was not good as we were exhausted after travelling from the UK. Knowing that moving to another room would make no difference, we made the financially painful decision to move to another hotel as we knew we could not physically sleep there and having spent a lot of money to get to NYC we weren't going to walk around like zombies the whole time because we couldn't sleep.We explained politely to the front desk that we were checking out early and why, and the guy didn't seem at all surprised about the complaints we had. We asked if they could refund us anything at all for the following 2 nights we had booked, under the circumstances and he said no. We weren't surprised but it was disappointing.We moved to Candlewood Suites near to Times Square and it was fantastic - highly recommended and best of all, we slept soundly the next two nights.Conclusion: don't waste your money on this place, it might be cheap but you'd get more privacy, space and sleep quality in a cardboard box.

The wifi was very very slow half a mbp and also , they should tell you that the rooms are very very small. Very good if you plan not to use any wifi at all and if you plan not to be there. The location is good just a block away from the subway . They should include these useful information when booking

Belnord hotel is a good small budget hotel in Upper West Side, Manhattan.if you are looking for a-not-so-expensive hotel in Manhattan for your stay in NY then Belnord hotel is the one.The room is small but so are the most of hotel rooms in NYC.the bathroom is clean and you get fresh towels everyday. I got a small closet also to hang your clothes or store your luggage.There is no restaurant in the Hotel, but plenty of restaurants/diners to have your meal, we particulary like the City Diner closeby for our breakfast (we saw Tim Gunn from Project Runway having breakfast there!). There is Starbucks also around the corner, Subway (line 1) is just (3min walk). You can also find supermarket/pharmacy and some shops around the neighbourhood.They have free wifi with different password each day, the reception will give you set of passwords for different days, and the internet was working fine.Unfortunately though, i have to complain about the unfriendliness from 2 Indian origins guys at the reception, I have to mention their origins for easier identification (not meaning to be racist, I'm an asian myself!) but they can be more friendly, respectful and helpful towards the guests. The other receptionists are ok.

Visited New York City with my partner on a 4 day trip. Amazing vacation. If you want a no frills hotel it was clean and although the corridors were being painted, no problems and they were very quiet. The room was small but there was room to store under the bed. You could not hear any noise at all. We only slept in the room and hardly in the hotel so was sufficient for us. The reception staff were helpful. It is located on 87 th street and the subway was on 86 th street, 2 minutes walk away. We purchased a weekly ticket which was cheaper at a cost of 34 dollars each and was well worth it. If you walk to Times Square it takes over an hour. We used it all the time after discovering the long walk. The subway line was number one and covered all Broadway to Central Park. There are many places to eat breakfast on Broadway and Amsterdam around the hotel. We had dinner in a Belgian restaurant turn right oi if the hotel and right again and the staff were brilliant.

Yes, the room was small, but it was really well laid out with room for everything mostly under the bed, but if you were organised it was not a problem. THe room was clean and the bed was made daily. There was a TV and air conditioner, the ensuite was again small but had everything we needed. The little kitchen down the hall was good for making coffee and tea but not for much else, but we were just round the corner from lots of good restaurants and coffee shops in Broadway, so easy to make do. We were a block away from the subway, three blocks from the park. A great location and we thought very reasonable for the price. Staff were helpful and friendly and organised our transport to the airport with a good company which wasn't too expensive. All in all a great experience.

Located in a nice nice neighborhood, 1 block away from the subway with decent retail & restaurants all within walking distance. Our room was located on the 2nd floor and it was clean, but was so small that it was only furnished with a double bed, 1 bedside table and a TV mounted on the wall (there was no closet, shelves or drawers to put away our things). Light sleepers should be aware that you can hear everything that happens in the hallway -- there was a person wallpapering the room next door one morning and it was enough to wake me up.

The Belnord was a perfect base, to keep all our luggage whilst we went exploring in New York City! Hotel staff were helpful and friendly right from the start, even so much as to helping book our transport to the airport. The rooms are of adequate size, as I said we used it as a base, if you plan on spending a lot of time in a hotel room, then I would book elsewhere. But this hotel is perfect for throwing all your stuff down and coming back to it later to sleep. The hotel is a half an hour walk to Times Square, 5 minutes to the nearest subway station and was in good distance of some great food places, Hot and Crusty, Candle Café West and Big Daddy's were our favourites in the area. A 10 minute walk to the Natural History Museum and Central Park, which also has a lovely café with great hot drinks and food.

My boyfriend and I visit the city 3-4 times a year and we always make sure to stay here! The rooms are small, but you're in New York, go outside and explore! If all you need is a place to sleep at night and shower, this is it. It's only 2 blocks from central park, a great bagel place three blocks up and awesome prices. It's clean and small, all you need!

I enjoyed the Belnord hotel. The metro was one or two streets away, and was in a safe neighborhood near really nice restaurants. Staff was friendly. The luggage room smelled slightly of urine though... But overall I enjoyed my stay at the Belnord. It was small, but it's New York City and a reasonable price, so what do you expect!
user_name:
MollyDurnas
Palm Harbor, Florida, United States

review_body: My husband and I love staying at the Belnord. Ty, at the front desk is an excellent point person. He has tons of patience and information that is extremely helpful and he strives to assist in any way that he can. The hotel is extremely clean and fresh smelling. The hallways are narrow and the rooms are small, but sufficiently big to be comfortable. The price is excellent. The area where the Belnord is located is perfect. Quiet, but steps away from Broadway, very close to Central Park and a lovely walk from great restaurants!

Yes, you can say that the rooms are the size of pillowcases and I had to walk sideways around my bed, but if you're spending much time in your hotel room, what are you doing in New York City? Belnord is clean, well-appointed, comfortable--hard wood floors and duvets--and is less than a block from the 1 train down to Times Square. For runners: it's two short blocks from running along the Hudson and four longer blocks from the running track in Central Park. I had a very quiet room in the back and the bath/shower was full human size.

Our room, though not spacious, was attractive, comfortable, quiet and clean. The hotel is well located, right across the park and a short bus ride from the Met Museum and another short bus ride to Lincoln Centre. The staff was very helpful and pleasant.

Stayed here for just 2 nights when I was visiting NYC with a friend in April 2014. Shared a twin bed room,. It was small but sufficient for the short stay. Neat and clean. Got a booking over the phone and they blocked a room for us. Very convenient location and a nice area.

Just what I wanted. Super affordable price and nice place. The service was fantastic from day one. Thank you very much Tahir Front Desk which greeted us very personally. The rooms small but very clean with everything you need. Very friendly staff helped us with information needed for our trip. Thanks to Daniel for the info of transportation. When we return to NY, we'll stay again at Belnord Hotel.Justo lo que buscaba. Lugar super accesible y precio agradable. El servicio fue fantastico desde el primer dia. Muchas gracias a Tahir de Front Desk el cual nos atendio de manera muy personal. Las habitaciones aunque pequeñas muy limpias y con todo lo necesario. El personal muy amable nos ayudo con informacion necesaria para nuestro viaje. Gracias a Daniel por la info de transportacion. Cuando vuelva a NY volvemos a Belnord Hotel.

I was in New York for a seminar. I had a reduced budget but I wanted to be in Manhattan near the place of the venue. This hotel is inexpensive but it is located in a wonderful neighborhood. The rooms are small but they are clean and comfortable. On each floor, there's a kitchen where you can prepare some coffee and keep things refrigerated. There's no breakfast service, though. The storage space is limited but enough for two people traveling with basic luggage. The staff are friendly and ready to help. It is probably not suitable for big families but it is really good value for money for couples or if you are on your own.

I arrived early and they were very nice in letting me check in early. The room was clean and comfortable. It was small, but I knew that when I booked it, and, really, it was perfect for what I needed. I traveled alone and felt safe in that area. It is very close to the subway station and a short walk to Central Park and the museums. I would definitely stay there again. Did I mention the fantastic price!?

Great location. Near a movie theater, bank, restaurants, and a nice shopping center a few blocks away. The room was small, but it fit my needs. Hotel staff was also very nice. Room was clean. Not to mention it's close to the subway and only 2 stops away from Times Square using the express trains. Will stay again.

The rooms are very small, do not underestimate the size there is hardly any room to move. On a better note is the hygiene. You get daily clean towels and you have a private bathroom. Location is well and another plus is that its really quiet at night which seems unlikely because of the location but there was no noise. Nevertheless, I would consider another place due to the unfriendly service. The welcome was unfriendly. The younger staff are a little nicer but the service is best described as distant and disinterested.

The hotel is good, clean and in the middle of the 87st street. It's close to the subway and very easy to do whatever you want. The hotel and the room are small but everything is nice! Good hotel! Even if there is no breakfast I suggest this hotel!!

Stayed at the Belnord Hotel with my partner for a week recently. We were lucky enough to be given a room that was wheelchair accessible - so the room was much bigger and more comfortable than we had expected. Room was very clean and free wifi was slow but easy to use in the room. We had no trouble sleeping though for light sleepers the sound of the lift/people in corridors was quite noisy as was the sound from the street. One side of the bed was also very narrow to access and either required squeezing out or climbing over. Overall it was a very pleasant stay.

I was there for two nights with my girlfriend. I am totally aware of the fact that it is a budget hotel and all of that, so I understand there are certain things you need to be prepared for. I have also been in NY before and with less or similar money I have been in nicer places.I'm giving the hotel two stars because 1- It was clean. At least my "room" and super mini bathroom were always clean. 2- Its location is nice, you can walk for around 20-30 minutes or you can just take the subway very close to it.The reasons why I was not happy were that first the pictures are sort of deceiving. Again I know it's a budget hotel, blah blah; however, the rooms are way smaller than they even seem. There's just some space for the doble bed, a nightstand and to try to walk around next to the bed. Now the bed. The mattress must be super old because even if you sit down, it makes a lot of noise. I felt bad about even changing sides on the bed in the middle of the night because I didn't want anyone wake up in the next 10 rooms around. Why? well the "rooms" are super small and walls are thin, ultra thin, so you can even hear the phone conversation that a person across your room is having.People were ok, neither friendly nor unfriendly. They don't seem to mind your being or not being there. I guess that one of the things that bothers me in general is the fact that it is called a hotel when it is much more like a hostel. I would honestly suggest you try and pay a little extra if you can and stay in a nicer place.PS. You have to deposit 200 dollars, much more than in a Hard Rock hotel or in actual hotels. For some reason someone could destroy their noise uncomfortable mattresses.

This is a very nice hotel that is not expensive. The rooms are small but very clean and the location is excellent - close to restaurants and markets and shops and the subway. There is no safe in the room, but otherwise it has everything one would need. It would be just so nice if the desk clerks could look up from their computer screens occasionally to greet their guests. They are positively glued to the screens at all time and one hardly feels like asking for anything lest it disturb them.

We stayed here for a 3 nights and were very happy with the location and price of the hotel. Rooms are spotlessly clean with hot showers and everything you need within a short stroll. Be warned though, our room was tiny, which was fine if like us you're just after a place to sleep in a great location.

I had a tiny, charming, quiet room for $123! In New York City! You can't beat this. If you want to drop hundreds of dollars for more space and room service breakfast, then go somewhere else. If you'd rather spend your money enjoying New York, then the Belnord is a find. Just outside the door are numerous, cheap breakfast options, and the subway is a minute away. I also found the staff to be perfectly pleasant.

Location is great on Broadway, rooms are small but I didn't care as I was out the entire day! The rooms get freshened up and cleaned every day provided with clean towels...I enjoyed the very short walking distance to everything near by and also walked to Times Square (20/30 mins).The staff is friendly except 1 front desk gentleman (Indian origin I believe) who wasn't so nice and helpful! A little more friendly touch would make this place even more special!!!I enjoyed the cleanliness and the Christmas decorations with the beautiful tree in the lobby... I eould go back if rates remain the same!!

Location was convenient. Close to Broadway. Close to a subway station. Quiet. Relaxed. Close enough to Central Park (although we didn't go there this trip). The hotel is very clean. The staff at the front desk was very helpful. Our room was small, but it didn't matter. The only thing we wanted the room for was to sleep. We were able to have our own bathroom, which was a plus.

This hotel is brilliant. Great location, and great neighbourhood. The staff are very helpful and friendly. The rooms are slightly small, but let's face it ... You don't go to NYC to sit in your room. It's right next to 86th St subway. Also you have to try out Manhattan Diner. It's a few blocks north on Broadway but does the best breakfasts ever! Brilliant base for a NYC adventure and 5 min walk to Central Park!

The location is very convinient, on the UWS, very close to Metro station and there are many food options nearby.The stuff were not very friendly but that was not big issue for us. The room is indeed small, but we were there only for sleeping. The bed was comfortable.The room and bathroom were very clean, much better than expected for a 2 star hotel in NY. Very good value for the price in NY, would go there again.

Clean and renovated rooms. Attendance is great at reception. Excellent localization , near the subway. The room is really very small but for those who will spend the day walking around the city that does not matter . I'll stay again in this hotel for sure, if price remains the same .

The Belnord is a quaint hotel. The location was perfect for our one-night stay and short visit to Columbia University. Easy access to the subway, close to Central Park, plenty of restaurants nearby. Our room was tiny, as expected. Two twin beds took up almost all the floorspace in the room. The bathroom was also very small but well-designed. The room and bathroom were spotlessly clean. These accommodations were fine for two average-size adults, but I think anyone trending larger (more than 6 feet tall, or more than about 180 pounds?) might be uncomfortable in the small space. The desk staff was friendly but a bit slow-moving and inefficient. The hotel offered a luggage room for storage before and after checkout, which is very convenient. However, it's also the reason I didn't give 5 stars. When I arrived to drop off my luggage, the desk clerk didn't even ask my name or ask if I had a reservation...I could have been anyone off the street! So I was somewhat concerned that they were indiscriminately allowing anyone who showed up access to the room. And the storage room itself reeked of urine. Overall, a great place to stay if you avoid the storage room and know what to expect with the size of the room.

Very well located, just 1 minute walk from the subway! Many shops around, including places to eat. It has free working wifi, and people working there are very nice. They take your packages without charging for it, and they had a great value shuttle to the airport. The only inconvenient is that the room is VERY small but, oh well, you're in New York City, you just need a place to crash. I'd stay there again.

We knew to expect a small room, but this time our room was exceptionally small - we could barely move around the room as there was nowhere to store our suitcases. Closet space was limited to say the least, don't bother unpacking. However, the bed was comfortable but would have been very small for a person above average height. Aircon worked but it was very noisy. The view from our window was towards the building next door, which made the room even more closet-like (because of this we kept the courtain closed).Bathroom was ok.Room was very clean and for us the wifi worked just fine. The biggest minus for Belnord Hotel is its staff who was very unpleasant, unwelcoming, unhelpful and even rude from the check-in to check-out. Only our maid was very nice.It is not that difficult to greet a person with a smile or even to make eye-contact. Also something more than a grunt would be nice when you ask for something.The location was good. The hotel is within walking-distance from Central Park, Metropolitan museum and museum of natural history, and close to nice restaurants and cafes such as Good Enough to Eat (excellent breakfast, really nice service and atmosphere!)This hotel is not top-notch, but for us it was what we needed: a comfortable and well-located place to sleep. We did not come to New York to spend our time in a hotel and neither should you (if you choose this hotel).

We recently stayed here for 3 nights and loved every minute of it!Yes, the rooms are very small but adequate, comfortable and very clean. If you want a massive room, pay for a 5 star hotel!!We used the room to sleep and shower in and spent all our time taking in this mad yet fantastic city.The staff were extremely helpful and we stayed in room 510. Whilst the wi-fi took some messing to connect, plus the annoying changing of the password every day, once connected the wi-fi was very good.As in earlier reviews, the hotel is in an excellent place set within a residential area. Central Park is a 10 minute walk away and the nearest subway is literally around the corner 3 minutes walk away.The hotel is just around the corner from Broadway on the upper west side where you can find many places to eat all kinds of meals, even 24 hour diners, shops, supermarkets and a few pubs. We liked the "parlour" Irish bar just around the corner on 86 street and also the "hot and crusty" breakfast deli, which was excellent. Not Starbucks, but why come to New York to go to such sterile cafes? Experience the local Fayre!!!Bloomingdales are opening an outlet this weekend and this is a 15 minute walk down Broadway.So in a nutshell, yes rooms are very small but reviews should be based on the accommodation as advertised and no way does this hotel purport to be a 5 star establishment. We stay in 5 star resorts for our main holiday each year but this hotel totally hit the spot with us. We thought ON THE WHOLE it was excellent, well placed and great value for money.Can also recommend the "go" airport shuttle, contact details in the photo, and at 21 dollars per person, this was a great way to go back to Newark airport and half the price of a yellow cab. The driver was a really nice guy!Other recommendations were the 9/11 national memorial which was very moving and very well done. Favourite up high experience was top of the rock because whilst Empire State Building was good, the rock looks at the ESB so you also get great views of that. Do these at day and night.Glad we did one World Trade CenterAnd went to the top but whilst it's high, and unique, we felt like they just wanted to sell you more and more and it spoiled it. ESB try and sell you photos etc but at least the staff are really nice.....Final recommendation is the New York City pass (the red and black one). We got one of these and found it excellent value!!!

Although the location is very good, do not waste your money there. We had to go to the nearest Starbucks every morning to use the WIFI. The staff was very rude and impolite. Moreover the rooms are very small, which is very uncomfortable for a long stay.

This hotel was conveniently located right off of Broadway and 87th street on the upper West Side. The #1 subway line was just around the corner on Broadway and 86th. I had read other reviews about how small the rooms were at this hotel and I was slightly worried, but it wasn't a problem at all. Yes, the room was small. But it was super clean, the bathroom towels were soft and plush, the shower was better than my own at home and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel offered free Wifi. We spent hardly any time in the hotel because we were out sightseeing and experiencing as much of New York City as we could. We were only in New York for 4 days so why waste it in the hotel room? We were in room 318 on the 3rd floor. There was a small window in our room that looked out to the building next door--no view--but I wasn't looking for one, nor did I want to pay for one! Our room had a small closet with hangers and shelving for clothing if you wanted to unpack your suitcase. Our bathroom, while small, did have a tub and a great shower. The staff was pleasant and there was a luggage room to store our bags for the day when we checked out of the hotel so we could sightsee the rest of the day without our bags before our evening flight home. I loved the location of this hotel because it is very close to the New York Historical Society, Central Park and the Natural History Museum. Across the park is the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Additionally, the location is quiet and there were lots of good restaurants in the area. I would stay here again without a second thought!

Wonderful location on the Upper West Side. Close to subway, Central Park, and many nice eateries. Tiny room but clean and comfortable. Check in was pleasant and the front desk was helpful. Would stay here again - affordable for location. Quiet spot!

It is repeated many times on Tripadvisor that the rooms in this hotel are small, so we considered ourselves warned. But come on, they are not just small, they are miniature! Matchbox-size. You can touch the door from the bed. There is no room to open your suitcase. It was claustrophobic staying here. If you don't mind a tiny, tiny room - that is really more like a hostel room than a hotel room - the location is good. But boy, were we disappointed (knowing full well that New York rooms are on the small side).

I stayed at hotel just a day and it was a smart choice for me - small room, wifi, good location, good price, convenient for one person! I recommended it ! Helpful staff, luggage storage, one hour more to do checkout in comparison with others hotels stars!Only one complain - no wheelchair access! In my opinion it was obligatory thing in all the hotels!

The hotel is located in a fantastic area. There are literally all types of food options (open late) within a few minutes walk. There is also a Starbucks about 50 yards from the entrance. The subway access is wonderful and very close (only a block away). Central park is only a few minutes walk away. The area as a whole is super safe and well traveled at all times. The rooms (we stayed in a deluxe double) are extremely small, but perfect for the essentials. The room is literally the bed and a small space around it to walk. The bathroom is small as well, but usable. Everything is great as long as you aren't expecting to do yoga in there. The staff was nice, and the room was very clean.

Recently enjoyed a 5 night stay at the Belnord with my 9 year old son. We stayed in a recently renovated bunk room which was small but very clean & very practical. It was a perfect fit for the 2 of us.Our room had everything we needed tv, wifi, in room safe, toilet & shower. Yes it is small but you don't visit New York to sit in your hotel room.We found the hotel staff to be very friendly & helpful.The hotel is well located close to restaurants On Broadway & even closer to the subway which was just On the corner. For us it was in a perfect position in a quiet & safe area of the upper west side.Would definitely return when visiting New York in the future.

It is located in a lively area, the upper west. There are plenty of shops, rests, and subway at 1block. 3 blocks from Central Park. The room was neat and clean, it seemed renewed. Though it was tiny, we found it comfortable enough for 3 nights. No noise, good rest. They offer tours and arrange transfer to airpots at a charge. We would go back!

As others mentioned, the rooms are tiny. We struggled to store our 3 pieces of luggage. There is a closet and some drawers that were helpful. But I don't come to NYC to be in a hotel room.Otherwise - very clean and comfortable. Free wifi worked well.Location was convenient, a couple blocks from subway and all other amenities.Room was surprisingly quiet and we were not disturbed by other guests.Don't expect to check in before 2pm although they can store luggage - slight inconvenience and suspect could be regular policy.

Two star for the location. One block away from 86th street station which is good. The area where it is located seems safe and CVS and Bank of America are close by. The room where they kept our luggages before we checked in smelled like piss. It was disgusting. Our room is very small, much smaller than the standard hotel room in Japan. It was clean though and for me that's all that matter except my husband is tall and he had a hard time using the toilet because of the limited space. Front desk staffs weren't so accomodating. They did not even acknowledge us every time we came and went in the hotel. Anyway, we'll never stay again next time we're at NYC.

One week in a cold (very cold!) winter.Hotel close to metro, very clean and where you can decide your own room temperature. It's possible to let your baggage in a storage inside the hotel even after your check out, perfect for enjoy the hours before your plane. Staff very kind, not too chatty but for us was ok!

We were looking for a budget hotel in Manhattan as we just wanted a quick getaway to our favourite city. We ended up settling on this hotel mainly because of its location and convenience. In fact, it's about 5 minutes away from Central Park and 2 minutes from a subway station. We booked on Hotels.com with a coupon and checking in was absolutely no problem. I'll reiterate what all the reviews say - the rooms are small! Having stayed in Manhattan at other hotels, I knew to expect small rooms but this seemed to be the smallest we've stayed in. There was barely any space in the room beside the bed which made exiting the room a bit awkward. However, it was a clean hotel and did the job for what we wanted it for: a safe and clean place to sleep.

The Belnord was a great spot for us. It had a small room but was very clean and comfortable. It was in a great location for us. Close to Central Park with excellent restaurants near by. The subway is a short distance away.

Booked through Expedia - mistake. The browser or Expedia site messed up and I got a booking two weeks later than needed. I emailed the hotel (was in Peru and couldn't call immediately), no reply. I phoned a few hours later, Belnord staff weren't interested in helping and told me to contact Expedia. I called Expedia, they said they'd call Belnord to amend, unfortunately I was cut off before the end of the call (ran out of coins at a Peruvian pay phone at the airport). After arriving at New York the next morning I went to the hotel expecting that Expedia had solved the problem - the staff at Belnord were unhelpful and fairly rude. They asked why I'd gone to the hotel and why hadn't I called from the airport (try finding a pay phone in JFK that works, I didn't have access to a US mobile phone). They said I should call Expedia again - but refused to let me use the phone in their lobby, and said there's a pay phone around the block that I could use. I did that - while I called Expedia again, my wife remained in the lobby at Belnord and heard their side of the call when the Expedia rep called them again. Mario from Belnord hotel told the Expedia rep "it's their problem", and refused to amend or refund the booking. When I went back to the hotel he told me that the hotel will only amend a booking "if someone dies". He said I'd need to call Expedia again the next day at 8am, and get them to speak to his boss (Armando).It was clear that the Belnord staff had no intention of helping, and couldn't care less that I didn't have a room for the night, and would probably waste $180 on a booking that I couldn't even use. After that I left the hotel and found a Starbucks a few blocks away to search for another hotel. The next morning I called Expedia again at 8am. Their rep tried to speak to Armando, but was put to voicemail. I raised a complaint with Expedia, they said they'd make it a "supervisor level query", and that a supervisor would try again to speak to Armando. Nothing came of this. I had a lengthy conversation with the Expedia rep, he confirmed (looking at notes on their system) that an Expedia rep had spoken to Belnord Hotel when I called from Peru - they'd refused to amend the booking date, even though they had a room available at the time. The booking was a waste of time and money. My trip to New York started on a very sour note thanks to the unhelpful staff at Belnord, and Expedia. My booking was clearly in error, two weeks earlier than needed. Probably something went wrong with the browser or website, when I first tried to pay the Expedia website stated that the fee had changed by 10 cents - second time I tried to pay it changed another 10 cents. Third time the payment went through, I guess that somewhere in that process the booking date reverted to the website default (two weeks in the future) and things went wrong. Have nothing to do with Belnord Hotel if at all possible. I sent several emails and haven't had a reply.

For what they charge one would expect that you would at least get a room which is larger than a dog kennel!!!!The room, while clean, was so small that two people could under no circumstances move around at the same timeA disgrace, to say the least

stayed here for 4 nights, room small but on the plus side had it's own bathroom, again small. Room clean bed comfortable, hotel staff very helpful & accommodating, nothing too much trouble for them. Lots of good restaurants & diners nearby, price was high for what you got but think that was due to the pope being in town

This hotel is quaint to say the least...but comfortable. The rooms are extremely small, but if you just need a place to lay your head, it gets the job done. The bathrooms are normal size, but the rooms basically just fit the bed. There are no dressers, just a closet rod and a shelf to keep your belongings. The service was good and we did not have any issues while we were there.

The hotel is in a great location relative to restaurants, the subway and Central Park. I would love to stay in the same location. The hotel room was pretty clean, but we did find a hair clip between the bedsheets, which was a little off putting. There is free WiFi, but it's mediocre. Was able to use it to check in to the flights, but couldn't stream any video. The staff was competent, but not overly friendly. Not to say they were unfriendly, but just were not overly interested in their job. Every time I came to the front desk, they were on their cell phones.The biggest issue we had was that we booked a room for two but was given a twin bed. A twin bed is not sufficient for 2 grown adults, and we were obviously given the wrong room. In summary, great location, pretty clean, but needs to be friendlier and ensure the room size is appropriate. Would stay again if I knew I had the right bed size for 2.

My girlfriend and I stayed at the Belnord for 4 nights as part of our trip around the US. Upon arrival we were greeted politely and given some tips about local restaurants/shops.The room, as all the other reviews mention, was very very small. It was a struggle to find floor space for our cases, and still be able to open the door fully! That being said, we managed fine, and for the price what do you expect? Plus, the point of our trip was to explore the city, and not stay in the room for 4 days!A MASSIVE plus is the location - just a 2 minute walk to the subway station, which takes you straight into Times Square in less than 10 mins, or all the way down to the Brooklyn Bridge in less than 20! Central Park is just a short walk from here too.We would definitely consider staying here again if we returned to New York, and would recommend the hotel to anyone!Stayed here August 24th 2015 for 4 nights

We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights. The room- bunk bed room- was very cute and clean.it was a bit small, but it really didn't matter to us. The wifi had some problems.The main problem was the SHUTTLE.We were offerd the shuttle by the hotel. They arrived 25 minutes late and the driver argued with me about the delay. The car was very crowded. Even worse, he didn't gave me all the change from the amount i gave him and kept the coins to himself. SO RUDE. The price is triple the one you would pay for public transportation and the expirience is terrible!!!

Our favourite hotel in Manhattan's lovely Upper West. Belnord Hotel has a superb location in a quiet, safe, family-friendly and accessible part of New York City. The rooms are fairly small, as is the way in the Big Apple and lack a refrigerator, microwave and business centre facilities etc. However, the location is close to perfect for a stress-free stay in a leafy area, close to Central Park and Broadway. The hotel is well priced, clean, close to cafe's and trains and we have never had any problems with the free wifi.

Booked a double room (full size bed) at the Belnord for an extended Labor Day weekend while visiting the U.S. Open.Like others have mentioned, it is tiny. The pictures that are posted make it look bigger than what it actually is. If you need a decent amount of space or have a lot of luggage- I don't recommend the standard double room. I'm a low maintenance traveler and spend very little time in the room- so it wasn't an issue with me. This was the only hotel in Manhattan in my budget that had a private bathroom. The space is well accounted for and ergonomical. Staff was efficient and the room was spotless. The 1 Subway is across the street.

This may be the perfect budget hotel for a short stay in NYC for pleasure, however I would not recommend for business if you enjoy sleep or need a desk to work. The room is the size of a college dorm, I could not open my suitcase up inside the room and move around or exit. Luckily, my suitcase fit in the closet with the top open. The room appeared to be recently updated, bed comfortable with clean sheets. Everything was very clean which for me is huge. But walls are very thin and people were walking up and down the halls and speaking loudly late into the night which made it difficult to sleep. Also, I booked the hotel through hotels.com and selected "pay at hotel" option, however they still automatically charged me for one night. When I checked in, they charged me the full amount including the one night that they had already charged me for. I returned to the desk once I had figured this out and they refunded me the additional charge without any problems. The service is not the friendliest but not horrible.

We stayed there for one week. The location was very convenient and very well connected to downtown and many touristic attractions. We have to say that both the room and the bathroom we're incredibly clean so that they were shining and you put smell the "cleaness". However, there is a huge caveat about this structure that is its management. In fact, we booked a room for 2 adults and when we checked in we got a very small bed in which we couldn't fit. The manager claimed we booked a full size bed and that was the bed we got but that wasn't true! We made him notice that not only the bed was very narrow but also that our feet didn't fit (and we aren't tall at all, being less than 5 and 8 tall)!!! You know what the manager replied to us? TO SLEEP WITHOUT PILLOWS so to gain extra space!!! When we complained about his helpless answers and his rudness he barked at us we could buy an upgrade to a queen size bed (this was the bed size we originally booked online) for a price that was more than the price we already paid for the room. This is cheating and poor customer service aimed at attempting frauds at tourists' expenses.

I booked a mid September trip to The Belnord on August 11th choosing the "pay at hotel" option on the booking web site. The Belnord same day charged my credit card one nites stay, when the booking choice option stated "total amont charged at check-in unless no show". When the charge appeared on my credit card, I called The Belnord and was told this pending charge was a mistake and would be removed prior to posting. I then also canceled my reservation at The Belnord as a result of their card charge mistake. The charge remained on my card as pending, then went through as an actual charge two days after the cancellation. When The Belnord was informed that the charge was now no longer pending and an actual charge to my card, they agreed to refund within 5-10 days. The charge should have never been pending let alone actual based on the terms of the reservation, and the 5-10 day wait period for the credit is unacceptable-24 hours is acceptable. Appears The Belnord is managing cash float on guest reservation charges. So if you book a reservation at The Belnord, and choose the "pay at hotel" option, expect to be charged upfront at least one nites stay, and if you cancel do not expect a refund prior to 5-10 days. I hope you have a better experience with The Belnord than I have.

Like everyone else has said , tiny room with loud AC and thin walls. Close to subway and Central Park. 50 cents (exact change not given at the desk) will get you coffee. Hot and Crusty deli and bakery is close and has good sandwiches. Just say no to the driver the hotel will call for you. Almost hit 4 people and constantly honking the horn.

Reasonable price considering the great location. Our room was small but comfortable and absolutely spotless. Perfectly cleaned every day. Small but surprisingly comfortable bathroom, I believe it has been newly renovated. Friendly and helpful staff. Free and decent wifi. Only two major complaints: 1. the extremely bright bluish-white lighting even in the bedside lamps.2. Very loud AC.

Just a double bed, bathroom and a TV. All I needed while on vacation on the Upper West side of Manhattan. Just kiddy corner from the 1 line to downtown. I had a great time. The 1 line had stops at 42nd street (Times Square), Penn Station, Brooklyn and Bronx. A weekend vacation. Saw Mamma Mia and Fish in the Hand. Also went to World Trade Center.
user_name:
Michael B
Greenwood Village, Colorado, United States

review_body: Like the rest of these reviews I can't say enough how small the rooms are. So if you are looking for some room to spread out perhaps find something else. The rooms are clean however and the neighbourhood is a great part of NYC. A couple of blocks to 3 subway lines and Central Park is a shot walk.

I booked the room in Belnord hotel through Expedia. When arrived, I was a little bit surprised with tiny room and super tiny bathroom. But sheets and towels were clean (bed cover was not though) and for one night I considered this place to be more or less fine.At night, when most people returned to their rooms we got a lot of noise. The loudest was from outside AC unit. And a vibration, too. It was impossible to sleep at all. I would like to stress that even for deaf person it matters since low-frequency noise and vibration are unhealthy. Personnel that had come to our room to check upon the complain totally agreed that it is impossible to sleep and unhealthy to stay. The comment from front desk was: "No other room to put you to, no refund available. You may stay or you may leave, that is your decision". What is a shame! We left this 'hotel' at midnight and hired another one. Stay away from Belnord - this facility is bad and unhealthy.
user_name:
Gregory B
Boston, Massachusetts, United States

review_body: A newly renovated hotel on the upper westside of Manhattan. The hotel is in a great neighborhood with any service you could dream of. Zebra's is 8 blocks south. You can bring your family here.The lobby is inviting the staff is attentive. I was upgraded to a room with a queen size bed since my original choice was unavailable. The rooms are very small mine was about12"x14" not counting the bathroom. It was clean and tastefully decorated. The bathroom is manageable with a great shower. I am 6'4" so i had some difficulty bending over to get the shaving soap off my face using the sink. If you will be spending a great deal of time in your room or are claustrophobic this is not the place for you. But if you're in New York City to be out and about and plan to only sleep in the room the Belnord is a find.What's the worst? The internet service. In my room i measured 0.4MB down and 0.25MB up speed, This is barely enough for email.

My daughter and stayed at the Belnord July 23. The hotel was VERY clean, the rooms were priced great and very clean. The staff was awesome. Jonathan, Christian and Tracey were especially friendly and very helpful. We will stay again! Price was great considering the location.

Quiet room and great neighborhood, near transportation and restaurants. If you are over 5'5" tall you may find it a challenge to maneuver in the tiny space and tinier bathroom. Lots of international travelers. This is not a hotel you hang out in. But who spends time in their room when Manhattan is out the front door?

Not much to say about the Belnord except that one needs to remember that one gets what one pays for. Room 205 was tiny with little space to go around the bed. The bathroom only fits one person at a time and the sink is doll size. Blocked window with view on a wall. The worst part were the vibrations and the noise coming from an A/C unit seemingly placed under the bed (on the ceiling of the floor below probably). I would avoid room 205. Also, no real coffee and tea available. Only a machine. Not sure why the two staff at the reception cannot be tasked to make fresh coffe or tea. Does not take that much. Pros: location near 1 train, room condition and general cleaning, lack of sketchiness.

Excellent location, clean, but no breakfast. The room I stayed in was really tiny, but it is okay if you just need a place to sleep and shower. I stayed in a ground-floor room, but there is an elevator to the upper floors. Safe in the room. Also offers luggage storage. I have nothing to complain about.

The location and the price of this hotel go well together. It's a short metro ride from the centre of New York. The staff on the front desk were very helpful. The hotel is very cramped with thin corridors and tiny rooms. But what do you expect for the price and how close it is to the centre? The room was clean, but very small. We could barely move around the bed. Our room was placed on top of some kind of generator so I did not sleep well at all. I should have asked to been moved, but did not. The walls are very thin and you can hear people on the corridor throughout the night. I did not sleep well. Have some earplugs handy!

I booked the cheapest room at the Belnord hotel - a full size bed in a room. Other than the room NOT having a desk and chair, this was the BEST deal I've ever had in NYC. I had a 5 night business trip and trying to keep costs down. The location is superb and the air conditioner was ice cold. Nothing fancy but just what you need for a good night sleep. A few nights I got the room for only $112. This is an INCREDIBLE price for the location (1 block from 1 train on upper west side). Will definitely stay here on future NYC business trips!!!

As somebody mention this before, this hotel is very well located and it is very clean, however the space even for New York is very small. The main issue here is the staff. They were very rude at most times and didn't care for helping our assisting customers. I would say it has potential, however, it has to change their staff.

I wasn't sure what to expect from a "budget hotel", and for the most part, the Belnord was a great experience. Three of us booked rooms while we were in NYC for a conference at Columbia. I was in a newly renovated room, which was very clean and a decent sized space. There was enough space for a double bed, 2 small nightstands, a tiny table-desk, and a small closet. There was room under the bed for me to put my large piece of luggage. The bathroom was great, and the bathtub was super clean/new. It sounds like my friends' rooms were a bit smaller than mine, with standup showers and no closets. The one area that really needs improvement is the service at the front desk. The men who worked there didn't seem to care at all about their customers. A telephone call asking for the wifi password (which changes daily) was met with a mumbled response. Questions at the front desk were also met with grumbling and without smiles. It really could make the experience a lot better with friendlier staff, but I would stay at the Belnord again. It was close to the 86th/Broadway subway stop and lots of shopping and restaurants.

First and foremost, the hotel was extremely clean. The rooms were small, which is to be expected in Manhattan, but had everything that was needed, and were cleaned daily while we were out. The bedding and towels were all very clean and comfortable. As an added bonus...the subway was only 1 block away!! There were plenty of choices of food and shops very close by as well. This hotel is very affordable and totally exceeded my expectations. This was my first visit to NYC...and it was amazing!!

Just left today rooms are small but manageable as you won't but there much it's very clean , clean towels and bed made every day housekeeping do an amazing job ! Great location for subway and places nearby !Also just down the road cafe diner is amazing .

Your enjoyment of this place is going to greatly depend on your expectations. This is the smallest hotel room I have ever seen. I don't think I can accurately put into words just how small it truly is. We had the two twin bed room (and I honestly don't think the beds themselves were even truly twin sized) and there was enough room between the wall and the bed for one person to stand or walk. In the whole room only one person could be up and walking at a time, it's that small. There is JUST enough room between the bed and door for it to open. The only furniture in the room is the two beds and a nightstand...there's some drawers built into the front underside of the bed. There's room under the bed to put a suitcase and honestly that's the only way if you're traveling with one since there wouldn't be enough floor space for both walking and a suitcase. Picture the smallest room you can think of and then cut that in half. It is half the size of even my dorm room in college was.That said, all we were really looking for was a place to sleep at night and store our things, and this hotel certainly did that. Honestly how much time do you spend in a room anyway? The staff was friendly, it's in a fantastic neighborhood full of restaurants and has two 24 hour drug stores very close by, it's a short walk in a straight line to Central Park, and, perhaps most importantly, it's just around the corner from the subway. If the price is right, I would absolutely stay here again.

I think it is an excellent choice if what you want is bedrock-basic, comfortable, inexpensive lodging in that neighborhood. Why is the price low? Because the room is small; I didn't notice any other tradeoffs.This was my second visit. Both times I stayed in one of their "bunk bed rooms." Both times my experience was the same and fully met the expectations I formed from their photograph, which presented the (tiny) room accurately. Obviously this is not luxurious or romantic lodging. However I thought it surpassed name-brand budget chain hotels in everything but the size of the room.The thermostat and air conditioning worked well. The bathroom was small and had no tub, just a shower. The hot water was very slow to get hot but fine once it did. They provided a generous number of good towels. The room appeared almost brand new and the room and corridors were very clean. Only one chair was provided. There was a strange very minimal desk with perhaps a 1 by 4 foot desktop. Someone had given some thought to making the cramped quarters workable. A clever touch is that the overhead light can be controlled from the entry way or from EITHER bed. The WiFi worked well (but the password changes every night at midnight so be sure they give you a full set).The lower bunk was fine. The upper bunk was not so good because it was close to the ventilator and the temperature varies as the fan cycles. There is a little gooseneck LED reading lamp in each bunk, but none of them worked on either visit. The rooms were quiet, the mattress was good, and I slept well.The housekeeping and hotel staff were courteous and efficient. I decided to tip a little extra because it must be hard to make the upper bunk.

My husband and I traveled to NYC for fun. It was our first time visiting. We had done a lot of research trying to find a place to stay for four nights. I found this gem! Yes. The room was small, but many rooms in the city are small and we weren't planning to spend a lot of time in our room. It had a private bathroom with tub, shower and hair dryer. Good cable. A small closet with hangers and shelves. Security safe in room. Comfortable bed with extra blankets and pillows. Very clean. Staff were all helpful and responsive. We were able to store our luggage when we arrived early before our room was ready. Excellent location on the upper west side. Movie, You've Got Mail was shot in this neighborhood. We even ate at two of the eateries in the movie. An all night drug store close by. Good shopping. Museums are easy to get from this hotel. Subway and bus stops close by. Within walking distance of Central Park. Safe neighborhoods. If we go to NYC again we will stay again. Not one doubt.

By far the Belnord is the best, it is immaculate, the customer service was the best and location, location, location. I fee comfortable going up by my self with the ease and access of transportation. Yes the rooms are small but the cleanliness and hospitality made up for it. Did I mention we stayed in 5 star hotels that weren't as clean ! ! KUDOS to the Belnord and it's staff! I will be back.....

Extremely clean, renovated and very friendly and proffesional staff. After quite a few awful experiences with hotels in Manhattan staying at the Belnord has definetely made the difference. Great location as well, very close to Central Park, the John Lennon memorial, the Dakota Building, Amsterdam Ave and Broadway. There is a lot of good restaurants and nice terraces around to hang out. It is also very close to Colombus Circle where you can get the subway to go to the Financial District and the most important points of Manhattan. Awesome experience.

The hotel is situated in Upper West Side of Manhattan - not too far away from the subway which goes straight to the lower part of the Manhattan. I really liked the quit street with lots of shops, restaurants and coffee shops around. A Central park is only a few minutes by walk very close to the lake. The room we had was very tiny that only bed was able to fit in but nicely refurbished and we also had nice private bathroom with a good size and excellent quality of egyptian towels etc.. The room was very clean I did not really find any dirt but only wondered if duvets are washed too as we only had plain duvet with a sheet under the duvet ( not a cover) I hope that duvets are washable too as I cant imagine to sleep under the unwashed duvet!! The bed was excellent but did not like the shelves under the bed as due to the size of the room we stumbled over the bed all the time and ended up with some injuries. The floor we stayed in also had a small kitchen with shelves, fridge, sink and also filter water boiler with paper cups etc. - which was a great bonus! The hotel is also offering budget rooms with shared bathroom or I think there also update for bigger rooms. The staff was very nice and fun and always willing to help. Wifi was ok. Breakfast is not served in the hotel but lots of diners etc to go close to the hotel The price was ok too as it is not as central but safe and quit. I do recommend this hotel!

The Belnord Hotel provided me with an excellent base on my recent trip to New York. I booked because of its great price for a room which had private bathrooms. The room itself was very comfortable, others have commented that they are small but you don't spend much time in your room in New York anyway so it is not a problem! Room and rest of the hotel I saw were very clean. Could hear other guests returning to rooms and when the guests next door were using their shower but apart from that it was very quiet, no street noise (but I was on top floor!) All staff were very friendly, always said good morning and when I needed help with fixing a some equipment they were more than happy to help! Great location, felt very safe walking around at night (female mid 20s travelling alone), friendly and clean neighbourhood. Close to 86th Broadway subway station. Amsterdam and Broadway both lovely to walk along to find places to eat. I definitely recommend heading for breakfast or desert at Sugar and Plumm on Amsterdam Avenue if you have a sweet tooth! Would stay here again!

It was a last miniute booking and the only one I could find under $400 with double beds. It was as clean and good for sleeping and keeping your stuff at and located in the upper west side which was nice. Better than expected and would book again just with more advance so can get lower price.
user_name:
Joshua S
Las Vegas, Nevada, United States

review_body: The Belnord is perfectly located in-between Amsterdam and Broadway. It's a comfortable walk to Central Park, too. We were welcomed by the lobby and check-in staff. They were very nice and helpful throughout our stay.We stayed on the first floor near the rear of the hotel. Quiet and away from the elevator. Without experiencing any of the other rooms, Room 111 was small. The queen-sized bed had clearance of about 1.5 ft along 2 sides of the bed while the the 3rd accessible wall, had enough room to comfortably move around and access the small well-appointed washroom. There was virtually no room to store clothing on any shelves. Hangers were available to hang some clothes but the small enclosure left little room for anything else.The TV was new and had all of the channels anyone wanting to see could see. The room was clean, current and well-maintained.There is a small business room (2 PCs and printer) to access the Internet or work on documents. I asked them if I could create a boarding pass when needed. The service was available but for a fee. This should be complimentary. I printed it elsewhere. A nice feature in the lobby was an electronic display of arrivals and departures from the airports. Very nice.One final note. This is a micro-hotel in a great area near the subway, great restaurants, shopping, etc. The maid service was very efficient amd pleasant. Our hallway was pretty narrow so moving on the floor must be equally challenging for them, too. We will return but in a larger room, if available.

My wife and I have stayed here 4 separate times while visiting our daughter, the rooms are small, but this seems to be typical for the city. Beds are a welcome respite after touring around NYC, showers are very nice, TV is just right, staff is always nice and willing to help with any problems. Location is close to subway, Central Park and Riverside Park, plenty of places to eat within a short walk, attracts many visitors from overseas.
user_name:
David L
High Point, North Carolina

review_body: It's a great location, close to center and metro station. Rooms are too small but they are pretty clean. Staff is ok. Price is more than expected however I would prefer to stay if I go to NY again :) If you want to utilize the hotel room just for sleeping and taking a shower it is a suitable place for your vacation.

Hemingway did not stay at the Belnord. No poems will be written about It; no honeymooners will have their pictures taken there.But here's the thing. A bed is a bed. Once you turn your lights out you can pretend to be at the Plaza or the Waldorf.It's clean. It's safe. It's close to any form of transportation. What else is there?Oh. The rooms are almost comically tiny. I mean tiny, like the size of a large walk-in closet. Perfect for Hobbits. And my room didn't even have a closet. Ask about getting one.I advise that you book over the internet. If you call them directly to book, the staff is so busy that they'll tell you to do this anyway.I used to live in New York and the location is superb. In an ironic way, hotels like these are for the truly sophisticated traveler who would rather spend their money on fine meals, museums, or shopping. As far as the rates go, pretty steep for what you get (if traveling alone.) If there are two of you, then it works out better--about $100 bucks or so each.Good luck and enjoy your stay in New York! For fun, walk by The Plaza and enjoy the fact that those folks are paying over $1000 a night more for essentially the same thing....A bed.

Our 4 night stay at the Belnord was okay. Location was great, across the road from the subway and a few blocks walk to Central Park. The area was very safe, we walked home late at night and were fine. The room was extremely small, the smallest hotel room I've ever been in. It was just big enough to fit the bed and that was about it! However it was clean and thd shower was good. Could do with some new bed linens though. Our room key card didn't work on the second day, apparently storing them next to mobile phones demagnetises them which was rather annoying. They were also doing construction in some rooms on our floor - it would have been nice to have been told this when we checked in. Heaters are very loud and make the whole floor vibrate! There is a luggage room to store your bags if you have a late flight after checking out which was good. Wifi is a bit annoying - they change the password each day so we had to go and ask for it. The hotel was fine for a few nights and nice to come home to a clean room each night.

My parents, my wife and I visited Belnord hotel in April 2015. We had 2 rooms with double bed booked via Expedia. On checking in, it appeared that the hotel was over booked and they did not have rooms that we reserved. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating though.The room heater produced loud noises at regular intervals throughout the night. So bad that the room floor was vibrating!The hotel is well situated for public transportation and minutes away from Central Park.

The Belnord Hotel is in a great neighborhood, the Upper West Side, replete with amazing restaurants, bars and sights to see. The Belnord Hotel is a VERY basic establishment with rooms the size of a college dorm room and very few amenities. However, the hotel is very clean and usually very inexpensive, so if you know what you're getting, you should be pleasantly surprised. It is a good choice for a single budget conscious traveler, but I honestly don't see how two people could stay in the same room.

I stayed at the Belnord at a recent trip to NYC with my boyfriend... the location is perfect. 2 blocks off Central Park, right near bagel and breakfast spots for a quick yummy meal before setting out in the morning. Good neighborhood, very very clean rooms, helpful service. Front desk staff gave good local recommendations and staff answered requests for extra blanket and iron very promptly (brought a heated blanket, too). Rooms ARE small, but honestly, if you are not looking for a swanky hotel and trying to budget, this hotel is perfect for a place to sleep and regroup at the end of a busy day. Only hiccup was when I first called to confirm they could not find my reservation... a simple clerical error, but their reservation system did seem a bit unorganized. Confirm early and be specific in your requests if you are a detail orientated traveler.

Pros,,, Location, friendly staff, overall cleanliness! Well organised!Small, but for the price and location, I didn't mind!Also if it's just one or two people, and you just need a place to sleep, the size doesn't matter!It's New York anyways, you don't go there to sit in the room!Shower tap needs a bit getting used to, (but maybe that's just me)And the water in the shower should be able to be drained quicker, (just a small something the management should look at)The bedding etc was a little old, but the important thing is, it was clean!

All the reviews here about Belford are extremely accurate. Almost everything I read here happened to me, so it meets all I expected.Location: perfect! Subway station just around the corner. Countless excellent restaurants around. 24hrs CVS a block away. Museum of natural history and central park within mind of walking. And a very beautiful, quiet and safe neighborhood. Room: tiny as I read, so the size didn't bother me at all. And the maid surprise me daily with the excellent cleaning Job. And I got a room at the end of the hallway, so it's very quiet.wifi: funky at times, but works well in general. Front desk: some are "rude" as I read, some are nice, and they always got the job done, that's all it matters to me.

My boyfriend and I stayed here for 5 days and 4 nights. It was definitely the cleanest hotel I've ever been in. Lovely staff, 24 hour service and they were very helpful. The street we stayed on was quiet and safe, there were times when we walked back to our hotel after midnight and felt safe. The hotel has parking available with a discount that they give you that's the next street over (not far at all) but we did parking though SpotHero instead, which was in the same lot on 88th street and was $10 cheaper. So if you like cheap, then I would suggest downloading that free app. Once you step out of your hotel Central Park is to the left and to the right is Broadway which takes you to the subway, literally a 2 min walk away right on 86th street, the 1 takes you straight downtown. Also, we requested a handicap room because we seen reviews that said the rooms were terribly small, so please "Request a Handicap Room" they will let you do so. Just check and make sure your room is still available a couple days before you check in. The only negative was there was no fridge or a microwave, but they had a ice machine in the basement. Overall we loved the hotel and we'll definitely stay again.

From the looks of it, the Belnord looks like a hotel. The lobby was furnished and there were a couple of receptionists that weren't even surprised to see us, while their eyes were glued to their online browsing/reading when we arrived. I knew from previous posts to ask for a higher floor, since these rooms were recently renovated. We arrived on the 5th floor and opened the door to our room. It was the tiniest room, more like a we've ever been in. It's feels more like a very large walk-in closet. The beds looked like the ones I've had at a recent stay at hostel in Chicago, and we couldn't both hang up our things. We had to take turns to move around the room. For the comfort splurge for an extra $30-50 per night and get a room you can actually relax in. You won't be sorry.

The location was amazing! Takes literally 1 min (if not less) to walk to the metro station. I was also happy about free wifi since a lot of NYC hotels don't offer it. The room was clean and looked nice. It was rather small but I didn't need more space. No problems whatsoever.

the room was really small, the smallest I've ever been, the location was ok, it was 1 block away from the subway, but it didn't worth the price. The employee at the front desk was rude and arrogant, I didn't have a bad time because I was always out, but I don't really recommend this place
user_name:
Giuliano M
New Paltz, New York

review_body: The room is pretty small, but between us - who comes to NYC to spend time at the hotel?It's pretty close to central park and the metro station, which makes its location excellent.There are no meals included, but I wanted to try some of New York's foods anyway.The room was clean and tidy, the staff are very nice and helpful.There is also free Wi-Fi, and paid internet at the lobby with the option to print (like the discount vouchers I decided to buy while staying there).The price was reasonable as well.The only bad thing was the loud A/C.On my next trip to NYC, I would most definitely consider staying at that hotel again.

Went with a friend. Had a very small room with 2 twin beds and a tiny bathroom. Very clean lobby and rooms. Price was right $125. Located on a quiet street one block from Broadway and 3 blocks from Central Park. 2 women walked home at midnight and felt safe. Will definitely try again.

Got an excellent rate and was afraid it would be too good to be true, but I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is in a great location - quiet, safe neighborhood and only a few blocks from Zabar's. The front desk clerk was pleasant and assured me that the desk was staffed 24 hours a day. The room was the smallest I have ever stayed in; I wouldn't recommend it for more than a night or two at most, particularly for two people. It suited me fine as a place to crash by myself for the night after spending the day in the city. The room was extremely clean. The bed, however, wasn't very comfortable, and the linens desperately need to be updated - they still use bedspreads and the sheets were a little on the scratchy side. I would definitely stay here again, however, because overall it was a great value.

The location of the hotel is fantastic. The Subway (86 Street on the 1 line) is around the corner with direct access to downtown Manhattan. There is a good choice of very reasonable places to eat within a few minutes walk...City Diner, Big Daddy's, French Roast, Edgars Cafe, Cafe 82 and many more. The hotel is small and easily accessible. The staff are friendly and happy to help with giving recommendations for places to shop and eat as well as directions to the many sights. The rooms are compact...but big enough and with all the necessary facilities you need for a comfortable stay. The rooms are quiet and the bed very comfortable. The whole hotel is spotlessly clean. The bathroom has a full bath, shower, hair dryer and lots of thick towels!I've visited New York many times and this was my first stay at this hotel but because of it's location, friendly staff and cleanliness this is where I'll be staying on future trips. Really pleased I've found this hotel. Thanks to everyone there for making my stay such a good one.

This is a basic, budget hotel in the upper west side. The neighborhood is nice/safe/clean. The lobby is quaint, efficient, and clean. The double bed guestroom we had was #201. It was spotless, had a closet, safe, desk, and full bath. The room is small 10 X10ish. The bathroom is small 3 X 4ish. Hence it is a very small area to be in for any length of time. With that said, the positives outweighed the tiny area because we were there to be out and about not in the room. My daughter and I managed the space. It would be better for one person. Two people is pushing it. I'm glad we stayed here. The desk staff was over and above in the helpful department. The cleaning staff keeps this place spotless. If you're ok w/ a tiny room w/ budget ammenities/ prices this is a gem!

I have been staying here for many years. It is PERFECT for my travel needs when I come to New York. The rates have always been very good and consistent. Good Location for public Transportation. Several excellent restaurants in the area (my favorite, La Mirabelle) and there is an excellent breakfast place one block away.

Rooms are being remodeled on 5th-6th floors. Spacious twin rooms at this neighborhood hotel. We love room 514. Good space with closet, drawers, and shower. Value is good too for what you pay on the UWS. Al and Tracy are great at the front desk. Good restaurants in the hood : Milling Room- great fish and steaks-BYOB on Tues night, Bodrum-half off wine bottles on Monday night with good pizzas, Ala Mashi Indian food BYOB, and Buster's Cafe BYOB any day with great fish and chicken at 104/AMS. The B cafe is good too.

My wife and I stayed here when we wanted to spend a weekend on the upper west side. We had a double room, and it was extremely tiny. There was a bed, and about a foot of floor space around it. Everything was clean, and the bathroom was new so we were happy. The prices were pretty cheap so if you're just looking for a place to sleep and don't have much luggage, this place will do just fine.

Stayed in October for a week. Room is basic but nothing out of the ordinary for New York. Overall very happy with it and the location was great, right next to the subways and nice restaurants nearby too. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

I was very worried about booking this hotel but was really impressed. Was met by very friendly staff - who informed me that they were a goo hotel, clean and up to date although up front they said the rooms were on the smaller side. I do a lot of traveling and am in NYC every week and have been choosing to overnight in NJ and train in because of the cost of hotels. Taking into consideration the cheaper price of hotels in NJ and my train ride - this hotel is a winner. It is clean and neat! As I read somewhere it seems very European. I am a taller person and the rooms are probably below average in size - but then having a large hotel room is a waste. Might be a bit tight in the bathroom and the only slightly negative I have is that you might need a desk if you plan on working. But really impressed - great place and great price!!

This hotel is super tiny. And I'm a tiny person. However, the rooms are impeccably clean and the hotel feels secure. I spent just two days here and, any more than that, I'd probably get cabin fever but I enjoyed it overall.

Other reviewers shared that it was small...but I didn't appreciate quite how tiny it was! With two of us, it was a very tight squeeze and we had trouble opening our suitcases. It would be fine for a single person though, and other than the size, it was clean and comfortable and in a great location.

I stayed there for a week in Jan 2015.It was a REALLY small bedroom (the door hits the bed when you open it) but i think space is the best thing to sacrifice for a budget hotel in manhattan, so i won´t count it as a bad thing.The heater is very noisy it's better to turn it off when you are sleeping, but as the bedroom is very small it wasn't a problem for me (it was really cold outside, like -10° C, and i dind´t felt cold)It's located in the UWS where you can eat in a nice place or have a drink at anytime, and just across broadway you can take the metro 1 to downtown. The hotel is VERY clean.One suggestion: they have free wifi, but ask for the passwrd in the reception (not by the phone), cause they have a quite complicated sistem.I recommend it if you can get a good deal, and i'd go back.
user_name:
ElGaspo
Province of Buenos Aires, Argentina

review_body: I really enjoyed my stay at the Belnord Hotel. The housekeeping and desk staff are friendly and accommodating. It is private and quiet and located in a lovely NYC neighborhood of brownstones near Central Park. The hotel is super clean. The rooms are small and the bathrooms are a tight squeeze between the sink and tub for the big and tall guests. There are nice neighborhood restaurants and shops in the area. I am not an underground fan but Navigating the 1/express was extremely easy and I never needed a cab to get to Museums on 86th east, Broadway or bus and train stations. It is a super clean property with TV and WIFI. I prefer crisper, white sheets. The comforter had seen better days. It is a great value for NYC and I would choose the Beldnor over a chain property midtown because of the great location and personal service.
user_name:
Charlotte G
Warrenton, Virginia, United States

review_body: I stayed at belnord more than 30 times.... It's a good value for the money when everything else in nyc is insanely overpriced. The room is small, seriously, the smallest room I ever stayed in. I really recommend belnord because the location. I would stay there again, again, again.....

The room was small but we were out all day so only slept there. The staff were very friendly and the room was spotlessly clean. Great location, quiet and there were a couple of bars round the corner. 30 min walk to Times Square. Very near to Central park. The only real negative was the very LOUD heating system that tended to come on in the evenings. A convenient little shop round the corner proved handy for a nice cheap hit tea after a hard days walk in Manhattan!
user_name:
Matt O
Rhondda, Wales, United Kingdom

review_body: I really like it here. Sure, the rooms are small but it's clean, well priced, in a very quiet part of town and the staff are friendly. I think this place works best if you are out and about a lot and just use it as a place to sleep.

Very happy with this hotel. Close to Central Park & just round the corner from a subway station. Room was spacious & spotlessly clean. Staff helpful. We stayed 8 nights & would recommend to anyone looking for above average facilities at a sensible price for the area

Stayed here in October with a friend. Room was cramped, but was expecting this as it is New York. Hotel was very clean and wireless worked well.
