But staff at desk weren't particularly helpful and location is a good bit outside of city centre. Not much happeneing in way of bars and restaurants close to hotel. We booked very late so it was fine for us but I was going to New York again I would book early and book into Midtown.

The hotel in general was good. It was at a nice and safe location close to subway. The room on the other hand was very small... Basically just the bed. I had a hard time to place my luggage anywhere... Im not sure if all their rooms are that small though... I was suppose to get a room with 2 twin beds - at least that was on my reservation.. Maybe those are bigger.. This was 1 double bed. You stepped into the room and there is the bed. And thats it.And the AC/heating was incredibly noisy. 1st night i couldnt sleep from it at all... It was automatic, so whenever the room temperature fall beyond the given Fahrenheit, it started to work.. That means like every 30-40 minutes... Tried to turn it off one night but i was cold without it. Honestly i was cold even with it...And the walls must be very thin because i could hear the TV from the room across the hallway (!!) of my room. And basically heard every guest arriving on the floor during the day or late at night. These were the negatives otherwise it is okay, it was clean and safe i guess. And at least had its own bathroom...

Teachers going to conferences never have budgets to stay at pricey New York City hotels. The 2 weeks leading up to Christmas mean even more expensive hotels. This is the second time I've stayed at the Belnord for a Columbia University conference. Good points: very near the #1 subway line, very clean, near restaurants and drug stores, safe neighborhood. Weak points: famously small rooms and bathrooms. The desk staff was very courteous throughout my stay. Internet worked well wirelessly from my room.

We had a lovely stay at the Belnord hotel. We were given a lovely room.. Not as small as the other reviews describe so perhaps we were lucky! The free wifi is great and the hotel is very clean and well kept. We reported a problem with our toilet and it was seen to immediately and without hesitation. The hotel is one block from the subway on 86th street which is so convenient. There are several dinner and breakfast places in the area. We have no complaints and would recommend to anyone.

Room is small and our bed is only a double (full size). My husband is 6'3 and can lay across the bedroom part and nearly touch both walls and his feet kinda hang off the bed lol. We have absolutely no view but we're ok with it. But the bathroom is nice and updated, the room is clean, and it's SO quiet! You would never know you're in busy New York. Less than a block from Starbucks and in a safe area of the city. It's a great location. If you don't want to spend a lot of money and you won't be spending a great deal of time in the room then it's perfect.

The Belnord is conveniently located in the middle of Manhattan a block from a sub way station, plenty of restaurants and with in walking distance of Central Park. The building and room were clean and the staff was friendly and helpful enough. that along with the price are the upside of Belnord. It was the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in and the walls were thin so we heard every noise made by our neighbors or in the hall. It was nice for the price and location.

We stayed 3 nights there and didn't have a huge budget, so the hotel was perfect really. Well located and in a safe and relatively quiet area close to subways and Central Park, but the room was tiny. Staff were friendly. Overall, nothing too special, but clean, well located and good value for money.

I know New York is expensive, but surely there is more value in goodwill than in charging $2 for 10 minutes on a guest computer. On the flipside free wifi (so why charge for computer use?).As a hotel this is a fair choice, and has some positives. But think Singapore/Japan sized rooms with pokey bathrooms. Beds are designed for short Asians or dwarves - I've never encountered such short beds in a western hotel. Noisy air conditioning.Housekeeping was generally good. But surly staff at the front desk. A smile and positive attitude doesn't cost.No guest laundry.No I'd not really recommend the Belnord. But it's cheapish for NY and close to 86th Street subway station. But I wished I'd paid a little more for a better grade of hotel.

My husband and I stayed at the Belnord Hotel in New York during Thanksgiving. It was nice, quiet, and close to the subway. I was worried about the size of the room when I looked at the reviews. Yes, the room and bathroom were small, but we were there to see the Parade and tour the city so we barely spent time at the hotel. We had a double room and the bed was raised so we were able to put our suitcases underneath. The bathroom was small but all we needed was a shower with hot water, which we had. There was free wifi but it was really spotty. We have already talked about going back to New York and would most likely stay here again.

We stayed 2 nights at the Belnord in the upper west side of New York City. We had done our research before staying there and we're not surprised by the very small room. The room and the hotel are very well maintained although the bathroom sink is so small it is impossible to use it for more than brushing your teeth. The location is great, right between Amsterdam and Broadway and just a few blocks from Central Park. WARNING! The hotel has a deal with a car service and they charge at least $15 more per ride than a cab. I specifically asked for a taxi cab and they called the car service anyway, luckily I got a very nice driver who worked with me on the price but in the future I will walk the half a block to Broadway and hail a cab!

Great little hotel, small. there were two of us with two suitcases and that was all that was fitting in the room. We measured it, 9X7. the bathtub was the smallest I have ever seen but the water was good and hot. The room was very well appointed, the furnishings were great, it was just small. It is in a great location, close to the subway, Natural History Museum and a lot of shopping.

The Belnord Hotel was a very good location -- only one and one-half blocks from a Broadway subway station. Many inexpensive restaurants nearby.It was the smallest room I have ever seen -- just barely large enough to get around.

Location acceptable-not far from Central Park.Rooms too small,about 10-12m2,only for sleep in. Regarding the service and room size,price is unacceptabely high.Clean.No coffe,no hot water.Computer use,printing not free of charge. WIFI all right.

I had a bad experience with management of the hotel because through a computer glitch I had a duplicate booking. The rate I had booked was non-refundable and according to reports from Expedia, management was very rude every time they called. The hotel was fully booked when we arrived so I was able to get a refund on the double booking at check in. We ended up with a handicap room which meant that the room was actually the size of a full-size hotel room instead of the usual tiny rooms. We were really happy with the location and were satisfied with service during our stay. For more variety of restaurants head towards Columbia, there seemed to be a great selection there. The wi-fi was very spotty for at least two out of our six day stay.

I stayed at the Belnord while I was in NYC to run the marathon. It was very nice - our room was quiet and very clean and the hotel is in a great location, close to Central Park, the American Natural History Museum, lots of great places to eat, and subway stations. The rooms are small (and so are the beds and bathtubs). My spouse and I had a room with one double bed. My husband isn't that tall (5'10") but he had a hard time fitting in the bed. After the marathon, I took a nice hot bath, but the tub was pretty short. Still, the location made up for many of the other shortcomings.The free wifi worked intermittently and the hotel charges to use a computer in the lobby to print out boarding passes (or tickets to attractions).

Yes-the rooms are tiny. No space to hang out. But you're in New York. Go hang out somewhere else!!! Hotel and rooms were very clean and we had no problem with the staff. They are busy people trying to accomodate the entire hotel-be nice to them, they will be nice to you !!A couple blocks from Central Park, Starbucks around the corner and tons of little shops and local delis along the bordering streets. Subway entrances just down the street! I will stay here again and recomend this hotel to anyone who isnt interested in paying crazy prices!!

Conveniently located on the Upper West Side. The Belnord Hotel is typical of a European business hotel, with small but clean rooms, each with a private bathroom. Pricing was quite reasonable price for NYC.

While parking was stated as $37 per night, the parking garage was full and we paid $52 at a garage on our own. Smaller than full size bed and took up most of the room and if I were a large person would not have fit between bed and wall. Did not feel clean.

It is true that rooms are quite small, however in our room the bed was sufficiently high to place our luggage beneath it. The bed itself was extremely confortable; overall cleanliness was above expectations. There was no other furniture in the room other than bedside tables and a small closet. You would miss a desk if you needed to work.Wi-fi in the room was working well, same as the TV.Location is extremely convenient: metro just arount the corner, plenty of coffee places for breakfast or restaurants in the neighbourhood, close enough to Central Park.

I stayed for 2 nights.. The room card never worked. I keep complaint but only sent someone fixing it and it still did not work.....I always locked myself out. Asked for changing room, next day they offered me a room next to electric closet which always keep low tone noise....it is hotel with realy terrible service. I went down and up stairs more than ten times to ask for help because the room card never worked.....

I really enjoyed staying at Belnord. The hotel is centrally located, close to the subway, restaurants and also the park. The rooms are small, clean and well appointed. The internet was free and fantastic. If you don't want a small room - don't go here!! It was perfect for me. The staff was very kind. We had a small miscommunication and the manager cleared it up immediately. Wonderful place - I will definitely return here. The one area for improvement is the website - getting the system clearer and faster so that it is confirmed what the reservation actually is. It would help to add in a space to email the confirmation so that the client can see this.
user_location: La Fortuna de San Carlos, Costa Rica
user_name:
MSSCentroEspiralMana
La Fortuna de San Carlos, Costa Rica

review_body: Put pin prick in map in my price range and cane up trumps. Hotel was right at subway. 10 minutes to time square. Everything was on the doorstep and walked to central park. Hotel was in a street of brown nose houses. Lovely area.Staff were very welcoming and free wi fire. Rooms very clean.

The hotel is clean and the staff were polite; however, the rooms are extremely small, much smaller than a cruise ship cabin. Likewise the bathroom was big enough only for a slim person. There was a rack for hangers in the room but if you used it you could not walk around the bed.Worst of all we asked the reception to call us a cab. I expected a yellow cab. Instead a limo showed up. I asked the driver id he had a meter and he assured me that he did. it was only after all the luggage and four people were loaded that I realized that he did not have a meter. Furthermore he wanted $45 to take us to the cruise terminal which should be about $10. I refused to pay and we unloaded all the luggage. The hotel reception refused to call a yellow cab. I hailed one in the street.I fault the hotel for:a) not warning us that they were calling a limo and it would be much more expensive than a cabb) refusing to call a yellow cab c) being unable or unwilling to give me the number to call a cab myself.

We have stayed in Manhattan hotel rooms many times so while this room was clean, the room was so small that there was no place to hang a coat, no iron, no safe, no easy place to put the suitcase. Thank goodness we only had one. No queen or king size beds so we had a room with two twins. All twin bed rooms are located near the elevator so all night we heard the pinging from the elevator keeping us awake. While the location is not terrible, it is a walk (40 blocks) to the theater district. Our family is on the east side so any money we saved on the room was spent on taxis to get across town.If the small room and lack of iron, closet, noise, etc. is not an issue; this hotel was clean and the staff was courteous.
user_name:
B B
Hilton Head, South Carolina

review_body: We enjoyed staying at the above hotel in mid town New York, it was a great location, close to subway, and nice shops, a few cafes. Very clean and tidy with helpful Receptionists. Only fault bedroom was very small, no where to put our cases so we didn't even get our clothes out! But we would stay there again if we ever go to NY again.

We stayed 4 nights. None of our concerns materialised. The negatives in other reviews were not evident. The staff directed us to reliable restaurant for breakfast. Such that we kept going back to the same restaurant for breakfast and one dinner. The current construction over the road is not very slightly. But at least it is not noisy. I would definitely return here. This is our first visit to NY.

I was disappointed in this hotel. The rate was $262/night and that included a bed and a bathroom. No coffee, unless you wanted to pay .50/cup from somewhere in a back room that the desk clerk pointed out. There is no air conditioner in the room, but the air cycled on and off all night. Sometimes too hot; sometimes too cold. The bathroom was tiny and you basically had to walk into it backwards. My husband and I are not 'big' people, but we still found it difficult to move around in there (alone). So tiny, in fact, that the there was no toilet paper holder! The location was fine and it was clean, but I would not stay there again. My biggest gripe was the cost and the lack of amenities (no shower cap!). For $262, I will search around for another hotel that has a larger bed (Belnord had but a full) and a few things to make a stay a little more comfortable. Sometimes, it's the little things!

Subway line 1 a short block away. Tons of places to eat nearby ( Barney Greengrass, Zabar's). No coffee maker in room. Rooms are very small. Beds only a full size. No dresser only small closet. Free wi-fi. Room temperture easy to control.

Just spent 4 nights here and agree with some of the previous comments.Yes the rooms are extremely small and the beds are tiny ,but it is spotlessly clean and in a great location.Never had a problem with the free WiFi,and found the staff very friendly.Didn't spend a lot of time in our room as we were out enjoying NYC!Probably wouldn't stay in this part of the city again as you really have to use the subway a lot more from here,and the area was a bit pricey too.However saying that ,a lot of the bars have Happy Hours ...try the Gin Mill on Amsterdam Avenue.

The wifi was spotty and slow at its best during my 6 night stay. I finally gave up on it and used the cell phone for a hotspot (it was that bad). There are a couple of computers with printers and a coffee machine hidden in the lobby but you have to pay to access them. Good luck getting the rather rude staff to tell you about them or anything else for that matter. The room was clean and the shower had plenty of water pressure although the water source is obviously shared with the entire floor. During showers don't be surprised if the water suddenly turns unbearably hot or frigid when someone in another room uses water.The location of the hotel is its best feature. It is very close to the 1 subway line at 86th and Broadway. Amsterdam and Columbus both offer a huge selection of places to eat and shopping. Be warned there is a building one block away also called the Belnord. Make sure when asking for directions you mention the hotel.

We stayed here for one night and chose it with some other friends because of it's proximity to The Beacon Theater. I must say we were very hesitant to stay here after some of the reviews. The neighborhood is lovely, close to Central Park and lots of great restaurants. Our room was very neat and clean and the bathroom we found to be nice sized compared to some in other hotels in NYC. The bedroom is very small. We had a double bed. The only other furniture in the room was one bedside table. There was also a medium sized tv on the wall. Other than that there were no amenities, no closet, nowhere to put your suitcase, no coffee in the room or in the lobby. It is truly a basic, budget hotel but it served the purpose we needed it for. We returned to our room late after a concert, left for breakfast the next morning then checked out. It was perfect for that but would not want to stay longer than one night just because it is so small.

Rather cold reception and we had to pay the total amount on arrival.The rooms are too small. You don't even have enough space to open your suitcase and you need to do this because the closet is too small to put everything in it.The beds are too small (because a larger bed just can't fit in the room). Our feeth were hanging out of the bed.Wifi is very very slow.

It was a little surprising at the beginning to see how small the room was. But since we are not big people it wasn't an issue after all. Don't mean to be rude but if you are a tall or bigger person i may get a little uncomfortable since there is no much room to move around. The bed was comfortable and the whole room with private bathroom was super clean. Also, very updated and had a nice modern decoration which made it pleasant to be inside. We stayed in the 5th floor, the room had a window were you could see the building next to the hotel but we never opened it. Everything was in perfect condition, almost looked like new and you couldn't hear anything from the other rooms. The only exception was Friday night when we heard a couple of drunk guests trying to party in the hallway which was also very small. It seems they were asked to quiet down because suddenly they just shut up and never heard them again. The hotel was located in a nice neighborhood with a good amount of nice restaurants and bars so if you don't feel like going far you could easily stay around. If you feel like going somewhere else the hotel was perfectly located only one block away from the 1 train which takes you almost everywhere. Overall, I loved my stay there and this will definitely be my first option when I visit NY again. Unless,I find something cheaper for something nice like this lovely hotel. I highly recommend it!

small, comfortable, walking distance to restaurants and subway, all you need for a short visit to New York, good restaurants and coffed shops, three block walking form central Park, bus stop to La Guardia Airport

This was our first trip to New York and although we did our research we were still nervous about what this hotel would be like. Yes like many others have said the rooms are very small but there is plenty of room for two people to sleep, shower and store their belongings. Our room was well kept and very clean. The linen and towels were fresh and changed daily. I found the staff friendly and courteous. After a few days I realized just how perfect the location was. Far enough away from the craze of Time square, and close and convenient to many important things such as the subway, amazing places to eat and enjoy a drink. A five minute walk to central park and a beautiful short stroll to the museum mile. In our opinion this place was perfect. We will definitely be back. We love New York!!

I have noticed that many people have not liked the size of the rooms. To be honest it's an average size room for this price range in NYC. On par with Wellington, Soho Holiday Inn, Cosmopolitan, Novotel, Yotel and larger than Pod 39 and the Wolcot. We loved the location, one block from subway station, great restaurants near by (Starbucks around the corner) parking near by and a laundry next door. We liked the fact we were away from the hustle of NYC but could be in Times Square in 7-8 minute on the subway. The bed was comfortable, small closet and desk and a bathroom with tub and shower. This was the cleanest hotel we every stayed in in NYC.If you want a nice clean hotel in a good location, this is the place.

Great location. Quiet. Room was small and right next to the elevator, but it didn't really matter (wasn't there that much). Staff was very helpful and accommodating. I'd definitely stay there again!!!

Clean, quiet, good location, courteous service, a relative value for NYC. We were here for 5 nights, and while small, tight quarters, it was well appointed and maintained. We were going all day and came home at night to bath and sleep. For that, Belnord was fine. Situated between Broadway and Amsterdam, there is a subway stop a block away on Broadway, and a host of many restaurants down on Amsterdam. Nice flat-panel TVs and channel selection, but we hardly turned it on... just tuning in for the news and weather outlook. Recommend for value conscious travelers. We flew in and out of Laguardia and public transportation both ways was fine (although the desk seemed to think we should do a more expensive shuttle or taxi... public transportation is fine in NYC).
user_name:
rob e
San Luis Obispo, California

review_body: Generally good and helpful staff, very residential location, near the metro, easy to find, very "local". Very clean, towels changed everyday and toilet and room service. Room was very very small, basic double bed and no space for suitcase if you are in a couple. Hardly any room to walk, had to take turns with my husband to get ready. Would recommend for a few days only. A/C very good, though for the heat that NY was those days we've stayed.Corridors very noisy and the cleaner's cupboard was right next to our room, so whenever they started they cleaning journey (about 6/7am) we would been woken up many times with the noise of hoover, doors opening and closing very hard. Even the corridor noise with someone walking was quite loud inside a quiet room. We paid quite a lot in our concept, but I believe this is just NYC prices in general.

We stayed at the Belnord for 4 nights. The room is extremely small (like the bed is the whole room) but it was exactly all we needed and more. We had enough room for two people, no rugs, hardwood floors, clean, the air is wonderful especially after running around all day. You can control the air in your own room. The bathroom very clean and the shower was awesome. The water pressure is amazing. Kind of like a massage after walking all day. There is a very small closet so you can put your bags in. There is a nice sized tv and cable. I did not hear noise through the walls so that was great. Slept well. Only about 3 blocks from Central park and the subway about a block. The staff was good. we did not talk to them much but they are always there at the front desk so you feel safe and someone is always there for questions. The hotel is well maintained and has an elevator. The price was the best we found around $150 per night which is pennies to some of the hotels in NYC. I would stay here again and I actually liked the smaller room. It was cozy and I did not over shop while there because there is no room to bring back to the hotel:)

Great location on W. 87th Street. Very well taken care of - clean and well-appointed. As Manhattan goes, not a bad deal. But NYC hotels in general are way too pricey, especially when compared with what you can find in Paris, Rome, Barcelona, etc.

First of all, the rooms are extremely small. I read the reviews and knew that going in, so no surprises there. The room and bathroom were very clean. The staff was nice and the location was about a block from the 1line subway. The air conditioning worked well, too. I would definitely stay here again. The only issue was with the Wi-Fi, it was a bit inconsistent, but it was free.

Stayed here 3 days during our stay in NY. Clean room but a little small. Got fresh sheets every day and a very Nice location close to Central Park. When we left at 6am to Toronto they called a taxi for us that drove us nicely to the airport. I would stay here again!

My daughter and I [2 full-sized+ adults] spent 5 nights at the Belnord, in a twin room. I price checked dozens of places - quite thoroughly, read reviews, checked Google Street Views, and basically drove myself nuts trying to choose. I know the rooms are small, but having done cruising in budget level cabins, we had no issue with the room.The staff was very pleasant and helpful, the rooms and lobby were always clean, the rooms had been recently remodeled. The bathroom was all new, and though tight, was functional.Our room had a great sized flatscreen tv over the dresser. We had 2 huge windows in the room so that it didn’t feel smothery. There was a vanity area that we used for staging/etc.The surprises? 1. I pack my clothes on hangars and there was no rod or closet. 2. At 5’3”, I really had to stand on tippy toes to get the showerhead to get soap out of my hair.We loved our stay and if we are ever lucky enough to go back, we would check the Belnord first.

My husband and I spent one night in New York, and this hotel was adequate for our needs. The room I very very small, with just enough room on each side of the bed to get in & out. The bathroom is also quite small. But it's clean, comfortable, and reasonably quiet so if you're not planning to spend much time in the room, it's perfectly fine.

As this is my first trip to New York! Booking into this hotel seems to be ideal, reasonable in price. On arrival , no one to assist you to carry your luggage up 5 steps up into hotel for check in, not a friendly smile or welcome from Front Offfice Staff, given room key and was told to go up second floor and find your own room! Room itself is very small, sparsely fitted with ensuite and no view! View from windows in the backyard of apartments. Bed- ? Has bed bugs !! As I woke up with bites, no kettle in room for you to make a hot drink, air conditioning is Very Noisy and goes on the whole day and night!!. Front Desk Not helpful when enquiring about how to get to Downtown or call a cab prior to check out...I was told to drag my luggage to the Cornor of the road and hail a cab myself!!!Estimated walk to downtown is about an hour! Near to subways but did not take it......would not encourage anyone to stay at this Hotel at all as it is not convenient for any tourists...try and pay a bit more and stay in Lower Manhatten or inner city way......only good for ? Locals......

The hotel was clean and neat, HOWEVER nowhere do they state on their website that it is a micro hotel. I have stayed in many hotels in New York city and the rooms were so small that I could not get out of bed on one side. Also there was NO cell phone reception because the hotel rooms are wedged at the back of the building so with the surrounding buildings you are effectively in a dungeon. The free Wi-Fi did work, but if you want to make a phone call, or send/ receive a text you had to go outside.The A/C was vey goodThe staff at the at desk were however very friendly and helpful.
user_name:
basil H
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The hotel is in a very lovely neighborhood on the west side - good location for exploring the less beaten path - few blocks away from Central Park and a lot of bars/restaurants in the area. For the adventurous, it is about a 40 minute walk across the park to the East side.The hotel itself is small but clean - the room I stayed in had a double bed in a very cramped space - small bathroom and view of another building. If you are staying for more than 1 - 2 nights I would not recommend this hotel unless you don't care to have cramped quarters and no amenities. Business travelers - there is internet but nowhere to do work at night. I would stay here again the next time I come in for a weekend since it will be for 1 nite only.

This hotel located on the upper west side is a little delight. We arrived late evening suitcase lock not opening and the staff there was amazing even sending someone up with cutters to open our suitcase. Before I had stayed MidTown but thought it would be nice to try somewhere different.Really close to Central Park which we did go to regularly and just one block away from the subway. Even though all the staff are amazing especially the night time receptionist was brilliant recommending restaurants close by, one which we did take up on just around the corner small Mexican place.I think we was lucky as our room was like anywhere that we have stayed before (maybe because we have twin rooms) the only thing was the shower which had lovely power but when you came out you realise you made a little lake. (But I think this is more due to me really).Just to note we did stay there about over 2 years ago and I am sorry that I am only getting this up now. As I never have time. But I would definitely recommend anyone who is on a budget, this hotel is a delight.

This hotel was small but exceptionally clean and had a very nice and helpful staff. A good place to stay if all you need is a place to sleep and don't plan on spending too much time there. Great location near two different subway stops and very close to central park. Quiet neighborhood- nice to come home to after a busy day in the city.

As I reviewed other photos on this site, I became a little envious of how big the other rooms apparently are. We stayed for a weekend in an 8'x8' room that could only fit a double bed and one nightstand. It surprisingly worked just fine, and our biggest challenge was getting the bathroom door closed when occupied. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone with mobility issues (half flight of stairs from the street, shin cracking on the toilet bowl), but I would recommend this for a 3-star on the upper west side.Front desk staff is very polite. Loved the free wifi.

The best thing going for this hotel is its location in the upper west side, close to a subway stop, Central Park and accessible distance from Columbia University if you have business there.It is also scrupulously clean..The rooms are the size of a large walk-in closet -- the only standing furniture being a queen-sized bed and a single nightstand. The luggage rack is tiny and wall-mounted -- just right for an overnight case. The TV is wall-mounted too..The bathroom is the size of an even smaller closet.No coffee/tea in the rooms and breakfast is not included in the room rate.OK for one night but if you have to stay longer it is way too claustrophobic and would not hold your bags even.

This is honestly the tiniest hotel room I've ever stayed in. It's small even for NYC. The room had only a double bed, with about a foot of space on each side. Just enough space for a single nightstand and luggage rack. I was really only there for sleeping, so it worked for me. It was nice and quiet and very clean. The bathroom was actually spacious, given the size of the room. Full tub, which can be hard to come by in the city. Staff was great. It's about one block from a main subway line, so very convenient for getting around. Nice, easy walk to Central Park (about 8 or so blocks), through nice neighborhoods.

We stayed here for a weekend recently and I cannot say enough good things about the location of this hotel. It's on the Upper West Side on 87th Street, between Amsterdam and Broadway. It's one block from the 1 train, a few blocks from Central Park, and on a very pretty and quiet street. There are tons of restaurants and bars within walking distance.We booked a room with a double bed (an important sidenote, all rooms in this hotel come with private bathrooms. This isn't always a given when booking a budget friendly room in Manhattan). Like many posters before, the room is TINY. Closet-sized. There's the bed, and just enough to space to walk around the perimeter of it, but that's literally it. But seeing as how all we needed was a clean, safe place to sleep, the room served our needs just fine. The bed wasn't the most comfortable of things to sleep on, but it was manageable for two nights.The front desk was polite and speedy in the couple of interactions we had with them. The hotel was a little dated, but everything seemed to be mostly in good, clean condition. It was exceptionally quiet as far as other guests coming and going are concerned. That being said, the soundproofing from the halls to the room is pretty lacking. Just the noise from the housekeeping staff in the hall in the morning was shockingly loud. They weren't actually loud, it's just how easily everything carried.This hotel had far more positives that outweigh the couple of negatives. Should the price be right, I would certainly book a room here again.

I have been with my sister in this Hotel end of April 2014. The location is pretty good near to the metro, 15/20 minutes walk from Central Park and in a pretty quite area. What I didn't like about this Hotel was the really tiny room they give us the first night at the first floor, there was not even space for the baggage, it was dark and the view from the window was on a brick wall. Beds are also very small and not particularly comfortable. We stayed 5 nights and I asked the Receptionist if there was another room available with a window on the street and some natural light. They moved us the next morning and gave us a much better room on the 5th floor. The room was near the elevator and you could hear everything from the corridor. Wireless was available even if not really fast and with some issue around midnight (changing of the password). Drinking water/coffee in a room behind the lobby. Apart the rooms/beds issue the Hotel is clean and nicely refurbish and staff is friendly and helpful. Overall it seems small rooms size and no breakfast is a common deal in Manhattan.

The room is tiny! But we loved the location. It is so convenient to travel from the hotel to places. The hotel is very close to a subway. The room is clean and tidy. The size is very small though but we just went back to sleep. We spent most of our days outside sight seeing so the size of the room didn't really matter. The price is a little high for the size of the room but location is everything in New York.

The room was tiny--10x10 maybe--with room for a double bed and 2 nightstands. Bathroom was also tiny/efficient. Also, there's no desk or workspace, and no place to sit except the bed. Closet had space for hanging clothes as well as shelves so you could unpack. I was pretty comfortable by myself but would have found it trying to fit 2 people in. That said, it was impeccably clean, very quiet at night and I LOVED the light-blocking window coverings.

The Belnord was a new experience for me and my husband - a room so small that we had to draw straws to determine who would get floor space! Definitely a budget hotel (i.e cheap furnishings), perhaps suitable for the young and agile but not recommended for older couples. Spend a bit more and add to your enjoyment of this great city.
user_name:
Marget D
Conception Bay South, Canada

review_body: The hotel is deceiving. The outside is nice and in a great neighborhood but that is it. The room are so small and the bathroom, forget it! There wasn't room for a toiled paper holder so you just put it on the floor! If you were a tall or large person, I don't think you could fit in the bathroom. The linens were gross, the tv broke. My business partner is practically handicapped and no one offered to help him with bags. There was not even a ramp for him .LEFT NYC A DAY EARLY BECAUSE OF THIS ROACH MOTEL.

Just came back from a six-night stay at the Belnord Hotel. Rooms are, indeed, small, but in my opinion that's not so relevant, considering that it's a budget hotel and NY is a city for you to spend all day out (and night, too, if you want to). If you're looking for a decent place to sleep, the hotel is a good option, especially if you see reviews of other budget hotels in Manhattan, which are ridiculously overpriced and sometimes not exactly clean. This is not Orlando; this is New York City. Don't expect huge rooms with cheap rates in NYC. You just won't find them in Manhattan, and if you see anything like that, you'll see that reviews usually mention bed bugs -- not my experience with the Belnord. Rooms were very clean and, although walls are thin, I couldn't hear anything from other rooms, just people walking outside, mostly during the day -- but that wasn't a real problem for me. From my personal experience, I thought this wasn't a real problem.Beds are just OK. One good thing about this hotel is that you can book rooms with two single beds - something not so common in the US. As I was staying with my brother, I found this to be good. The Upper West Side is a very pleasant area in NYC. It's not as busy as other parts of the city and people are much more polite on the streets (no stressed walking fast and angry at people who can't keep that pace). It's the ideal location for a family stay. Moreover, the 86th St. subway station is just next door -- that was really good!I must mention that Daniel, who works at the lobby, was really nice and gave some nice tips to my parents, who were staying in another room. The other receptionists need to improve their facial expressions (a.k.a. smile) and really incorporate the American way of rendering a service (nice approach, "how are you", "good morning", etc), which is one of the key elements that attract visitors to the United States. Other than Daniel, most of the other ones wouldn't answer my "good morning" or "good evening" phrases -- that was something that bothered me a little.

I realize that the cheap price of this hotel is tempting, but resist the urge. Yes the hotel is in a great neighborhood but that's the only benefit as far as I'm concerned. We stayed for two nights and I still get the shudders thinking of our stay there. The room itself is comically small. The walls are super thin, you could hear everyones conversations and it was very hard to get sleep. It's also dingy and the sheets/blankets looked gross and smelled. Everything looked and felt dirty to me. I've had better stays in hostels.The hotel amenities are nonexistent - and no one offers to help you with anything in the hotel (bags/extra towels).
user_name:
Jacqueline N
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Great neighborhood, a block away from the Subway near Central Park and it's safe and relatively quiet. We stay here every summer and its always clean, the staff have the personality of an old wet stinky rag and the room was the size of a medium sized walk in closet but we always enjoy our stay and for sleeping and resting for short periods you can't really beat the economics in making this your home base for your visit.

Nice convenient location. Okay if you're looking for a base and would just be using the hotel to sleep in. But not a great place to relax in: room dark and gloomy; no public areas; staff unwelcoming. No, you wouldn't call this place a home from home.

The customer service when I called the website was horrible because I was a little upset I was hung up 3 different times, Bob was the last rep and he got me to a superviosr The supervisor listen and still had nothing good to say but let me vent, no corporate number no one above her that I can speak to, like I was out of money and room at the end of the night. I will never use this website again! The hotel was very neat and presentable, just did not understand how I got a small room like that.

Prior to staying I read the reviews so there was no surprise that the rooms were small... It cracked me up as to how many people were "shocked" at how small the rooms were.. Come on people it's stated in almost every review! I didn't care because I didn't go to NY to lock myself up in a room. It was clean and served it's purpose. The front desk staff were helpful and friendly. The location was great! Really close to the subway (1 block) and close to the museums. Times Square was a hop, skip, and jump by subway. Would def go back and recommend.

It was the cheapest we found in Midtown NYC. Still it was a wonderful hosting! Bedrooms very clean, the staff always helped needed. There are also employees who speak Spanish. It's just a pity not to have morning coffee or food at the hotel, but this is no problem in New Yourk, because there is always a delivery. Best of all is receiving packets no charge for this service. Before we went we read some comments about bedrooms be small, but we stayed in a room for persons with special needs and the size was very comfortable and spacious.

We stayed here for 4 nights. I can echo the other reviews:small rooms, no coffee machine, very very noisy heating. Our TV worked , and we had to choose between heating and tv, as together was not possible for the noise. Our toilet broke down but was repaired the day after. Internet was slow but worked.Apart from noise, good place to stay. With earplugs this is a "go!"

Have just finished a 15 night stay here and it has been great staying there. We went in with very low expectations and were pleasantly surprised. The rooms are very small but they are clean and cosy. We had a private bathroom in a twin room and the bathroom was AMAZING! So modern and the shower was powerful. The room also had a wardrobe which was unexpected along with a flatscreen television. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Location is perfect for if you want to be away from the chaos of midtown and experience something with more of a neighbourhood vibe. It's very easy to get anywhere with the various subways. It's definitely a no frills hotel but this is what we wanted. When we did have issues including the television breaking and the toilet flooding they were fixed immediately. My only negative is that the heating system is EXTREMELY noisy. Even when ours was turned off we could hear next door's and at first we thought it was a helicopter outside. We had to turn ours off because it was VERY VERY noisy. But apart from that, a great stay!

This is a great affordable hotel on the upper west side. Rooms are small as others have said but if you're on holiday in NYC you're not there to stay in your room. Rooms are clean and the location is excellent, minutes away from the subway and a short walk from Central Park. The cleaning staff were lovely. Only thing we'd have liked was a mini safe in the room but otherwise this seems hard to beat.

I stayed ther with a friend of mine during holiday season 2013. The hotel was very clean, decent size of rooms, the staff was friendly and helpfull. One of the great points in our stay there was the location of the hotel. % minutes walk from subway, made the whole trip transportation a piece of cake.

This is a clean, safe, convenient landing place for anyone visiting New York. Subway and buses are steps away to get everywhere in the city. The rooms are clean (wood and tile floors let you see how clean!) and very comfortable. The heat and air work well (tested during the week of snow and below zero temperatures in January), the bed and linens were top notch. The bathroom was updated and spotless. The staff was friendly, knowledgeable and efficient. Questions were answered, requests were fulfilled (I too experienced the mysterious noise, but they responded and resolved whatever it was immediately), and they were always pleasant, day and night.The room was not spaceous, but if you are only sleeping there, there is plenty of usable space. In my full week's stay the internet and tv worked without a hitch!The price is right, great location, good people...GO!

We stayed here at the beginning of January this year (2014). We knew we wanted to stay on the Upper West Side from prior visits to New York, but wanted to try a different hotel from our last one there. Separated only by several blocks, this hotel was comparable to the last one we stayed at in terms of location. When comparing cost, however, this hotel was considerably less and just as convenient in location and value. Our double bed room here was very, very small - just enough room to move around the bed and desk. We had seen on other reviews that this was the case, and it certainly was. The bathroom was adequate but the toilet made weird noises after every flush. Our bed was comfortable with several pillows and the bedding was clean. There were extra blankets and pillows in the tiny, tiny closet, which was nice. Towels were replaced faithfully, which was very nice. We had control over the heat for our room, which was great. Our view was a back wall of a neighboring building, but that was fine. We believe you really need to like the person you're rooming with here, though, because you are going to be in *very* close quarters for the duration of your stay. The staff was friendly and polite. The internet worked fine but you had to log in everyday with a new password the staff can provide shortly after midnight every night. The staff arranged a car for us to take us to the airport on very short notice when our flight was unexpectedly moved up to an earlier time - the cost for the car was a flat $50 rate to LaGuardia, but well worth it.The Belnord is *very* conveniently located to Central Park and several very good restaurants and coffee shops in the area. We recommend the Cafe on Broadway and 5-Napkin Burger (both about 2 blocks down on Broadway) as well as Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf (there are 2 fairly close by) and the Ocean Grille (about 8 blocks down on Columbus). The subway stop is one block over on Broadway from the hotel and well lit for nighttime travel back to the hotel. If you need a truly cost-effective room to sleep and shower in at the end of everyday in the city that is also conveniently located to good food and transportation, the Belnord is great. If you plan to hang out in your room a lot, you might want to think twice about this really great and comfortable hotel. For our part, we will *certainly* stay at the Belnord Hotel when we visit New York again.
user_name:
FlashandWW
New York City, New York

review_body: The room was very small, but clean. No facility to make coffee, but Starbucks was around the corner. Laundry next door was very handy. Close to Central Park. Very good location, close to the subway station but not too close. Quiet clean attractive part of Manhattan. The WiFi in the hotel worked OK, despite the staff's disclaimer that it might not. For New York (where hotels are usually a rip-off), the value was quite fair.

I booked a night at the Belnord based on the reviews. I will say that it is spotless and cozy. The bed is comfortable and inviting with 5 pillows. It is only as quiet as what is happening outside your door. I promised Manuel, the kind and helpful caretaker, that I would put in a nice word for him. In fact, it is because of his kindness that I chose to stay another night. It was one of the worst nights of my life. The thing with this hotel is this: NONE of the tvs work, and NO one knows how to fix them. Manuel spent an hour the first night, and finally suggested I change rooms. He told me about the nice coffee machine, also broken. At about 1 in the morning, the toilet started running nonstop. AND YET, as a traveler to many countries, I have learned that the kindness of the staff can cancel out a lot of headaches. BUT, I am a woman traveling alone, and looking for an apartment in Manhattan is stressful. The next morning, I told Jonathan about the issues, left my bag in the storage room, and said I might stay another night.I was in fact TOO tired to take the bus home, a journey of one and one half hours. I decided to treat myself to a night of TV and another night in the city. BEFORE booking the room, I made sure I could get the same room. I called and was told they would save the room for me. When I got to the hotel it was no longer available. I took a different room. I got into bed right away, and tried the TV. BROKEN. They sent another man, who stayed one hour coming and going while I tried to talk on the phone. End result- O. I Was too tired to move rooms and I resented the lack of privacy. I slept for about 3 hours to a loud humming noise which WOULD NOT go away. I tried ear plugs called the desk. A very nice guy Daniel, said he would send someone to look at it. A man came up, asked if he could do something. I had been up almost three hours with no TV to at least distract me. I told him I'd love a cup of tea. FOUND out the beverage machine was :Broken! I just felt so miserable at this point I almost walked to the all night cafe. Except I realized I had a fever. Daniel at the desk agreed I was entitled to compensation. He said to speak to Jonathan, whom I knew to be hardworking and nice.As LONGas you Don't complain The next morning he said he could not refund the night EVEN though I ONLY STAYED based on the fact I be given the same room. Daniel actually implied it was my fault because I didn't change rooms. He offered me 8-12$ refund. This was a really bad experience, and people need to hear about it

Yes, the rooms are small. Yes, the price isn't as low as many would expect for a room of this size. But this is New York City people. This was my first time visiting and even I knew what to expect. We were on the third floor and never encountered an issue with noise. The TV worked just fine so we were able to watch a little bit while getting dressed. Wifi worked too. We stayed for three nights and found clean towels every time we returned to the room. The only issue I had was that the toilet made some weird screeching noise every time it was flushed. Not a big deal though. If you're looking for a clean, warm room with a bed and hot shower that you'll only be returning to at night after a long day in the city, stay here. If you're looking for a room to work or hangout in, look elsewhere.

First the good. The hotel is cheap (by Manhattan standards), very clean and in a great Upper West Side location (assuming you want to be on the Upper West Side). It is an easy, half block walk to the 1 Line and is within walking distance of groceries, coffee shops, etc. If you are traveling for pleasure and do not plan on spending much time in your hotel room, these may be the key factors for you and you will not be disappointed. However, the rooms are very, very small. Even for Manhattan. The room I had was literally about 10 feet by 10 feet, excluding the bathroom. It had room for a bed and the TV, which was hung on the wall. There were two night stands, one of which held the phone. That was it. There was almost no room to turn around,. There was no room for a chair to sit in, much less a desk. Unfortunately, I was in Manhattan on business and needed to spend a considerable amount of time in the room working. This just wasn't possible. So, I sought out a coffee shop, took my computer and my iPhone and set up a hot spot using the phone. This way I was able to log onto the internet. But I couldn't make private business phone calls in a public space like this. So, the coffee shop as a work space didn't really work for me. Just to be clear, the hotel does have wireless internet, which is included in the price, but trying to lie on the bed (remember, there is no place to sit in the room), type and conduct business just wasn't possible for me. Also, while not a big deal, the wireless internet is very slow. You can't really use it to stream video. It sort of works, but not very well. It's fine, though, for e-mail.So, I gave the hotel 3 stars. A more precise rating would be 4 stars if price and cleanliness is paramount to you, but 1 star if you need to spend a lot of time in the room.

Great location, fantastic price. As clean as possible. Small room, but it is manhattan. If you are a large couple, the basic room and bath might be too small. We are only 5' 8" and less, so it was fine for us.

I stayed at this hotel for one night to sleep-in after a fun night out in Manhattan. The rooms are very small but clean and practical to just go to sleep. To be woken up by the cleaning staff doing their work was very annoying. I could hear loud walkie-talkies, stuff clanking and banging, conversations, etc. I often stay at budget places like this Manhattan over weekends but Id have to really think hard about staying here again.
user_name:
Rene D
Cold Spring, New York

review_body: The Belnord Hotel was a recommended hotel for teachers attending events at Teachers College at Columbia University. Positives: very clean, comfortable, great elevator, in a good neighborhood and close to the subway. You can walk to groceries, coffee shops, restaurants, and pharmacies--all are close by. They stored my luggage in a secure place the last day when I had to attend my conference until the afternoon and made sure a taxi was waiting to take me to the airport at the time I needed to go. Negatives: rooms are really small with small bathrooms. There is no restaurant at the hotel, but several closeby. Close to Central Park and museums. I would stay here again and would recommend it to friends.

Rooms are small, but clean and well laid out. Everything was fine apart from the heating, which was on a thermostat and every time it kicked in, it woke me up. It sounds like a plane landing!! Other than that, a perfectly good hotel.

Tiny room with a view of a brick wall - not so unusual for NYC. The bed was supposedly a double, but I'd not want to put two people in this room. Bath the size of a closet (you can't spread the bath mat all the way out on the "floor"). Again, if you're traveling alone and just need the bare minimum, it works. Great location just a block from the 86th Street Subway station on a reasonably quiet street. That's worth a good deal.

The Upper West Side does not offer many hotel options so The Belnord, hidden among the row houses, tenaments, and brownstones, allows you to feel like a resident of this interesting, quintessential New York neighborhood.Access to Central Park is also priceless. That said, the photos posted here tell the entire story. The rooms are tiny but comfortable. There are no views, no amenities, no services beyond the basics offered by a staff of eager to please, well trained, but unpolished young locals.It was perfect for business travel but only of you're working nearby or get an excellent rate.
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
Sal C
New York, New York, United States

review_body: The hotel is not a luxury five star hotel. It is, however, comfortable, warm and well positioned for the metro and Central Park. The rooms are small. We had a twin room and there wasn't much space around each bed. However, the room was clean, the beds were amazingly comfortable and the bathroom was functional with a good shower and hairdryer.The reception staff were helpful. There was a storage area for suitcases and a general shower room which can be used if you arrive or leave outside of check in time.The metro station is just one block away and it takes about 10-15 minutes to get into central downtown. The trains run well to time and are very frequent.I would recommend this hotel for anyone who is happy with a reasonably priced, basic hotel in good location.

the location for me was the only plus. the hotel itself is outdated with no amenities. the rooms are ridiculously small, and you can hear everything that goes on in the other rooms and the hallway. the bed is hard and the sheets are not comfortable, and the curtains didn't close all the way. The front desk staff greeted me curtly, and at 10 o'clock at night could not find my reservation even though I booked it directly on their website. they repeated this with the next person who followed me in, and eventually managed to find both reservations after a long wait. that's a terrible feeling 10 o'clock at night. my room key never worked, so I had to go to the front desk to be let in every single time. this was a last minute stay, only for one night, and I would not return or recommend to others.

Excellent location and average standard. Really nothing special to write home about. The location is however excellent for both business and pleasure. The hotel itself would be a two star hotel according to my standard. Price is not related to the standard. Well, staff is friendly, room is clean but it is definitely no a trendy hotel. A bit old fashioned. Wifi is not complimentary. Air quality was not particularly good in my room. But again, what can you expect to get from your money In NYC in December?

The room was too small to lay your suitcase down. Two people cannot walk in the room without one of them needing to get onto the bed to let the other pass.We walked in and walked right out. They still charged us for a single night. They offered us a alternate room that smelled like urine. Beware.

My husband and I stayed here for a night. We knew to expect a small room from the previous reviews, but didn't expect it to be that small. There is not a closet, but there is a rack for hanging clothes. You have about two feet around the bed to maneuver around. The bathroom is a little cramped too. Needless to say, it was fine for what we needed it for: a crash pad after a night of bar hopping. The room was very clean and the staff were professional and accommodating. It's close to the subway, bars and restaurants. If you're a couple looking to stay for an extended period of time this might not be the place for you. BUT I would stay here again for a night or two.

Ok. Here's the deal. DO NOT look for the amenities. There is NONE! But what it does have is a bed, a bathroom and a television with about six channels. It is small. REAL SMALL. But also real affordable. If you are traveling alone and looking to spend your money on something other than where you sleep for six hours, this is a great deal. It is positioned three avenues off Central Park on W 87th. That is the Upper West Side and you are just a couple of blocks away from famous streets that filmed such movies as The Prince of Tides, When Harry Met Sally & You've Got Mail. Very clean, very quaint and one block from the 1, 2 & 3 subway at 86th & Broadway. 10 minutes from Columbus Circle and 15 to Times Sq. I thought I'd give it a whirl and was very pleased for what I spent. I say, "Try it. You'll like it."

Although the room was very small, it was very clean and the location was ok. The staff is friendly and fast. It was very surprising, my friend and I didn't expect it to be this good because it was much cheaper comparing to the other options we had booking at last minute. The metro station is close and there are some markets near, where you can buy some food to make breakfast and dinner cheaper than in restaurants.

Wasn't so sure about this place when we booked, but it was a pleasant surprise 'coz it ticked all the most important boxes (at least for me): a.good location, b.clean rooms and beds and c.good quality Wi-Fi. The room's really tiny, but it's always clean, comfortable and doesn't smell mouldy and no carpet stains. Helpful and friendly staff, specially the south-american ones. Great Upper West side location to the ones who rather avoid the super crowded and noisy areas of Manhattan, at least for when it's bed time. Really nice local restaurants, cafes and bars on the surrounding area with less tourists - good to get a better feeling of the new yorker life style. Easy to get around, as you have a subway station right next door on 86th and Broadway. Also quite a few good designer stores in the area for the shopaholics. A very good option for the ones who wanna avoid the crowds and don't wanna spend too much on accommodation to shop, eat and drink more.

I was here for four days on a work trip, and for this purpose, the hotel was sufficient. The rooms are rather small, and the bathroom was REALLY small, even for me (I'm only 5 foot 2). Still, the room and bed were comfortable, and the hotel is in a great location on the upper west side of Manhattan, a short subway ride to Times Square. I'm not sure this is somewhere you'd go for a romantic holiday, but if you want be near the centre of New York, and you're on a budget, you could do worse than this place! The staff were also really friendly and helpful.

Great Upper West Side location, helpful staff. Literally have never seen a smaller hotel room. There was nowhere to lay out the suitcase on the floor. Even the halls are narrow. But you can't beat the spot.

The room size of the Belnord, given the location in NYC could be forgiven if it weren't for the atrocious service. We booked our room on travelocity and despite showing the front desk attendant our reservation confirmation, he refused to honor it because he could not find it in his computer, stating that Travelocity did not enter it into the system, which he said has happened before several times. Rather than contacting Travelocity himself to resolve the issue, he told us to contact Travelocity and forced us to sit in the lobby for the next hour at midnight. Travelocity stated they they sent him info, which he says had not been received and continued to argue with us about what Travelocity should be doing, prompting him to force us to call Travelocity a second time. It was only when we became insistent that he resolve the dispute directly with Travelocity that he finally called them, and then proceeded to talk down to the person on the phone and not believe them either that the reservation was real (despite them giving obvious details on the phone of our reservation) and demanded to know their names and how to contact them should it be false so he can track them down and hold them accountable. While sitting in the lobby for an hour we got to witness the same staff being rude, abrupt, and unclear to multiple people that came to check in, mostly because they handed over debit instead of credit cards to put a hold on the room, which meant that the Hotel would put a $200 hold on the debit cards...this is a fairly easy explanation, but he managed to make it into a semi-hostile and confusing encounter with many guests. In the end, when we were finally allowed to check into the room at 12:30 am, he apologized, but we were pretty frustrated by that point.The room: Oy, other reviewers are not exaggerating when they say how small the room is. It actually made me laugh multiple times whenever we would try to maneuver through the room because it was so small that you could almost touch all four side with your arms and legs outstretched, almost...if you were a basketball player, you totally would. It was a modern feat in architecture really to be able to design a usable space that small that was not a prison cell. I don't think a TV would have fit in the room if they did not have the modern wall mounted kind. The beds are very hard and the blankets are rough and uncomfortable. The temperature of the room could not be adjusted to a comfortable level, despite having an adjustment box available.The pros: it was clean, the price was great for NYC, and the location was perfect, just a little ways from Central Park. However, given the frustration we encountered, I wouldn't stay again.

This hotel is in a perfect quite safe location to explore New York. The staff are very friendly, informative and helpful. Although our twin room was small it was very clean (the maid service was excellent & we came back to an immaculate room each evening!) with a nice bathroom with a walk in shower! Although there isn't a lot of storage space there is a large cupboard which is sufficient for clothes and luggage! We made good use of the ice making machine for drinks when we were in our room! We stayed here for 6 nights & thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The one thing that would make a stay here even better would be tea/coffee making facilities in the room!Thank you to the staff for helping to make our stay in New York perfect!

The Belnord Hotel is located in the Upper West Side, which is a great area: quiet, close to Central Park, surrounded by subway stations. It's a really good place if you are looking for a cheap hotel in Manhattan. It serves no breakfast, but there's more than one Starbucks in the surroundings: it's definitely pleasant to have a bagel and a coffee as a real New Yorker. The rooms are tiny, but absolutely clean. No carpet on the floor, which is quite nice. Before I got there I checked some of the comments here: I understand the bedrooms are not huge, but who comes to New York to spend time in the hotel? The Belnord is perfect for tourists that do not pretend too much and love to enjoy a quiet and simple New York City experience! Thumbs up!

Perfect hotel for a New York City experience. Small rooms but who goes to New York to sit in the hotel? The Belnord is conveniently located on the red subway lines and is only a couple blocks from Central Park and the Museum of Natural History.

When I got to my floor and started walking t my room, the hallway was extremely narrow, and zig- zagged like some sort of life size maze. When I got to my room, there was a bed, and less than 2 feet of space between the side of he bed to the wall, and the end of the bed to the bathroom. Basically, it was like putting a bed in a closet. Front desk service was ok, and it was nice to have A/C. A place to stay alone, maybe on business, but not a place to bring the kids.

I like the room,the coffee, good employyees.nice internet service. nice area.except no parking lot ,would be nice if they supply free breakfast room too small,but gossip,maybe price down just a litle.

The location of this hotel was great with easy access to Time Square and the rest of Manhattan, the rooms were kept clean all the time, most of the front desk help were at your service at all times, some were very grumpy due.The down side is the keys had to be changed all the time and that was not very entertaining.There was no food service at the hotel, no fitness center.The internet was ok, but not great.
user_name:
Vendela Akua E
Oslo, Oslo, Norway

review_body: Whoever takes the photos for the Belnord Hotel is a master of deception. The largest single room this hotel offers makes most New York City studio apartments look spacious by comparison. We could scarcely open the door all the way to get in--there was simply no room to move around. To make matters worse, when we first checked in, the hotel staff gave us the key to a room that was ALREADY OCCUPIED. Paper thin walls ensured that we never felt like we were alone, which in a way was good, because who knows when another guest could have accidentally walked into our room. The only good part about this hotel was the location, but I would recommend you look elsewhere before staying here.

My high school friend and I were looking for an inexpensive place to stay in NYC for 1 night. We were not disappointed by the Belnord. The room had been updated recently and the bathroom was clean and small. We had 2 twin beds and which were very comfortable. The location was less than 1 block from the subway. We also had connectivity issues with the WiFi. One suggestion would be for the hotel to install hooks to hang towels and clothing. I would definitely recommend staying here.

The Belnord is a great budget option if you want cleanliness, safety, and proximity to public transport but aren't concerned about amenities and extra services. My mother and I stayed at this hotel in July 2013 because we wanted a hotel that was close to the subway and close to Times Square. The primary purpose of our trip was to see as many Broadway shows in one weekend as possible. Our main concernd in choosing a hotel were cleanliness, price, and location (in proximity to a subway that would take us to Times Square / the Theater District). We were pleased with the Belnord as it met all of our criteria. We got a great deal on the hotel through Travelocity, but I would not spend more than $140 / night (taxes included) on the room as it is small.When you stay at the Belnord you will get a clean room that is small. The only seating available is on the bed (at least in a queen room). The WiFi worked well. The bathroom was very clean, clean towels were provided, but there was not much counter space. There is small "business center" on the bottom floor with 2 computers and a coffee machine (but you must pay for the coffee). You can store your luggage at this hotel before/after check in.Bottom line: If you are looking for a hotel that will be used primarily for sleeping and resting, that is clean, and that is close to public transportation, this is a good choice. If you are seeking a hotel that is spacious, luxurious, in the middle of all the action, has a desk for business travelers, or that will give you first rate service, you should look elsewhere.If you are depending on use of public transportation, be sure to check the internet for information about service changes before booking your hotel!

Ditto what others say in terms of location to the park and Subway, cleanliness of the place The room is small but the price is good. The WiFi was nonexistent for the first part of our stay. The people at the front desk didn't tell us that upon arrival and when we asked about it were told that the service was complimentary therefore it was ok that it was not functioning, huh? Also use of the shower causes bathroom flooding, seriously you need to get longer shower curtains, it is that simple.

Well let's face it, it is New York where space is at a premium! So yes the hotel room (1-queen bed) is small. But who goes to NYC to stay in the room?! Great location on the Upper West Side of Manhattan. You are within walking distance to a CVS and food market, (less than a minute) to the subway line (Red-1) that takes you all the way to Times Square. You are located near great eateries and several blocks from Central Park. The Museum District is on the other side of Central Park and you are with walking distance of the Guggenheim, the Met, MoMA, the Natural History Museum. Take the train to Lincoln Center, etc. There is so much around the hotel you won't want to stay in it.Now the ratings: B-Overall good value for the price and location.You do have free wifi, TV with limited channels, basic toiletries and a blow dryer, but that's it. There is no microwave, mini fridge, iron or board, safe or clock. The room I stayed in had the wall paper torn or peeling from a small portion of the wall which I reported to the front desk (so I was not to blame). But the room had wooden floors (which I love, I don't like carpet in hotels), very clean and no signs of bugs, the mattresses had a hygiene cover. The water gets SUPER hot so be careful with your settings. Bathroom small clean and appropriate for use, tiled flooring with ventilation. Central air/heating controls in room. No pool, no restaurant, no room service (other than cleaning) and I had a view of the alley you can hear noise outside your room.Be sure to "go DOWNTOWN"...just listen to the music of the traffic in the city...

I've been here for 6 nights: it's a quite good budget (for NYC standards) hotel. Location is very good - a bit far from main tourist attractions, but with 86th street subway station (red line) just one block away in the classy and quiet upper west side.Rooms are quite small, but very clean. Bathroom is small too, but has everything. Just keep in mind that the hotel has no restaurant nor breakfast, but this is not a real issue since there are lots of cafes and brunch places nearby.Overall, it was a very good choice and would stay here again.

We planned a five night stay at the Belnord and after one night we had bug bites on our legs. We thought nothing of it until the next evening when we noticed some dust(bed bug poo) and bug casings in between the glass of a picture frame in the room. We immediately pulled up the bed sheets on the corner of the bed to find about twenty bed bugs awaiting their next meal. Ugh. So we asked for a new room and when we pulled up the sheets of that bed it was three times worse! We showed the hotel attendant who said, "yeah, those are definitely bed bugs". We left the hotel but they would not refund our money. The next day we argued our case to the manager and were still charged for two nights there after only staying one night AND being bitten up. The hotel is gross and careless.

Love this hotel!! Very clean, quiet, and safe. Front desk staff very professional and helpful. Conveniently located to museums and subway. Rooms are what the sightseer on a budget needs; a quiet, comfortable place to sleep. They are smaller than the average hotel room but we didn't come all the way to NYC to hang out in a room. Will stay here again!

We had a suite with 2 queen beds. Quite spacious for NYC. Very safe. Very clean. Easy walk to Central Park. Recommended for location and cleanliness. Staff was polite enough, but not effusive. But this is not a 5 star hotel. Really quite nice.

The location in the upper west side of NYC is this hotels best feature. The rooms, though clean, really are tiny. If you are planning on shopping, you will struggle to find somewhere for you buys. I disagree with the $200 deposit they take off u when checking in. There is nothing in the room that can be broken! The staff are great and very friendly. It had its flaws but I would stay here again.

We have just left the Belnord hotel after 3 nights stay. We had a wonderful time.We arrived late at night and the man in the front desk(Mario) was very nice and helpful.the room was the smallest i've ever seen , but very very clean and new.(It seems that they have redecorated lately). the towels were very clean and pamper. air condition worked perfectly well.There were no blankets, only sheet. the price was good. it located few steps from the underground. We reccommend.

We spent 5 nights at the hotel and it was a really good experience. The hotel is very well located, 2 minutes from metro station, 5 minutes walk from Central Park. Although the hotel rooms are really really small (ours had about 9 sq metres, I guess), it was very clean and quiet. There is free wi-fi in the whole hotel, you just have to ask for a password every day. The neighbourhood is great, so you will find many places to eat. When we checked out, we could leave our luggage in the luggage room. The front desk staff were not very warm, but professional. I would definitely recommend this hotel to people who come to NYC for sightseeing and need just a clean, quiet room and bathroom and an easy place to get to the centre of Manhattan.

This hotel is very well located! Close to the subway, walking distance from central park and the price is quite reasonable for such a location. The rooms are clean and I would have given it a four star (for all the above mentioned reasons) if it weren't for the bathroom. The bathroom is very small but that's not the problem, the problem is its maintenance, a bit of care and it could have been much more comfortable to use. Sliding door instead of shower curtain for example, because once you have that shower, the floor is getting wet no doubt about it. The staff was friendly and polite but not very helpful with tourist directions. But honestly, for a short stay in New York, what more do you need than a clean room and a super comfortable location? we were out all day and all night in this marvelous city that never sleeps. I would advise it.

Yes, the rooms are quite small, but they are very clean. You're spending your time seeing the sights of NYC and just need a clean, quiet, and convenient place to sleep? The Belnord is all this, along with making you feel you live in this nice, Upper West Side neighborhood. Lots of restaurants, coffee places and shops around, too. The front desk staff is a little bored and not especially welcoming, but hey--it's New York City!

Quite convenient location and unbeatable price for the beginning of May. Rooms are very small but clean and beds are comfortable. Would've been a great place to sleep on a busy weekend in the City if not for a very poor soundproofing. It's non-existent. Every word and every step are heard from the hallway. Noise started at 4:30am and the sleep was ruined. Feels like sleeping in a tent on a side of the road - can't see but hear everything.
user_name:
DanielT237
New York City, New York

review_body: For a clean decent place to sleep, this was fine. If you want more, look elsewhere. We wanted a hotel on Upper West Side for a weekend visit to our son who lives in NYC. This was the cheapest thing available -- $240/night in early May 2013. Is that "budget"? By NYC standards, I guess. We didn't feel like risking a lower bid on Priceline or Hotwire, because location was important and this was perfect. I'm 6-feet tall with long legs, and my knees just grazed the pedestal sink in the bathroom; doesn't bother me, but taller or fussier people might care. My 5' 1" wife didn't care :-). The biggest problem was in the morning, when I woke up before my wife: there's no chair in the room, so I had to read quietly in bed without waking her. Basically, the room holds the bed, a 1 or 2-foot path around the bed, and that's it. The shower worked well, the staff was friendly, we didn't have any mechanical or noise problems. I wouldn't rush to stay here again, but if the price was right, I'd consider it.

I was at Belnord for a week this last month. The room was well proportioned and well furnished. I felt comfortable and secure coming back to the hotel, which is near the 86th street station and the Central Park.The internet wasn't reliable throughout the stay. I was offline for over a day but I'm guessing this was not a frequent issue. The hotel location is quiet so I was getting enough sleep.

The Belnord has been recently remodeled and is well maintained by the housekeeping staff. The people at the front desk are accommodating and polite. These positives do not offset the negatives. The hotel hallway floors are surfaced with a laminate that makes for a very load hallway. While sitting in your room you can hear suitcases being rolled down the hall. Late arriving guests make for a poor nights sleep. Ear plugs can be used to minimize the noise, but nothing can be done to addres the miniscule rooms. They are smaller than a college dorm room of the 1970's. Perhaps if you are traveling by yourself and only staying for a night or two, you could make do with the limited space. While its location is excellent and the staff is good, the physical limitations of the property will keep my wife and I from staying at the Belnord again.

the good things about the hotel- it s located near central park, about 4 blocks away- it is located near the subway station making everything convenient to get to- it is a place to rest your head nothing moreit was my first time in NY so i am not sure if this is the standard. i spent 4 weeks in the USA on this trip and went to san francisco, New orleans, Vegas and LA too.
