Room could have perhaps done with a little more storage space as well.Located on the upper west side of Mahattan close to Central Park and the Hudson River. Area was quiet and has the 86th subway station round the corner which was ideal for travelling around as the line included stops for Times Square, Penn Station (Madison Square Gardens) and Liberty Island. All major attractions/sites (i.e. 5th Avenue, Empire State Building, Rockefeller Building) were within walking distance of a station on the line. Natural History Museum, Central Park and the Guggenheim Museum are all within walking distance of the hotel. If really eager, most popular sites can be walked to relatively easily (at a general pace, Times Square can be reached within an hour, this includes stopping and looking at everything on the way there!).There are a number of pleasant/recommendable local restaurants/bakeries that offer breakfast, lunch and dinner if you don't want to go far from the hotel for something to eat. There is also a multiscreen cinema a few blocks away if you fancy a quiet night!

Fantastic hotel, rooms are super clean and not tiny as I thought it would be. We had double room with private bath and it was perfect. Rooms were clean, linens fresh and great location.We got a great deal on their website and paid about US$75 a night which is incredible for a hotel in New York City!

Room is tiny really really small but very clean and fantastic location. Just 1 minute from Subway (number 1) going to Times Square and statue of liberty. The rooms are very clean but bed is not great. Overall fantastic location and value for money. Close to NY restaurants. If you need good service and nice big room with bathrooms, then this is not ideal but for if you are more interested in seeing NY and will be out a lot, then highly recommended.

Most of the "negative" reviews on the this place seems to have been made pre-renovations. We were therefore pleasantly surprised when we found Belnord to be newly furbished including floor boards throughtout, LCD TV (no cable), new bathroom and wallpaper. Yes the room is tiny, but there is so much to do in NYC that you would be crazy to spend ALL your time outside! There is no breakfast, free internet, you can't make phone calls in your rooms (but you can receive calls still). Location is FABULOUS, 3 minutes walk to 86th on red line 1, very very safe at night (as long as you don't go past Amsterdam!). The rate we got was EXCEPTIONAL for NYC but was also low season, we stayed there for 7 nights at a rate of between $69-$89 before tax for a double room. No other hotel with private bathroom comes in CLOSE to this sort of value.Overall- Excellent choice in the sub $100 range- Excellent Location- Small but clean and newly renovated rooms, quiet- Free wifi- My only dislike - indifferent attitude from the front desk but hey whateverI won't hesitate to recommend this place

If you are looking for a hotel just to keep your things, sleep, shower, and be in a safe location this is the hotel for you. Not much on amenities. It's in a great location 3 blocks from Central Park. Close to the Broadway and 86th subway. Perfect for a traveler. The rooms are tiny but clean. The hotel is on a quiet street. I did not hear other guests too much.

You need to retrain your entire front desk staff. I dealt with three separate individuals all poorer than the next. The first clerk couldn't even tell me where hotel guests can park their cars. She had no clue.The second clerk: I asked if there was a soda vending machine in the hotel he totally ignoed me. I will have to look on every floor until I find it. Doesn't know what floor it's on but it's in a corner. The third clerk: spoke very or limited English makes no sense.What the hell is going on with this hotel?" -If you do decide to stay at this hotel, be prepared for the following:- rude and disguisting service by the front-desk- French accent/Indian accent- elevator always had blankets and garbage from housekeeping on it.- no in-room safes- thin walls (you can hear your neighbours wake-up calls)- dirty and dated hallways- small bathrooms - limited services- 30 minute walk to Columbia (or 2 stops on the subway)In the future, I would look into staying elsewhere, possibly at a hotel chain. At least they have standards on room cleanliness and how to treat their guests.

We were a bit worried at what awaited us when we booked for less than $100/night with tax in the Tony West Central Park area, but boy were we thrilled when we checked in. The room was small, but was beautiful and newly remodeled. We opted for a private bath which was finished in marble with ample space to get ready every morning. Small closets made the limited space for storage in the room a distant concern. What was most wonderful was the maid service. EACH DAY we had new sheets, EACH DAY! The room was spotless, and had a soft floral scent each time we came back to it. Fresh towels and toiletries came with each turn of our room, and the front desk staff was knowledgeable about the area and gave great tips and directions. Overall, I don't think I could find the words to describe how impressed I was with this hotel. Such a value!

My girlfreind an I were in NYC for new year and stated in a hostel, for 4 nights, 10blocks up from here that was fairly poor even for th price we paid at that time of the year. But to our joy when we moved down to the belnord, for 3 nights the class difference was aparent, even if that hotel is the low end of the empire hotel group. However we knew the rooms would be small but there was everything there that was needed, even if it was almost shrunk to fit the smaller room dimensions. I stayed on the ground floor and it was a bit noisy from other guests but just lived with it. Room was pretty warm all the time even after turning off the heater an it was -10oc while we were there. Great location for the bus m104 straight to times square, subway around the corner and some great eateries within 2 mins walk. (city diner 91st & broadway, Tals bagels 86th& b'way, French roast 85th& b'way) to name a few! Thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would recomend to anyone who is realistic with their valuation of a budget hotel.

Very happy with our recent stay at the Belnord Hotel. We had booked the hotel for just one overnight stay since we did not want to be committed if it was not to our liking. My college aged son and myself had a room with twin beds facing the street that was a bit small but very functional. The rooms had been recently renovated and included polished wood floors, marble and tile bathrooms, flat screen tv, and wireless Internet. After staying an evening and really enjoying the location, the cleanliness of the room, and the great service we decided to stay an additional 2 evenings there. Several nice restaurants and shopping areas within walking distance. Buses, subway, and cabs are just a few steps away. We felt very safe walking around at any time of the day or night. You could sense that the residential neighborhood that surrounded this hotel was very proud of their block. Parking is an issue as it is everywhere in NYC but we were able to find parking directly in front of the hotel (by luck) and never moved the vehicle again (except for street cleaning). This is not a place that you would bring a family and expect to spend quality time in your hotel room. But, this is a great place for one or two people and even couples to be a guest at. For some reason several females stay at this hotel along with couples. If you are accustomed to being waited on, pampered, and having somebody snap to attention because you have arrived seek alternate accommodations and expect to pay three to five times the $150 an evening we paid to stay their.
Such a great place! We are going back again next month and hopefully more times int he future. I really recommend this place

My wife and I went for my birthday in October. In short the hotel rooms are small, but it is NY and we had room for bags on the floor and to get to the bathroom. The bathroom was very clean and had full tub with shower head, nice newly redone. The rooms also had hard wod floor not carpet so it was easy to tell it was clean. Over all this place will give you your own bathroom and a nice clean bed to sleep in, and in a great location with a subway station one block away so really it is everything you need from a hotel in NYC.

The rooms are very small, almost shockingly so. But they are very clean and adequate for someone who is out and about in the city. The hotel is very close to two separate subway lines and just a few stops away from all the main tourist areas. The neighborhood itself is very nice, with shops and restaurants. The staff was fine. They brought us a new hairdryer when ours blew out, but otherwise our interaction with them was at a minimum. I would definitely stay there again.

Room was tiny , you could not swing a mouse in it , never mind a cat. No cupboard/ wardrobe in which to hang a suit or shirt, not even a hook to hang a coat on.The shower( there was no bath) only had hot water sporadically.There are no breakfast facilities and no porters to help you with your luggage . All the toilets in the common areas were blocked and constituted a health hazard. The staff at the desk were, to say the least , unhelpful. DO NOT CONSIDER STAYING IN THE BELNORD , IF YOU HAVE BOOKED , CANCEL. IT IS THE WORST AND MOST OVERPRICED HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED IN .

Stayed there for three nights, its a cheap hotel and in new york you cant expect to much if you go to a budget hotel, but I think it was ok. Close to broadway and central park, subway at 86th is just nearby which brings you downtown quickly. The rooms are tiny and bed is not large, so if you are going with a friend that you don't want to share bed with it is not recommended. For me it was ok since I booked a room by myself. The room was very clean, according to other review it seems like things have improved alot since a renovation. Wireless internet is included, just call front desk and they will give you a code which you need to get access. (need a new code every 24 hours). The air condition was also a bit noisyHotel got no mini bar or restaurant etc, but resturants and breakfast places are in the area, if you go to new york you shouldn't stay at the hotel all the time anyway.

Rooms are small but clean and as opposed to previous reviews I found the service fine, free WiFi in the room brilliant, hotel is nicely located a few yards from the subway, and good value. Only downside is the noise, shame they don't or can't turn the lift signal off at night and wooden floors in the rooms and corridors add to the problem. Overall though not expensive and some great restaurants nearby.

For the price it was perfect! The room was clean. The room came with a private bath. The hotel is a minute walk from the subway, a 24 hour bakery/diner, a 24 hour CVS pharmacy. The room does not come with an alarm. The room does not come with a desk. I stayed in a double. Someone reviewed the place and complained about the hot water - just let it run for a couple of minutes before taking a shower so that it can warm up - no biggie. The AC/Heater is a bit loud so - set your temperature setting if you leave for the day. Besides that - you can't really fault them much for the PRICE! ABSOLUTELY AMAZING PRICE for NYC!

My trip to NY with my brother was supposed to be relaxed. We went to attend our cousins wedding. When we got to the hotel at 7 am they told us our room would only be ready at 12 so, we went out for the morning. At 1 pm, an hour after our room should have been ready, i came to check in and the room wasn't. So, i waited in the lobby for an hour until it was ready. Then i came up to the counter and asked for my key, they said i had to pay first. This was unusual, but i took out my brothers credit card (i paid for the flight, he for the hotel) and handed it to them. They said that because he wasn't there they wouldn't charge it. My brother and I had been there before when we dropped off our luggage, they said it would be fine if i checked in under his name. Now, it wasn't okay and i was in Manhattan and he in New Jersey so i asked for the manager. The manager came out and insisted that my brother be there for them to use the card. I was fed up. I had already been waiting for my room for 7 hours and, i was very tired front jet-lag. I asked for the key to get my bags from the luggage room so i could find another hotel, they promptly refused. I HAVE NEVER HAD SUCH A TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE! THEY WERE RUDE, TELLING ME THEY WERE BUSY AND I WAS WASTING THEIR TIME. (THERE WAS NO-ONE IN THAT TINY LOBBY)! In the end my brother had to come and, be there for there when they swiped the card to hold the money. When we got to the room it was tiny- barely any room to move in. We had to unpack and put our bags in the storage room because there wasn't enough room to move around in with our 2 medium size bags. It was not worth the money and, it wasn't a lot. I WILL NEVER STAY THERE AGAIN AND, I DISCOURAGE ANYONE FROM STAYING THERE. IT'S NOT WORTH THE STRESS, THE NOISE, OR THE INCOMPETENCE OF IT'S EMPLOYEES! (AND THERE WAS NO INTERNET OR BUSINESS CENTER, NO GYM, POOL, OR ROOM SERVICE). One word to describe this hotel would be PATHETIC!

Clean, quiet hotel. The room was small and basic, and had a clean private bathroom. If you're just looking for a clean, comfortable place to sleep and shower, this is a perfect choice. The street is quiet, we had our window open during the night! Service: friendly 24/7 staff. No breakfast or any other food service, but coffee places on the block. Luggage storage. They will arrange a private airport shuttle upon your request. Good location: Many dining options, pubs and shops at walking distance, 3 blocks from central park, 2 blocks from a (local) subway line.

'Service' pretty much non existent - unfriendly front desk staff and housekeepipng who seemed to ignore the 'do not disturb' sign. Room was fine - surprisingly large given what I was expecting from other reviews. Air conditioning was awful. So noisy and vibrated throughout the room which made it totally unusable.Location is not ideal but that is reflected in the price. Convenient for subway (once you work it out) but expect a $20 cab ride at night.This is for you if you are looking for a clean, reasonable base to explore NYC from that won't break the bank and you are happy to negotiate the public transport and go without the nice extra touches you get from a higher class hotel - a reasonable sized and very clean room with private bathroom (although they don't all have a bathroom so careful what you book)
I arrive the beds were dirty and the room was very tiny not even if I paid 30 dollars I paid 200 dollars for a small double. The bathroom does not work well either I do not suggest not well managed

Super clean, TINY room in a safe area with great staff. Cannot stress how small the rooms are, door brushed the bed when entering the room.Grandma's house was always clean & welcoming, but no frills. The internet on the computers available at the hotel is horrible, don't waste your time or money. I don't know about the wifi, I left my laptop at home since the website said they had a computer room.There was a tiny little bit of mold at the very top of the shower but I could tell it had been cleaned up. I've got mild allergies and didn't have any problems but it could be an issue for some. Other than that the room was just as expected/described, clean and small. Comfy bed, small storage/closet area, tiny but private bathroom. The walls are thin, I could hear movement in the morning but the cleaning staff honored my Do Not Disturb sign and stopped chatting when they got near my end of the hall.I'd recommend this hotel to anyone looking to save money & willing to go without the luxuries.

We stayed here at the end of September for 4 nights and had no problems what so ever. The rooms are extremely small and I mean all you can fit in the room is the bed, its the smallest room I have ever seen. However it was very clean and modern, the maids came in every day with new sheets and towels and tidied the room. Most of the hotel staff were friendly and helpfull, but there were some that were ignorant and would look the road you were on, but I suppose you can get that anywhere.The hotel is in a great location, not right in the heart of manhattan but only a 2min sub ride away from time square and the nearest station is only one block up from the hotel, you can also walk to central park from the hotel, which is fab. There is also lots of places close by to eat, the city diner on broadway just a block from the hotel does a fab breakfast, and a brilliant little irish pub called "the Parlour" is situated across the road. All in all if your looking for somewhere purely to put your head down, and dont plan spending to much time in your room, for a really good price and a good location, I think the Blenord is the place for you.

At the last minute, we decided to give ourselves three extra nights in NYC. Because our usual budget choice was booked up, we stayed at the Belnord -- with some hesitation given the mixed reviews. But the room was available at a very attractive price in a nice, quiet neighbourhood very close to the 86th Street subway stop for the no. 1 (local) train -- Times Square is less than 15 minutes away.True to the reviews, the front-desk staff when we checked in could best be described as surly, but the cleaning staff were really friendly (even though the only Spanish I know is "hola" and "gracias"). The room was TINY but actually had a small closet (!!!) and a flat-screen TV. The tip envelopes that I find so annoying were not present here, which perhaps inspired me leave a larger tip than I normally do.Bed bugs were not a problem for us. Thin walls/doors were a problem, however, but when we called the front desk to complain about noise a few doors down, in both instances someone came upstairs RIGHT AWAY to ask the offending party to quieten down. If I could complain about one thing, though, this representative should NOT tell the noisemakers which room lodged the complaint. We didn't face any retribution for our actions, but I still thought it was bad policy.

At first sight this hotel seemed like a gem. Clean, convenient, a great value. Then the bugs started biting and "management" started playing a game of "pass the buck". Their scheme was so transparent it was comical. "I just work here, I can't do anything for you", "someone will call you", "the manager had to leave for a meeting". This went on for three days. We did get moved to a different room, but there was no apology, no "sorry for your inconvenience" and a $94 suggest restitution wasn't made until we checked out. I understand that bed bugs are a problem in a lot of NYC hotels, but they way the Belnord handled the situation was shameful. It is obvious they practice this routine frequently.
This hotel is great for budget travellers. The rooms are small but clean. The hotel location is close to Manhattan. We enjoyed our stay

The 1st impression of the hotel is that the lobby is very clean. Then you open the door and find that there is not much space other than the bed. But surprisingly, I don't mind because it is so tidy and clean.It is just one street next to the subway. It takes only 10-15 minutes to bring you to 42nd street.For the price, it is very reasonable in the Big Apple.

I travelled with my 2 very young kids and parents, so we had to take two rooms: a double and a quadruple. The rooms in general are small, but were very clean and pretty new, with flat screen TV on the wall and new bathrooms as well. The big problem of the quadruple room was there is not place to hang the clothes on (no closet, no cupboard, nothing), so it was not comfortable from that perspective. There was no crib at the hotel either (one of my kids is 1).The location of the hotel is very convenient with metro station, restaurants, CVS, etc. around. The car can be parked on the street quiet easily. One of the staff at the front desk was not very polite when dealing with a couple of issues. Value: it was very good, I think it is very difficult to get a similar hotel at that price in Manhattan. Summary: very good hotel for the money you spend. Definitely I would go back if travelling with my wife alone, but not with the complete family.

Our hotel selection was based almost solely on the reviews we read on Trip Advisor. The Belnord Hotel lived up to expectations. For the money, it was the best deal we have found in Manhattan. The rooms were clean and quiet and the location was safe. For the money we were not expecting a large room. Having visited Manhattan several times from Phoenix we know the amount you pay seems to proportionate to the room size. Therefore, for a nightly fee of less than $100 we knew the room would be small. One word of advice to the management; could you install hooks on the walls and in the bathroom so we can hang our stuff on? Otherwise, very satisfied.
only enough room to waik around the bed on 2 sides. the cases used up the space at the bottom of the bed.

This was the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in - very pokey.No amenities, not even a coffee maker. No fridge. No outgoing calls. Very noisy - very thin walls. But a positive - good location - close to Central Park on one side and Hudson River on the other side.

bills itself as a boutique hotel, IT IS NOT.......... not quiet, walls are paper thin .......... not accomandating to normal hotel request (extra towels, late checkout)......smallest hoel room and bathroom Ive ever seen...............front desk personnel barely speak english ..............no espn on the tv.................................................. on the plus side is it is cheap with a comfortable bed in a great location

We've stayed in Belnord for 5 days from May 30 th an we've been really satisfied. I mean it's NYC, so the room was far from a spacious condo. But it was new, clean and quiet. So I can sincerely recommend this hotel for anyone, who's concerned about both money and quality.

My girlfriend and I stayed at the Belnord Hotel in 8 days. We booked our stay at Belnords website and the price was 420 dollars each, so very cheap compares too other hotels in New York City. We got a handicaproom, so the room was very big. The service was perfect and there was cleaning every day. The furniture was new and the bathroom was big and also looked new. We can only recommend Belnord Hotel.:)

There were no bedbugs, like we were terrified about from early reviews. But when I mentioned this to the desk clerk, he chose to make it seem as though the hotel never had bedbugs and that every previous reviewer here was a liar."People can write whatever they want," was his response.This was my first clue that not everything would go right about this experience, because what he should have said, if indeed the infestations were all taken care of (and we have no reason to believe they weren't), is something like: "we had them. then we renovated and sprayed. now we don't have them."OK, so we were well aware that the room would be incredibly small for such a low price. But the first room we were given wasn't clean. I mean it REALLY wasn't clean. It had somebody else's garbage in it!!i complained about this and was given a new room immediately, which was clean.on our second night there, the electricity went out at 7 a.m. this killed the a/c and made it almost immediately 85 degrees in the room. the phone wasn't working either. when i went downstairs to complain, 100 firemen were outside. there was a fire in the electrical room. maybe you can fault the hotel for doing something wrong that contributed to the fire, or that contributed to its not being discovered early enough, i can't say. but the lack of electricity for that day, and the elevator that was broken for the next four days, was not something they compensated anyone for. everything went relatively smoothly for the rest of our stay (except for having to run up and down four flights of stairs).

If you look at the dates of the vast majority of the bad reviews, you'll find that the Belnord was once a very shabby stay - but they've renovated every inch of this place and now it is bargain hunter's dream come true. Every last thing was BRAND SPANKING NEW. New Hardwood floors = CLEANER THAN THE CARPET AT THE PLAZA I GUARANTEE, because carpets, by their nature, are filthy even when they look clean.NO bedbugs NO stainsNO dirtNEW fixtures in the bathroomNEW tiled floor and walls in bathroomNew curtainNew towelsNEW beddingNEW everything. YES there is an elevatorBottom Line: You are paying next to nothing (I paid $75+tax per night) for a room that is perfectly clean and nice. The ONLY reason that it is SO cheap is that it is incredibly, unbelievably and a little bit laughably small. I knew it was going to be small for the price, and my husband and I did laugh a little when we opened the door but in good spirits. If you can handle the smallness, your needs will be met. I hate to say this, but if you are a person of large stature, you may be too uncomfortable in this hotel. I have to laugh at the people who complain about their "view" being a "brick wall". HELLO - you are in New York City where all of the buildings are lined up wall to wall down every street. Were they expecting that every room in the circumference of the hotel faces across the street? Or worse, were they hoping for a 10th story balcony and a view of central park for $75? Please, don't go to a bargain hotel expecting free breakfast, a Ritz Carleton sized room, a glitzy view and free parking. I actually felt like a real New Yorker with my view of that other brick building because there was a pigeon sitting on the sill and it was unique.This place made it possible for us to go to NYC for the weekend. We couldn't have afforded it otherwise. The renovations made this place a gem for those of us with smaller incomes. I would go back - without a doubt. Unless they raise the price too high.PS. Try Tal Bagels (head north on Broadway) for a nice bagel!

We stayed here for 6 days in May and for the price we paid, we felt that the room was small but clean, tidy and modern. The staff were helpful and it was very well situated, close to Central Park and Broadway. We were pleasantly surprised after reading some of the reviews on here. Would recommend for a short stay.

The location is great. The room was very small but clean. Nice bathroom, but I found it difficult to manage in such a small space with no closet or hook to hang any clothes on. Liked the wood floors. Beware of the bed bugs. They are really infested with them. We are covered in red itchy spots. I don't think I'll stay there again, couldn't sleep much because of the itching bites.

I loved this place. I thought it was clean, and modern and the price was right. I figured the rooms would be small, and they were. But seriously, how much room does one need? The neighborhood is awesome and unless you are looking for a Planet Hollywood within arms reach, you won't be disappointed. The train is also right around the corner. And they provide free wifi to boot. I wish all hotels had hardwood floors, it just seems cleaner. I will and have recommended this to all my friends. If you need the stereotypical Time Sq. hotel with a mini bar and room service, this isn't for you. But if you just need a nice clean place to rest your head, I found this to be perfect.

A friend and I stayed at the Belnord the first weekend in April. The room was $89/nt plus tax on Hotels.com- room 514. The place has been undergoing renovations and we got a renovated room with twin beds. Everything was brand new and spotless and I cannot say enough good things about the experience. The decor was fashionable. The beds were comfy, the linens were fresh and clean. The towels were thick and fluffy. The bathroom was brand new with beautiful tile, a pedestal sink and a good sized shower. The toiletries were basic- no name soap and no name shampoo. A flat screen television is mounted to the wall. WiFi is free with a code from the front desk.The building is located on a quiet side street in a very safe area with tons of shops and restaurants within walking distance. We could have easily spent the weekend hanging out in the neighborhood. It's a short walk to Central Park on one side, and Riverside Park on the other. The subway ( 1 2 3) is a block away. It was an easy walk to the Museum of Natural History.The rooms are small - there was not much room for anything besides the beds, a nightstand and a little alcove with a closet. There was no chair, and not really room for one. There is no tub in the bathroom, only a shower. But we did not find the room cramped. I have stayed in more expensive NY hotels that were about the same size but not nearly as nice.We were originally in Rm 501, right across from the elevator with a very loud bell. I asked to be moved because of the noise, the pleasant staff immediately changed the room. Room 501 did not have a closet, only a small dresser. It did have a writing desk, but seemed smaller than the room we ended up in (514). Although I read of complaints of noise from the renovations we did not have that problem, no jack hammers, no noisy neighbors. We were completely stunned by how nice the room was, the cheap price, and the amazing location. I've stayed in a lot of hotels in NY, but from now on I will stay at the Belnord.

as i open the door too the room the room was so small i almost fell out the window ,when i rushed to the bathroom i realize how small it was i had to put one leg inside the bathtub and the other leg outside the room to take a #2,when i was is time to finish my duties the bathtub curtain was to close to the toilet that i accidently stained ,the bed was so uncomfortable and small as i turned to the right my wife fell to the floor hitting her head with the cheap night table,looking at the window was a view of a old man eating soup,when i went down stairs to talk too the manager all he said i dont spieaki in inglish lol...(aint that a something)the tv was placed on a aukward angle that made it uncomfortable to watch the tv this place should be called the whiplash hotel,the hallways where so small we had to walk sideways to reach the elevators...if you are afraid of small places this is the perfect place to bring your claustrophobic enemy...keep away from this hell hole igloos,i rather sleep in the trains at least i know what to expect and fair is just 2.00 dollars....

We were really supriced how nice this place was!Me and my husband stayed at Belnord hotel 19 - 24 of december and we loved it. Ok the room was cold but the blancets in NY are cheep so that was no problem. The room was nice and cosy, tiny but comfortable! The bathroom was spotless and our sheats and towels were changed everyday! The area was nice and everything worked nicely at the hotel. They are renovating it at the moiment so there were workmen running about in the mornings but that did not bother us. So after the renovation it will be a lovely place to stay. The subway was just 2 minutes walk aroud the corner and lots of pubs and restaurants!We will be there again!!!!

This is one of the worst budget hotels I've ever stayed in. Although the location is really good, just one block away from the subway and walking distance to 24/7grocery stores and Central Park, it isn't worth the money, even if you need to go cheap.The pricy tiny rooms are really COLD and the heater makes a very loud noise which makes it almost impossible to get some good sleep after a long day walking around the city, I know you only use the room for sleeping in, but even this was too much to ask for at this place.Another thing that makes the stay here even worse is the very unfriendly staff, it seemed to us they were there not to be bothered at all.I would definitely not stay there again and not recommend it.

This hotel was booked for me as part of a business trip to New York City. After reading the previous reviews, I approached my stay with trepidation and was prepared to leave if necessary. However, I was pleasantly surprised to find that the renovations were nearly done, that it was clean and quiet, and that overall it was a satisfactory place to stay. The rooms are quite small, but the closet and bathroom are adequate. There do not seem to be any amenities, but restaurants and other services in the area are plentiful, and it is within easy walking distance of public transportation.

This hotel is in a great location - 2 minutes from subway and less than 10 minutes walk to central park. However it is under construction at present and it looks pretty terrible. we had no idea they were doing renovations when we booked and were pretty disappointed in it. we were on the 4th floor which doesn't have an elevator stop so we had to go up to the 5th floor and walk down a flight of stairs. There were exposed electrical wires hanging out of the walls in the hallways. Constant noise from the power tools being used. The reception people were pretty rude at times.not a good experience, but the rooms that have been renovated looked pretty good, so may be okay when all the work is done.

My boyfriend and I booked this hotel for Monday, September 15th ($300 for the night), and arrived on to this 'building site' early in the morning. It's quite close to Central Park (this hotels only apparent positive) so we took a wander around there and we checked in later on in the afternoon. We had to drag our bags up three flights of stairs as there was no lift (a kind builder helped us!) and the carpets were FILTHY with tiny, claustrophobic hallways. Our room was absolutely appalling - tiny, dirty, a hard bed with an uncomfortable plastic cover on the mattress, a shabby desk and chair with a tiny bathroom. The towels looked very suspect. The room was dark and looked onto an alleyway with an archaic air conditioning unit. We tried to stay out of the room for as long as possible for the day. When we came back, exhausted from our day of sightseeing, there was a fire alarm going off in one of the rooms down the hallway. We visited Reception twice and called them from our room, as did other disgruntled guests we met in the hall. We received a frosty and impatient response that the Maintenance guy would 'look into it' - it took him two hours to do so.After very little sleep, we ran out of this hotel at 8.30am. I made a complaint at Reception but didn't get any satisfaction as they said this hotel was advertised as being under construction and we should have duly received a discount for where we stayed from Expedia - none of this was relayed to me at my time of booking. Who would knowlingly book into a building site? We were eventually given the number for Expedia's Sales Support in the US - after two unsuccessful and stressful 10 minute phone calls, they couldn't even locate us on their system?? I will definitely be following this up with them.I think the positive reviews are for the more updated other side of the hotel (they even have a lift!), but avoid the older side at all costs - particularly if it's going to cost you 300 bills a night.

If you like bedbugs, you'll like this hotel. I paid $250 a night for a hotel that had bedbugs, a renovation going on, broken bed light, outlets that didn't work, and a filthy carpet. For a vacation damper, stay at the SmellNord. I knew I would get a small room looking out onto a shaft, as that is what you get in New York City, but the filth, bedbugs and construction were unacceptable. PS Take the toilet paper roll off the dispenser if you like to remain seated while going to the bathroom.

Stayed at the hotel 3 nights ... Completely re- done new beds, sheets, floors and bathrooms... Small, but not bad at all ... The lobby was the last part of the hotel being worked on. Smells like new too. Nice area, close to the subway and food. No Bed Bugs like prior reviews. See hotel website, looks exactly like the photo. There is a older side of the building, so make sure you ask for the new renovated section.

We stayed at the Belnord for 5 nights. There was construction work going on so the front lobby was covered over and the stairs were a bit dusty. The room itself was clean and the ensuite was lovely, especially the power shower! It was very close to some lovely (and quite cheap) restaurants and grocery shops, and the subway was 1 block away. Very close to Central Park and a ten minute subway ride to Grand Central Station and Times Square. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and the room was cleaned thoroughly every day. No sign of bugs or cockroaches,and the air conditioning was good - essential in July! All in all a pleasent and comfortable stay if you're on a budget.

The hotel was under construction when we got there. My boyfriend and I went to nyc for 3days and stayed at the belnord. It was very clean and everyone including maids were very helpful and friendly. Our 1st room was on the 2nd floor but the air conditioning wasn't working properly. They quickly upgraded us to a larger room with a private bath. The location of this hotel is excellent. The only down fall was our new room was on the 5th floor but it was really nice and really clean. I would definitely stay there again.

I was extremely disappointed with this hotel. I had made plans to travel to NYC with my boyfriend. We were to go to a Yankees game and then I'd book the Belnord Hotel after. Plans fell through and we missed the game due to very poor directions and when we got to the hotel which had no parking (I had to pay $45 to park my car in a garage overnight after already paying $152.45 for the hotel for one night) it was under construction. We walked down the hallway to the "bedroom" if you can call it that and I just got more disappointed. There was no bathroom in our room but it was down the hall where it had to be shared with others on our floor. The locks didn't even work that well because someone tried coming in while by boyfriend was taking a shower! There was one window in our room and the mini blinds weren't even long enough to go down to the window ledge! So people in the next building could have looked in if I hadn't blocked the opening with the towels and our bags. Then all that was in the room was the double bed, 2 small endtables (one on either side of the bed) and a very small "closet". There was only about a foot or maybe a foot and a half from the end of the bed to the wall and that's all there was to the room!!! The bed was hard and very uncomfortable. There was a tv in the room but in order to watch it you had to sit in a very uncomfortable position which hurt my neck. To only make things worse I was awakened in the middle of the night by the guest in the next room snoring. That's how thin the walls were. Then I heard all the construction workers very early and even though I had the "do not disturb" sign on the door, the maid STILL knocked twice asking if we needed the room cleaned. Are you kidding me? It says do not disturb so please don't!!! But it didn't really matter because I still heard the vaccum running. I'm glad we were only staying for one night and hadn't booked it for a week. I would not recommend this hotel to anybody.

LocationThe location on this hotel is excellent, its about 10 min walk (if that) from Time Square. If you walk down broadway there are many shops to keep you entertained as your walking down.RoomVery basic, No bugs, double bed, small storage cupboard, dressing table, Tv, air con, Small but "VERY" clean bathroom. No safe!Hotel I found the hotel basic but it was perfect for somewhere to crash down of a night, Although i was very disappointed with the service we recieved during our stay. Maids where friendly, as i later found, they had stolen shoes and a bag , that i's left in my room. We complained and they did nothing to compensate. I stay at this hotel AT YOUR OWN RISK,and take your passports out with you wherever you go.Tips on staying in New york* Walk everywhere IF POSS* If going during winter, take Extra warm clothes and layers.*Tax and Tips will be added to eveything*If getting Taxi's just get the yellow cabsHope this review has helped, thanx for your time!

We saw no bug during the week we stayed at the Belnord in March, 2008. That was important to me. We had a room with a double bed and a private bath, which was also important since we are older than most of the Belnord customers and use the bathroom frequently during the night. Our bathroom was new and spotlessly clean, though tiny, like everything else in this hotel. If you want a bath, you will have to sit with your knees bent. The shower, however, was nice. The sheets were clean. The maid service was nice and friendly, though we were given only one wash cloth daily, sometimes none, and our plastic glasses were not replenished. The room was about 9 feet by 10 or 11 feet, which included the closet and bathroom. The double bed was very small, and the pillows were about an inch thick. Everything in the room was of cheap quality. There was one bedside table and a small desk, both of pressed wood with some of the veneer chipped off. There was one straight-backed wooden chair with a filthy stained seat cover. The carpeting was filthy and stained; the wallpaper was hanging loose in a couple places around the window. There was a plastic zip-up mattress cover on the mattress, for which I was grateful, knowing that is a way to help prevent bed bugs. Outside air came right in around the window air-conditioner, though it did not matter to us in March because the room was warm enough to sleep in. When we turned on the heat briefly, the clanging in the pipes was loud and quite amusing. It wouldn't be amusing, though, if you actually needed heat and had to leave it on. The halls are very narrow; if you stick out your elbows, they will touch each wall ( and I am only 5'4") - but who cares how wide the halls are? If you are obese, or very tall, you will not be comfortable here, however.  So why would one stay at the Belnord? Amazingly, $150/night is cheap in NYC, especially for this area. The location is wonderful, my favorite area in NYC. There are scores of good cafes and restaurants on Broadway and more on Amsterdam, between which this hotel is located. It is close to subway stations, the Natural History museum, Central Park, Zabars. We spent some time in the Barnes and Noble nearby and found the entertainment for the evening was a group of Times Square actors reading parts from short plays. We were eating in a small local restaurant with great inexpensive food when Jerry Stiller came in and sat down for dinner (George Costanza's dad on Seinfeld and actor Ben Stiller's real-life dad).  If you need to "do New York" as cheaply as possible, this is a good option. Our bed and bathroom were clean, and we were able to sleep here in a terrific location for at least $50/night less than any other place other than a hostel.

I have never slept in a room anywhere so small and the window looked out onto a shaft (brick wall). Room was gritty simply because there is no way a vacuum could get in and out of there. Carpet was tacky under my feet. Bed reasonably clean and comfortable. The air con (80 deg. weather) made more noise than we could imagine. Location was great. Shared baths had water all over (leak somewhere). Hall too narrow to carry a bag in each hand( not kidding). No room for a dresser, only room for two nightstands and the bed. Door almost hit the bed it was so close to the door. TV was right above our head (18inches from foot of bed to the wall) so we had to lie flat to see it, but could not hear it over the air con. Front desk staff were ok. Cleaners were nice. It did not ruin our trip and we stayed because the town was booked solid. We took photos of what $160.00 buys in NY to show our kids. I have stayed all over the world backpacking and this is youth hostel class on hotel prices. I'd book earlier and stay off the island next time for a decent room for the same price and take the subway in.

We found the Belnord to be good value for money. The room we had was extremely small, but that didn't matter to us since we were in New York to experience the city, not hang out in our hotel room. We'd leave at about 9 or 10 each morning and return at 10 or 11 at night. The bathroom on our floor (shared, across the hall) was immaculately clean at all times, and had brand new fixtures. Our room itself had older carpets and furnishings, but it was clean. The service was good, and the staff were accommodating. The location was the best thing about the hotel. We were in a very safe, really nice Upper West Side neighbourhood near Central Park. It was very close to good restaurants and shops, and had easy access to the subway.There is a good drop-off laundry service right next door to the Belnord. We found it very useful. They wash, dry, and fold for you, and charge reasonable rates.

It's close to a subway station, a deli and a drugstore.The outside hotel and its area are ok, but the inside is a mess and smells to mould. The rooms are very small but we didn't expect more and the bathroom is clean. I am sure its written somewhere but we didn't pay attention there's no lift.Altough we've complained, they never turned the heating on and believe me it was too cold in early december, so we had to leave New York one day earlier and we've got no refund.

Me and my boyfriend stayed at Belnord from the 19th - 23rd December 2007, we booked Belnord through Expedia, we choose this hotel purely on price, as it was an absolute bargin copared to the other prices, we worked out it was about £30 a night!!! After looking into the hotel we saw it was in a very good location but then started reading reviews about bed bugs and rude staff we began to worry!........ BUT.....upon arrival (quite late at night and with the flu) we found the man at reception to be extremely friendly and helpful. Must admit when we saw the room we did laugh as it was quite small, just enough rom to walk around the bed with a bedside table a tv and a small cupboard..... as our trip was or only 4 days all we required really was a bed to sleep in at night and this is what we got. The room was very clean and was cleaned and had the sheets and towels changed everyday. And concerning the bedbugs..... we did not see one for the entire stay.On our floor there were about 5 bathrooms and toilet rooms, almost enough for one to every room, there was always a bathroom free when you needed and they were very clean. On one ocassion the radiator dial snapped off, went down to reception and th "fix it" guy came up literally staight away and sorted it out!!!!Get the subway everywhere from 86th, just down the road, save your money on taxis and eat at the Olive Garden in Times Square!!!!!We think this hotel has been given a pretty hard time considering how cheap it was... you get what you pay for!!!!!

We had planned our trip to NY and was excited about our visit our plans were to conduct some business and enjoy visiting our friends, Due to unforeseen weather conditions, our trip had to be canceled, the Belnord Hotel, sees it fit to charge for one night's accommodation, for events totally out off our control. The air line issues a credit at no additional charge, If you rely on customers coming back repeat business, in which I will visiting NY on several occasions, I am sure a credit can be issued or at best refund, under any other conditions that might be controllable I can understand such policies. However the weather is not one of them. I think that taking money from your clients is not best business practices. When it comes to service, zero, when it comes to policy 110%, I am sure I will not refer any of my clients or customer to this hotel.

Just in the door from the hotel and have to say it was just fine. You get what you pay for. It was safe, not at all fancy and the staff were courteous. I would go back there as the price is right and the neighbourhood was great. It is not the plaza but it did the job. I had an executive twin room that was very spacious. The hotel is old and worn but all in all I would return and was pleasantly surprised. Give it a go!!!!!!

This hotel was by far the nastiest hotel I have ever stayed in. I rated it a one, however, it is not even deserving of that. The room I booked was so small that basically all that COULD fit in it was a bed. To watch the TV, you would have to put your head at an uncomfortable angle, as it was suspended from the ceiling. There was long black hair in the bed, and the room smelled of what I do not know. I complained and was upgraded to the "best room available". This room was somewhat better, but on the way to the room I spotted a cockroach crawling up the wall. I brought the manager to see the roach, and he did not seem to care. In the room, there were stained towels on the bed, and again the long black hair. There was no elevator, and the carpets looked like they should have be replaced years ago. There were holes in the floors, which I assumed had something to do with the repairs. We checked our bags at checkout, and they charged $5.00 to hold them, and there was no bellman to carry bags. I cancelled the rest of the reservation, and by the end of it all my friend and I renamed the hotel to Hotel Hellnord.I wouldn't leave an animal in such a place.

I found my room clean and pleasant, and I actually ended up spending alot more time there than I expected because I had work to do and theyhad fast wireless Internet (for $10 a day). The bathrooms were finetoo. It's no frills, but quite liveable. I experienced none of theproblems other reviewers reported. There was dust in the hallwaysbecause they were undergoing a major renovation, but that didn'taffect the areas I occupied.

Where to start – just avoid this hotel. The outside looks okay, but on arrival you will realise this is not worth the money. The staff are extremely rude and unhelpful, but you could look past that if the hotel was at least clean. The rooms are awful and filthy, with dirty un-cleaned carpets and even filthier bed sheets. The beds are tiny with hard mattresses that are covered with PLASTIC sheets. These sheets are extremely uncomfy and very noisy when you move. All the pipes in the bathroom were sticking out loose from the wall, ie. Shower head hung off the wall, taps spun round on the ends of the pipes and mould grew round the edges of the bath. All halls are filthy and absolutely stink of smoke – the room was meant to be non-smoking, but all they did was spray overpowering sickly air freshener around. The room was literally 2 single beds and no room to move. We had to look through our suitcases on the bed as nowhere to unpack. When we went to checkout we asked if we could leave our luggage for a few hours – we were told they CHARGE!!! to store luggage in a room that anyone could access. We hastily left and will never book a room with them again. It is quite close to a tube station, but not on the express – stay either a few blocks higher or lower these are better for the express.

I stayed at the Belnord one night. It was cheap for NY so I didn't expect 5 star accommodation. It's true the room was minuscule, the aircon growled and burped all night, and the bathroom was down the hall. But my bed was comfortable and clean, and the hotel staff gave useful advice when I needed it. A porter carried some of my stuff up to the 4th floor. While I wouldn't want to commit myself to a lifetime at the Belnord, I thought it gave me basically what I needed, a roof over my head and clean bed-linen

Oct 20th.Stayed at the Belnord for 6 nights. It was great. Had read about the bed bugs. I saw NONE. Room lovely and cleaned every day. All staff friendly and very helpful. Fantastic for getting around NY, minutes from Central Park and seconds from the subway. You spend very little time in your room as you taking in the NY sights. There was a great little deli round the corner for tea, coffee and little snacks. Great bars and restaurants really close. Found ALL the people in NY sooo friendly. THERE WERE NO BED BUGS!!!

Just returned from a wonderful weekend in NYC (Oct. 12-15, 2007). My stay at the Belnord Hotel was fine. The staff (front desk & housekeeping) were courteous and helpful. I booked a double bed with ensuite bathroom and all was well.I had read previous reviews before my departure and so was on the look out for bedbugs. I am glad to say i did not encounter any.As others have said before me, the location of this hotel is optimal for a stay in New York City (upper west side Manhattan). I walked to and through Central Park and down Fifth Avenue from the hotel. Also the 86th St. subway line is just steps away. I felt relatively safe traveling the subway in the evenings and walking back to the hotel.For its affordability, I would consider returning to the Belnord. for future stays in NYC.

We were not in New York for the hotel. The place was acceptable. The bed bugs were not. Good memories of biking New York but itching for a week, paying 200.00$ a night was not. We are not the first to complain. Nothing have been done. Stay away until the bugs are gone.Marino

I would give this hotel -100 They screwed up my reservation so I ended up wasting $300 dollars when i didn't even get to check in.DON'T STAY HERE.And if you call in, don't trust the receptionists because they basically LIEDand i got my ENTIRE reservation screwed up.The receptionists are very rude too.I would just spend more money and stay at a better place.STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL

very convient accomdation.out the door,to left and 5 mins was centeral park. To the right was uptown broadway street with a subway to take you anywhere within the city.Accomdation ideal for money if you plan on been out and about all day. Room was small but clean and shared bathroom was immac with no problems from other guests. situated in quite street. No problems with traffic. Ideal for those on a budget

New York's Manhattan must be one of the most expensive areas to stay in but never get sucked into staying at the Belnord Hotel. Due to a mix up in travel arrangements, we needed somewhere to stay for 1 night - desperately. We shouldn't have been that desperate to book into the Belnord.We upgraded to the Executive class of room (where did they get that adjective from) simply so we could have ensuite facilities and paid a crippling $346 - for 1 night only (no breakfast of course). Our room took the award for being the most overpriced weathered shoe box in town with a similar size shower / toilet. In fact once we opened our cases, there was no empty space on the room's floor - honestly. We were however lucky to be on the ground floor as the Belnord does not have a lift to any of the 119 rooms nor does it have a porter. Even hauling your cases from the sidewalk to the reception area is quite a feat.Our room carpet was filthy and the receptionist totally uncaring.This area of the Upper West Side (between Central Park and Riverside Park) is particularly nice but if you do visit, do not stay at the Belnord. They even wanted to charge us $5 to store our cases after checking out and before leaving for the airport. Yes, after just settling a bill for $346. Never again.

I thought that I'd give this place a try in order to save a few dollars. Big mistake on my part. I've never run hotel and you can call me crazy but I just don't think there's any excuse for bugs infesting a bed that I sleep in or for those bugs feasting on me while I sleep as I wound up itching and covered in bites including on my face. I was moved and occupied 3 different rooms during my 7-day stay. Wrong answer. As for the rooms themselves, consider yourself lucky if you have a closet to store your belongings and if the carpet is clean. Try not to get neck strain while watching the television that's at ceiling level. Try meditation in order to relax on their most uncomfortable beds. And "service" is not this place's middle name. So that's what equates a "budget hotel"? Sad. Ironically, the one thing that you'd think would be a problem (shared bathrooms) wasn't. They were fine, clean and there were 3 or 4 on every floor. On the bright side, the location is great. I love the Upper West side, but that's about all I can offer as an endorsement for the Belnord.Unless you only other option is sleeing on the subway, don't stay at the Belnord.

From the outside the hotel did not look bad, we were a party of 4. The room I was given looked like the carpet was not cleaned for months, the telephone initially did not work but then it was fixed after having an argument with the night porter who was telling me I did not know how to use the phone. There was no remote control for the TV despite asking for one. Worst of all one person in our party found a bed bug on her pillow, when complaining another women complained that she had many bed bugs in her bed and she was bitten in many places. After all that I did not bother about telling them the air conditioning did not work. We left the hotel in a taxi booked by them (the best part of the visit, both taxi and leaving the hotel).We have since found out that this problem has been going on for some time without the hotel doing anything to resolve this, I think they should be forced to close and then be fumigated before they are permitted to reopen.I know hotels can easily get this problem due to different people staying there and taking appropriate action to resolve the problem is acceptable but it is not acceptable to carry on without resolving this problem.I have had to spray my case and contents and put all clothes in the wash in order to prevent anything getting into my home (I should not have to do this).This is not a fake review it is totally factual.To sum it up, I would not recommend it.

New York rooms are expensive and as has been stated by others, this hotel offers some of the cheapest non hostel type rooms around so expectations weren't high. First impressions were favourable. Location was great and even the view over the piles of basins and toilets from a refurbishment didn't seem too bad so long as you kept the blinds down. We had en-suite facilities but there were plenty of communal bathrooms which were kept clean and were never in use when we walked past them. All was well until our third night when I was roused by a rustling noise on the bedside table. When the light went on we found an unopened packet of crisps had been gnawed into and there was a smattering of crisps on the top of the unit. Further investigation showed a mouse under some bags in the corner of the room which disappeared when it was disturbed. The night receptionist initially said that he could not move us as there were no free rooms but conceeded under pressure and we were given a miniscule room with less than two feet of space on either side of the bed. The mattress was covered with plastic and then only one thin sheet which led to a very uncomfortable night and the air conditioning unit was so noisy that all chance of sleep was lost. To top it all ,we saw in the morning that the clothes cupboard was equipped with it's very own bait box so obviously rodents are not an uncommom site in the Belnord's rooms. Having said all of this, we did have a great stay in New York (THANK YOU, KEVIN ) . Just be aware that if you were concerned by the reports of the bed bugs there are other more terrifying creatures lurking in the fabric of this establishment.

We weren't sure what to expect for the price, as it is pretty much the cheapest hotel that's not a hostel on Manhatten. The location is superb, great subway links and a short walk from Central Park. Leonardo Di Caprio was even filming a new film across the road while we were there.The room was small, but aren't they all in NYC? It was clean, with a daily maid service, a good air conditioning unit, and a small TV with a good selection of channels. There was a built in wardrobe and separate cupboard for your luggage. I was really worried about a shared bathroom, but there were 4 bathrooms on my floor and there was always one free even at peak times. The bathrooms were always sparkly clean.Whilst there isn't a bar or a big lobby area, there are vending machines and a very smiley man on reception.I would recommend this hotel to couples and singles, but not if you have mobility issues, as there was no lift.

I stayed at this place for 10 nights just returned today. Overall the hotel is good. If you are looking for somewhere to dump your bags and sleep then look no further. The subway station is literally 30 seconds away so I had good access to the centre of town. The staff overall are helpful, apart from this one guy who didn't even acknowledge me when I greeted him.Problems were few. The showers turned hot and cold a few times, there was always toilet roll but no towel to dry hands. Also no ironing board which is the reason I give the place a 3/5. If you are looking for safe, basic and conveinient this place is very good.

I found this hotel a couple of months ago and booked it right away. the price and location were just what I was looking for. After paying in full I started reading reviews. Had I done this first I would not have chosen this hotel. All the reviews about bedbugs scared me but I'm too cheap to change my reservation and I knew I wouldn't find a hotel on the upper west side for the same price, so I decided to risk getting bedbugs. Before my trip I spent many hours reading about bedbugs and I got really scared of bringing them home with me. When I got to the Belnord our room was on the fifth floor(no elevator) but that didn't bother me considering the price. Our room wasn't too small and It was fairly clean. I immediately looked behind headboards and in drawers for signs of bed bugs and all I found was a few black spots that could have been bed bug droppings (They looked exactly like pictures I've seen on the internet.) We slept with the lights on and kept our hard plastic suitcase (which is almost air tight) closed at all times. The first night as I was trying to sleep I noticed a blood stain on the wall right next to my bed which was the same size and shape as the stains I'd been warned about on the internet. During our one week stay we got a couple of bites that probably were from bed bugs but that's it. Bugs that aren't very hungry won't come out if it's light, or so I've read. I don't think we brought any bugs home with us and overall the hotel was great. But I felt worried about bed bugs for months so I'm still not sure if it was worth it. If you are deciding wheather or not to book this hotel read reviews on this site for a couple hours first. Then read about bed bugs. If you're not scared of bed bugs, this hotel is perfect for the budget traveller.

Despite reading awful reviews on this place my boyfriend and i decided to give it the benefit of the doubt - what a mistake!! We could barely get out bags in the door of the room it was that small! The bed had the grottiest sheet on which was stained so we used our sleeping bag liners instead. The bathroom could barely fit one person in let alone two and it had the smallest bath ive ever seen i dont think you could even call it a bath! The staff on reception were rude (apart from 1 girl) and would not give change for using THEIR washine machines they made us walk down to the shop. Once we had walked down to the shop and put our washine in the machine we realised they were so tight that all the machines worked on a COLD WASH ONLY and so our washing came back out dirty and im not joking!! We paid £250 for 3 nights stay here and i would never ever go back or recommend it to anyone. The only good thing is that it is central and just off broadway.

The hotel was great - after worrying what it would be like after reading the reviews on here, we were pleased with our choice. So close to the subway. lots of shops & eateries, so easy to get around. The room was smallish, but big enough for us and our bags with ample storarge. It was clean. The plastic sheets around the bed were a bit annoying, but it did not ruin our stay by any means.The hotel is well equipped with internet, phones, vending machines if needed and I thought the staff were very helpful if needed. Would recommend this hotel - no problem. Is lovely to stay up near Central Park too.

I was nervous because of the mixed reviews,on this site and others and often put aside things stated by people being far too fussy, perhaps they should be staying in 5 star Hotels instead of 1 star (with the equivalent prices of course.) For the money I do not know if you could get any better, the bathrooms were very clean, I found the staff very pleasant, but I was not asking for any services. ( I do not think one should expect this at the price one is paying here) There was an unusual smell, but it was not totally unpleasant, but I was on the ground floor so cannot comment on any other part of the hotel perhaps someone had brought in an Indian curry or something, so without airing out the rooms with the doors and windows open any odors left over may very well linger, and again for the money I did not find it something worth worrying about and after all I was in New York with so much to do. I did take my own silk sleeping bag and use this as I was concerned about the reports I had read. I checked out the bed as suggested and found nothing the first night or the second night on my third night I found something tiny and dead on the sheet, but refused to think about it I had one more night to sleep there. On my last morning (3 nights) I found 3 tiny dead bugs under my sleep sack, Now I checked the bed every night before going to bed so they appeared thru the night. I decided to have the hottest shower possible and leave asap I had been warned and because of finances chose to ignore this. If it had not been for the dead bugs I would have rated this place above average for New York prices, but sadly it REALLY does look like they have a bad problem with bugs, the sheets were changed every day and the mattress was encased in plastic as someone else said, but I still found bugs, I am still scratching but of course it is all in the mind!! New York is a great place to visit and I felt very safe as an older female solo traveler., I would not hesitate to go again but hopefully next time I can afford at least the standard of Holiday Inn Express which I guess I am going to have to pay around $300.00 per night(for the equivalent in Manhattan) and not $119.00 as I paid at The Belnord. I cannot say it was awful, but if I had a car at the door I would have probably not booked in, and gone looking elsewhere, but as my first trip to new york I neither wanted to spend the time or the money, as The Lion King, Inherit the Wind , an evening cruise on the Hudson, and many other delights may not have happended.

I was privileged enough to spend one week in a 5* hotel whilst in NY on business so after deciding to stay for the weekend and arrange my own accommodation, the Belnord seemed like an absolute bargain!Having enjoyed a week of luxury and having read mixed reviews about this hotel, it was with great trepidation that I checked in. I am pleased to say that all my fears dissipated as soon as got to the hotel.The location is fantastic; just one block from 86th St tube. The hotel itself is on a fairly quiet leafy street, but just off a main road. I was a solitary female so it was important to feel safe coming back to the hotel on an evening.I found the Hotel staff to be perfectly pleasant and helpful. A couple of times my key card deactivated and I couldn't get into my room. A quick trip back to the reception soon sorted this out.The room itself was fairly compact and quite basic, but what do you expect for only 68GBP (incl.) a night?! I was lucky enough to have a private bathroom which was spotless and I had everything I needed. I have to admit that having read so many reviews about bed bugs, I had almost convinced myself I would not be sleeping alone!! Again, I am pleased to say that I had no problem whatsoever and did not encounter any bed bugs.All in all I would recommend this hotel to any traveller on a budget or anyone wishing to save their money to be spent elsewhere (e.g shopping!!) If you are only in NY for a short trip, then realistically you are going to be spending a fraction of your time in your hotel room. Providing it is clean and comfortable and in a good location, what more do you need? This hotel was all of these things and an absolute bargain by NY prices.

I stayed at this hotel for nearly 2 months to do some travelling around New York and other areas, i stayed here from the 26th of Febuary to the 7th of April, i stayed in two different rooms because i made 2 seperate reservations (because i was staying longer than 28 days), and both rooms were perfect.There were no bedbugs. The rooms were cleaned every single day by friendly maids, every member of staff here are friendly and kind.The location is amazing, the subway is literally 40 steps away! Its on the same block as the hotel, the subway train "1, 2 and 3" line, which takes you from the hotel, through times sqaure, all the way downtown to the world trade site.The hotel is in a very safe area, in my whole 2 months i did not have any trouble at all, the hotel is right on broadway! I beleive its one of the safest areas in the city (upper west side on broadway).I was very pleased to find a lobby with a fast computer with the internet, and some vending machines, the internet is nice and cheap to use.Bathrooms were always empty when i wanted to use them, there were 5 bathrooms to each floor, all the bathrooms are spotlessly clean, and they are cleaned daily by the maids. In the whole time i was there, the bathrooms were always empty so you can have hot showers or baths anytime you wish.All the rooms have TV's with many stations, and a phone, and icebox to keep your items cold if needed.There are no bedbugs here.I am very impressed with this hotel, and i will always stay there again when i go back to New York, it really is an amazing city!Matthew Holland

I booked this hotel, in January not expecting greatness. It was only $400 for 4 nights, which is a steal for NYC!! It is also in an excellent location. I was worried about bedbugs, but decided to risk it.We arrived Saturday night. There are 2 stairways, and apparently the other stairway leads to creepy abandoned rooms. More on that later.We climbed the EXTREMELY NARROW stairs up to floor 5. (No one helped the two of us carry our 4 bags up the 5 flights!!) I felt extremely claustrophobic here. The wall enclosures around the stairs are very close. We got to the room, opened the door, and the perimeter of the bed was about a foot smaller than the perimeter of the room. Also, itwas snowing outside, but it was so suffocatingly hot in the room thatwe had to turn on the air conditioner. So it was small and suffocating-great combo!!Down the hall, another tenant was blasting techno music and occasionally strolling down the hall barefoot-flashbacks to my freshman dorm room. Clearly this guy was living here. Then I went to the bathroom. I am very petite and the toilet was facing the wall with about an inch of space between the toilet and the wall. I had trouble squeezing into that space, so I can't imagine how anyone elsemanages. Also, there was no soap or towel in the restroom, meaning that everyone else there is NOT WASHING THEIR HANDS after using the facilities. YUCK.After about 20 minutes, we called my brother (who lives in Brooklyn) to come meet us. He apparently went up the other staircase, which ledhim to some creepy torn down area of the building that was reminiscent of "The Shining." Also, it was comforting to know that someone without a room key could stroll in the hotel and hang out on the floors-and even use the bathrooms! (Attention New Yorkers: Here is a public restroom alternative to McDonald's!!!)Top-notch security in place. I tried to show my brother the tiny weird bathroom (it was adjacent to my room and any noises in there could be heard very clearly). I pressed the door, which was unlatched, and someone was INSIDE and slammed it shut!! Who goes to the bathroom without closing the door or locking it??? In a hotel with shared bathrooms?? And you know he didn't wash his hands afterwards!!This hotel was all kinds of creepy and uncomfortable. I cannot stressenough the absurdity of requiring a/c in FREEZING COLD TEMPERATURES!!! I felt like I was being smothered with a hot blanket.YUCK.DO NOT STAY IN THIS TINY PIECE OF HELL. ENROLL IN COLLEGE AND LIVE IN A DORM ROOM INSTEAD. (actually, even my dorms were much nicer and better than this crappy dump.)

great place for those who are coming to visit NYC for the first time. bus M60 from laguardia airport takes you almost to the hotel, and the subway is very close too. that makes easy going aroung and get back to hotel at any time. rooms are average, clean enough, nothing special, but enough for pleasant staying. bed thing is they do not have breakfast unlike most of European hotels. hotel is settled in peaceful and safe area (upper west side) and central park is only few blocks away. you can walk to Metropolitan museum that is just across the central park. nice place to stay in NYC

We read mixed reviews about this hotel and was hesitant to book. The location was the really the only reason we did book. We had our fingers crossed that we hadnt made a mistake.We were pleasantly surprised! Very clean hotel and rooms. There was never a wait for the shared bathrooms and they were also very clean. The staff is friendly and helpful. GREAT location. Step out of the hotel and you are ready to walk anywhere! The Park is like 3 blocks away, Museum of Natural History is close too. CVS drugstore across the street. Great eateries and shopping all over. It was nice to take in the excitement of the city and come back to a quiet, neighborhood. We had a very comfortable stay and would stay again. The price cant be beat!

Despite the reviews about bedbugs, we booked it because we couldnt find anythink last minute.The place was ok. The bathrooms and the room was always clean and there wasnt any bedbug.The location is very good and around there are many restaurants and shops where you can find anythink you need.Considering the price the location and the category of this hotel i could say that is exelent !!!!

The hotel Belnord was a great pick for us. The location was wonderful. Great eats and shopping right near by. We loved the "Hot and Crusty" pizzeria that was only a block away. The room was small but that was to be expected. Staff was friendly and assisted us with luggage and helpful in locating near by points of interest. Maid service was timely and provided us with clean linings on a daily basis. Room was a little hot at times even with the radiator off. Only downfall to the hotel was there was no elevator however we were aware of this before arrival. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to New York on a budget. We chose to go New Years Eve weekend so it was a bit pricier then normal, $220 a night. However we enjoyed the hotel and the neighborhood. Will def stay again soon.

Despite the reviews about bedbugs I read on this Hotel, I can say that I stayed goodly from 12-1-06 'tiil 12-06-06 in this beautiful hotel!Ok you get what you pay for but the room is clean, comfortable, not very big but it's ok! NO bedbugs or something else absolutely! Personal is very kind, you can ask about whatever you need!Located on 87st, a very quite zone full of shops and services, in 10 metro train minutes, you get at Times Square, the heart of New York city.I recommend this place to everyone who wants to stay in Mahn with a small budget.Me and my girlfriend stayed 5 nights greatly! The day we left they kept our luggage until Supershuttle-totheairport arrived and we could even use a bath if needed!Unfortunately this hotel in not provided of any lift! But this is the only bad thing about!G.

my friend and i have just returned from a wonderful week in new york. it was our first visit and wont be the last.the hotel was just what we expected for the price we paid we had a big room with twin beds and our own bathroom. the room was clean and the linen was changed daily. the shower was excellent with plenty of hot water. the only thing that was missing was a kettle( but this is an english thing). our only complaint was the hairdryer didnt work despite reporting it at the beginning of the week, still this was minor thing.the hotel is excellent for its location as the subway was only a block away on 86thstreet and a 7day metropass cost us 24usd and we went everywhere.the cafe down the road called 82 was excellent for breakfast which we used everyday and cost us about 5 usd this filled us up till evening.we recommend the 2 day greyline bus pass which was 49usd and this covered the uptown and downtown loops on an open air bus this is the way to see new york as you can hop on an off where you want. we did all the sites and the last day we were armed with our shopping lists and went shopping macys if you go to the visitors centre you get a card for a 11% discount this is valid for a year whereas bloomingdales is only for that day. we ate mostly in times square at a place called BBQ the meals were hot, hugh and cheap the service was excellent in every place we went to and it was safe to walk about as there were so many police. the statin island ferry is good as it is free and you can come straight back and the view from the empire state building is awlsome but make sure it is clear or your see nothing. we were lucky with the weather as it was fairly warm and only rained two evenings but was clear the next day. make sure you take a street map that you can read, get a subway map as it is easy to use and good walking shoes. we read all the safety instructions and the rule of thumb is be careful dont take unnecessary risks we used yellow cabs from jfk as these are licenced and charge a set price to manhatten. to our hotel it was 49usd but the journey was an hour and we did get there at midnght.we had a fabulous time but was shattered when we came home but it was well worth it and we found all new yorkers that we met when we looked lost to be friendly and helpful and it was so reasurring to see so many police, perhaps this is what we need.our flight there and back was with air india and despite the 6 hour delay going it wasnt to bad except that no one takes notice of the safety notice or the seatbelt signs as people were getting up using the toilets and getting things out of the lockers before we landed. we prebooked our meals on their web site and this is excellent as we had good meals, (no curries for breakfast like my husband thought) the plane did have pillows and blankets and could spread out on the way back so it was a plesant flight.on the whole we had a very good experience and a good holiday and will come back

This hotel was much better than the reviews I've read. The bathroom were exceptionally clean! The rooms are no smaller than any European hotel - why do you need a huge room anyway - you only sleep there! The location is the jewel of this hotel. Upper West Side; within a few minutes walk of 2 subway lines, quiet neighborhood for NY and several eateries and shops. I'd use this hotel again in a NY minute!
