My boyfriend and I spent 4 nights here from Oct 25-29, 2006. The hotel did not have a lot in the way of amenities but we were just looking for a roof over our head and a clean bed, which it provided. They did have one computer with internet behind the reception desk. We opted for the shared washrooms and we didn't have a complaint. There seemed to be about 12 rooms on each floor with our guess being that 4 of those had the private baths, while the other 8 shared 4 washrooms, with 3 of them having shower/tub facilities. There is no elevator, which thankfully we knew about before we arrived as we were on the 4th floor. Didn't see one bug or dirt anywhere. The washrooms were kept impeccably clean, as were the rooms. The rooms were only about 8 by 7 feet big and didn't have a dresser, just a t.v. mounted from the ceiling a double bed, one nightstand, and a small closet. The subway was about a block away and central park was about 2 blocks. All in all I WOULD go back and stay here, can't beat the price in New York!

My husband and I were going to New York for the very first time. I found Belnord and thought wow this is very cheap, so I booked it. After that I started reading the reviews and I got really scared. I didn't want to sleep somewhere that has bugs!!! I didn't find anything the last minute so we had to go there. My expectations were extremely low so I was some what pleasantly surprised when we were in the lobby. The two men who were in the reception gave us a bad first impression. They felt very unprofessional and kept making mistakes and apologizing. Our room was on the 4th floor and it was tiny!! I don't mind really, but when there might be bed bugs it doesn't sound at all appealing. The one huge plus was that the bathroom was right next to us and it was clean most of the time (unless the guys opposite the bathroom had already taken a shower, then it was dirty...). For the first three nights we slept with the lights off, then when on the third morning I found one tiny bedbug and killed it, we slept the rest of the nights (11!!) with the lights on. We found one bed bug after that but had no bites anywhere. When we got home, my husband had some in his waist and I found two in my leg. But that was all. I covered myself up pretty well and used this bug protection liquid on my skin. hehe. It smelled funny in the room and the air conditioner made a huge noise. When we were checking out, they made us pay $5/BAG (!!!!!!) to keep in the luggage room!!!!! So in total we had to pay $20!!!!! That was insane. I felt the people in the reception were always unprofessional and felt to me like they didn't know how to help and made me feel like I was dumb even asking. Overall I am happy we didn't have a bigger problem with the bedbugs but the next time I visit New York I will definitely NOT stay here. The only good thing about this hotel is the location, it's absolutely PERFECT!!

This Hotel was perfect form beginning to end. The room itself is great with a very nice bathroom and cable TV. The room is clean and smells pretty good! The hotel staff were very nice. They tried there best to meet our demands. They helped us also with info on how to get around the city. GREAT STAFF. PLus it is located right next to a subway !!! i recommend this hotel to everyone!!! Have fun in New York!!!

Hotel reservation made and deposit paid to Ratestogo. On arrival at the hotel, they said they did not have a reservation for me. They then found the reservation but didn't have a room available for me. Without too much discussion a room was found for me, but they couldn't honour the rates I had been quoted. We then renegotiated rates. On receiving credit card statement, I found that they pushed through an extra transaction for about $90 without my knowledge.I am advised by my credit card company that hotels can "finalise" the account up to 90 days after checking out and the hotel claims the receptionist made an error, so I can't claim a refund. At the time the extra transactioon was processed I was staying in the hotel, so asking my authority would not have been a problem if the charge had been acceptable to me.

My wife and I were looking for a place to stay for five nights for our trip into NYC for the first time. A good rule of thumb that I found was fairly accurate was the number of stars a hotel claims to be, add two zero's onto the end of that to get your minimum nightly stay (ie: 2.5 stars = $250 per night). That's how it worked for us ... anyway, I found the Belnord through tripadvisor and ended up booking 5 nights there.A little about The Belnord hotel: to keep cost down, don't get the bathroom in your room, you get 4 bathrooms per floor of about +/- 10 rooms each. There is no elevator and smaller hallways. The room we had was roughly 8' x 12', enough for one double bed, a nightstand and not much walking room. The pillows were flat and bed was pretty hard. We packed a third suitcase with extra pillows and an extra sheet. We had ZERO problems with bugs as others claim. Bathrooms were very clean, no problems with waiting for others to get out. We paid $115 a night. We only slept in the room, our days and evenings were spent adventuring all over Manhattan.We flew into La Guardia airport, closest (and probably cheapest) to Manhattan. It was a $30 cab ride (incl. tolls & tip) from the airport to the Upper West Side where this hotel is. After you pick up luggage, DO NOT GO WITH THE PEOPLE TRYING TO SELL YOU THE SHARED RIDE OR DIRECT TRIP. They quoted us $55 plus tolls (we went through one toll, $4.50 I believe). We found a line that about 10-15 others were standing in and there was a guy hailing cabs for us - hence the $30 cab ride.The Belnord is one block from the subway, get a pocket map of the subway system and manhattan, it'll be your best friend. If you are there for 4 or more nights/days buy the unlimited subway pass for $24. It is $2 per person per ride no matter how far you ride on the subway. Good rule of thumb to begin at is you'll need to go atleast twice a day on it, from and to the hotel. We made the mistake of thinking we wouldn't use it as much as we did ... we're going to get the unlimited next time. You might be able to get away with getting one card and sharing it ...For Dave Letterman or Conan tickets, which are free, the further in advance you can try and request dates for, do it. At the beginning of October, for example, Conan was booked out until mid/late November. Although you can get standby tickets. Get to the NBC Studios Rainbow Room (outside, underneath the sign, on the Today show side) at around 7:30ish (in the morning) for the standby handout at 9:00am to have an excellent shot of seeing his show. For Letterman, you request online and they call you prior to the requested date, otherwise he has standy tix too. SNL tix get about 100,000 requests per year and they can only satisfy 8000 of them per season. Standby tickets for those get handed out on Saturday morning but people get in line on Friday early afternoon. If you like the Today show you can get there about 6:30am and have an another awesome chance of being right up against the gate they put up. We made it on national TV!For the Letterman fans, we went to Hello Deli and ate lunch there and also met Rupert! Nice guy! Good lunch too. There are so many restaurants to choose from it is crazy. We are in our mid-twenties and we liked Greenwich Village the best. It is trendier, more active and offers local night life as compared to touristy nightlife, lots of good restaurants and quite a few bars. John's pizza just by Times Square off Broadway to the East is very good pizza. Ask any local in/around Times Square and they should be able to tell you where it is at exactly.I'd definately recommend this: we bought for $77 a piece a guided tour of Lower Manhattan, Upper Manhattan on a double decker bus. Be forewarned, bring some ones for a tip to the tour guide/driver, especially if they have done a great job. This was on the red bus, there is also a blue bus that does the same thing. Included in our $77 was also tickets to the Empire State Building observation deck and the Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island. We saved about $10 pp doing that. This was good for 2 full days but they signed it for an additional day for us. PLUS you can get off and back on at any one of their MANY stops for free.

My husband and I booked this hotel for 2 nights. We read the reviews and it seemed that half of the people had great experiences and half had bed bugs. And stupidly we took our chances because of the fairly inexpensive price and good location. Well, like so many others have said, it's NOT WORTH IT. The first night I woke up with one very large bite on my lower back. I thought maybe it was a random spider or mosquito or something like that, but no, it was bed bugs. The second night of our stay, I woke up with about 6 bites all over my body. They itch like crazy. This was almost a week ago and I still have disgusting bites and scabs on my arms and back. It's one of the grossest things I've ever encountered. At checkout, I told the person at the front desk, they were apologetic, but in a sarcastic way. They asked why I didn't notify anyone earlier in a really condescending tone - like it was MY fault that I had been bitten.This hotel is deceiving. It lures you in with very reasonable rates and good location. It's nothing to rave about - the rooms are TINY, but the room we stayed in had a double bed, TV, AC, private bath - everything a couple on a budget could want out of a Manhattan hotel. (Not every room has a private bath and there are no elevators in the 5-story building.) Even the bathroom was very clean. When we first walked in to the room, I was pleasantly surprised by the "apparent" cleanliness.So, if you want to take your chances, stay here. But I guarantee you that I will NEVER stay here again. It is well worth the extra money to stay in a hotel where you don't leave itching and knowing that little bugs were crawling on you while you slept!!

I was in town for business and booked 2 rooms here for colleague and myself through expedia. While there the president was in town thus booking solid most NYC hotels. I had confrimation of 2 rooms there and when I arrived at 9pm. They told me that they only had 1 room and that the other was in their system as a "no-show." Well, standing there I found it hard to believe that I was a "no-show" considering they still had my other room available. When I asked to just give me another room they told me "sorry, we're sold out." Thankfully my colleague had friends in the city who he called and stayed with and I got the joy of staying at the Belnord. As I walked up the stairs to my room I noticed the domestic dispute between the couple across the hall which was heard all night through both doors. After making myself comfortable in the box they consider a room I called the front desk to order a wake up call because there was no clock/alarm in the room. I noted that the bathroom was so small that sitting on the toilet your shoulder touches the wall and the other sholder is hanging over the tub (I'm not a big guy either; 5-11 180lbs.) While sitting you can outstretch your arm and be well over the sink (measures about 2x1 ft. While attempting to sleep I had to deal with the loud window A/C and the domestic argument across the hall. When staying at a hotel you expect to get your wake up call, mine at the Belnord never came; yep, the guy in the morning said "they never put it in and I didn't start until 11pm so it wasn't my fault." Great, thanks, glad it wasn't you... Anyway, when it was finally over, I was happy to be leaving. To top it all off, here I am almost a month later still fighting with them because they charged me for both rooms! Yep, they said that because I was a "no-show" that they charge the full cost of the room. For some reason it's hard for them to realize that someone that booked 2 rooms and checked into one could not have possibly been a "no-show" for the second room. Idiots. Seriously, stay somewhere else, it's the worst place I've ever seen, and I've seen some pretty suspect places before.

This is my 2nd 'budget' hotel experience and I'm giving it an excellent rating inspite of the small, tiny room because overall it's great! The location is perfect in going to times square and central park and anywhere in manhattan! Checking in and out was easy and fast! It has a lot of bathrooms, you don't feel like you're sharing it with anybody. In fact, in my three day stay there I haven't once seen anybody else use it but me and my sister. I also like the fact that they have a full bathroom with tub/shower and toilet and sink and next to it is another restroom if you only need to use the toilet or the sink!! NO need to rush and wake up early just to use the shower! The negatives are the same as in most budget hotels, the sheets/beddings and towels are old and thin so you're better off bringing your own. Bring toiletries too. They don't have free soap and shampoo. (A CVS store is just around the corner if you need anything 24/7). The room has this old, musty, almost stinky smell so bring your own air freshener too! These aren't even complaints because you are in NEW YORK afterall, the most expensive city in the US if not in the world. For the price, this is surely not a dump! I'd definitely come back and tell others of this great find!!

Okay, this place was TERRIBLE! I can sleep anywhere and I couldn't sleep there! Hard bed, questionable bedding, VERY small, not clean. This is a hotel that people live in. People were coming and going all night... usually I'd say who cares but the wall are paper thin. I really hated it. Don't be cheap. spend a little extra money and stay somewhere else it'll be worth it.

I had stayed at this property about 2 years ago. I was attractred by price and location. I was pleasantly surprised that the accomodations turned out to be adequate and reasonable for Manhattan. THAT was 2 years ago... BOY, is that no longer the case.I wish I had read the reviews on this site BEFORE I booked. Yup, it's true. The place is RIDDEN with bed bugs. I had welts all over my arms, legs, and back for about 4 or 5 days. These bites are much larger than mosquito bites and WAY itchy folks!!It's disgusting this place is still in business. I have notified Hotels.com. If they continue to allow this property to advertise on their site going forward, I will lose all respect and trust for Hotels.com as well.You do not want to stay here!!!!!! No one should stay here!!!!!!!!The place should be condemned. HEED, this warning. I am not the competition creating a problem for a competitor. The truth is this hotel has had many complaints and ample time to fix the problem. It's ashame because these bugs are insidious and I imagine it would be costly to treat the entire property thoroughly. However, they will end up going out of business or renting by the hour anyway, at this rate. I have NO doubt.

Great place to stay. Would definitely recommend to any friends coming into the city for a few days. Great price. Clean rooms. Clean shared bathroom. Check for toilet paper! LOL! Always seemed to disappear. Subway 1 block away. Super convenient. Totally safe to walk up and down Broadway in the middle of the night. Nice attendants. Was totally paranoid about the bed bug situation. Very nervous. Found one small bug. And one larger bug on the first night. But didn't see anything for the next 3 nights. Comfortable bed. A little warm in the room. But good air con. Shared bathrooms weren't a problem. 3 bathrooms (maybe more, but we found 3 on the 5th floor). Although all 3 bathtubs are of different size, oddly enough. Stayed on the 5th floor. Stairs weren't a problem. See other posting for number of stairs for each floor. LOL. At least they didn't creak and squeak. Very quiet place. TV in room with multiple channels. Towels. Althought u might want to bring your own b/c they're looking a little shabby. Fresh sheets every day.Didn't experience any kind of "tipping" situations like the other poster's description. H & H bagels is just up the street! MUST EAT! Filenne's Basement is just across from there. Jamba Juice, CVS Pharmacy, multiple mini supermarkets for fresh fruit or anything else u might want to pick up....McDonalds. Barney's Co-Op. Victoria Secret. Origins. Coach. Banana Republic. Club Monaco. Starbucks. Diners line the street. along Broadway. Plenty to eat along Amsterdam Avenue too. Stayed in 2 other hostels and this is definitely by far the best area and most comfortable hostel. Really couldn't ask for a safer, cleaner place to stay.

Well we read the reviews and we didn't pay any attention because we were attracted by the price and location.We've just come back and guess what....there were bedbugs. I'm sitting here right now with about 30+ bites on my body (very itchy and annoying). I've washed all our bedding and vacuumed the bed, plus we are airing the whole apartment. And not forgetting to wash every single piece of clothing we took with us!!The location is fantastic and so is the area the hotel is situated in (safe and very NY). The rooms were really small and there wasn't a view. The staircase is narrow and hot, and if you live on the top floors it's a long way up after a long day of sightseeing. The rooms are cleaned regularly but the airconditioning makes for very artificial living.On the first day we checked the bed for bedbugs.....found none of course. We didn't really research the signs of bedbugs and one of them is little blood stains on the sheets and covers. We found those every day and we never thought anything of it.They also charge you $5 per piece of luggage that you store the day that you leave. It's a little good money earn because you have to check out by 12. Our flight wasn't until late afternoon so we had only booked a car to take us in the early afternoon. We were advised to this by a cabby who told us traffic is murder on the way to the airport. A good car company to book your car, reasonable rates JFK $46 + $4.5 for toll - --Final word, don't book this hotel no matter what, it isn't worth the money. Remember BEDBUGS are a pain and not at all fun. Think 30+ and growing bites of mosquitoes and then you are getting close to what it's like.

Any hotel with such a great location must be fairly bad to be priced so cheaply.... and Belnord is.The bad bits: the disgusting stench of stale smokethe tiny roomthe view of a brick wall (ha ha)the unhelpful (and noisy) staffcharging $5 per bag to hold our luggage after check outthe carpets and bedding looked a hundred years old, plenty of dust in there!The ok bits (good would be going a bit far as they're actually expected in most normal hotels!):The toilets were cleaned reguarly and always smelt niceThe hotel itself seemed fairly clean We didnt have bed bugsSo if you just want the room to sleep in and can handle feeling a little bit grubby and unglamorous for your stay then it is fine. We had no major complaints as there was nothing essentially wrong with it. However next time i think i would prefer to pay a little bit extra to stay somewhere less dingy!!

My friend and I wanted a weekend getaway to NYC for some shopping & girl time. We didn't want to spend a lot, and I was thrilled to find the Belnord which looked nice and was in a good neighborhood AND less than $100/night, including tax!I booked it, and THEN I read the reviews. Bedbugs, tiny rooms, shared bathrooms. We didn't care that the room was tiny, because lets face it: we didn't come to NYC to sit around our room. The shared bathroom we weren't that concerned about either because we figured we were only gone one night, and if it was really nasty, we'd just wait until we got home the next night to take showers. The bedbug reviews, however, totally freaked me out. I knew I couldn't cancel my reservation, and I knew we couldn't afford any other hotels in decent neighborhoods.My friend's mom made her read 2 articles and watch a video on bedbugs and GAVE HER A QUIZ before we left! She is so funny. I was feeling okay, though, because I had read other reviews about the Belnord that said other people had read the bedbug reviews after booking, had been really freaked out, but had no problems whatsoever. I relaxed.THEN we got to the hotel. It was too early to check in, but the nice guy behind the desk let us leave our luggage in a luggage room while we spent some time sightseeing. While we were at the desk, a girl about our age was checking out of the hotel and said "You might want to look into that room, because I woke up with these bites all over me! Look, I have like 40 bites and I itch like crazy! There's definitely something in that room!" We flipped out. We listened to her say her room number, which was 170-something. We made a mental note in case they tried to give us that room. While we were sightseeing, we tried to come up with a plan. Sleep in bugspray? A scuba suit? Find a dog that was sick with a fever and let it sleep with us, since bedbugs seek out the warmest body???When we checked in, they did not give us that room. My friend knew what to look for, so as soon as we got to the (tiny) room, we tore it apart. The room was 10 feet by 7 feet, no lie. We didn't care, though, as I said. There was a plastic, zippered matress cover. We undid it and examined the seems for evidence of bedbugs. We took the headboard off the wall because that is another place bedbugs hide during the day. At the Belnord, you can lift the headboard and it comes off easily. No evidence there. We were reassured.The next time we were in the lobby, I said to the desk boy:"Remember that girl who checked out ealier and complained of bedbugs? Do you get that a lot? You can be honest, because I've already paid." He got very flustered and said "I don't know what to say! Maybe she just made that up to get a discount. If you have any problems with your room, we are here 24 hours a day and we will move you, no questions asked."Although it was a little hard to sleep, knowing that there are bedbugs in the hotel, even if not in my room (and because the AC unit scared the mess out of me and woke me up every time it kicked on), we had no problems at all, I am happy to say. BOTTOM LINE: Do your homework before you go. Know what to look for as far as bedbugs are concerned. KNow the signs. Move if you have ANY concerns. They will switch your room for you. I would stay at the Belnord again because it is in a safe area and very convenient to the subway--only one block away and it is very affordable. THe bathrooms were clean and always available. You can always ask for our room, 203-9, because you know at least that one doesn't have bedbugs! Good luck!

We had a very good experience at this hotel when we stayed there in June 2005. The air conditioner worked good, the room was clean, and there were no "bed bugs" as other reviewers have complained about.It is in a quiet little neighborhood on the upper west side, just a few blocks from a subway station and Central Park. There are nice restaurants, grocery and drug stores and delis close by.The room is very tiny, but all we used the hotel for was to sleep in so that was not a problem at all. After walking all over NYC it was a nice, cool and comfortable place to rest at the end of the day.There is no elevator and the hallways and stairways are very narrow, so if you are morbidly obese you may want to find another hotel. But if you are that obese then NYC is probably not the place for you since many of the subways are not accessible by electric scooters or wheelchairs.

When my friend and I arrived at the Belnord, we thought it was a great place. The rooms are tiny, but that is all we needed since we were only in there to sleep. We are two female college students with a tight budget. The location is perfect, just a block from a subway. The rooms were always clean when we arrived at the hotel at night. The bathrooms are cleaned in the morning, but I think that is the only time they are cleaned. The shower leaked a few times and the floor was full of water. We never had to wait for the bathroom, but I experienced 2 ice cold showers at 8am. The mornings I woke up at 6, I got a warm shower. The hotel staff wouldn't hook up the phone since they said it would cost too much. We tried calling collect from the payphones in the lobby but they would not work either. The payphones in the lobby cost $0.50 for a local call. On the street, it is $0.25. The front desk staff was OK, not too friendly.We stayed on the 4th floor, and there are no elevators. On our third day in NYC, my friend started getting red bumps all over. She thought it was just a reaction to her lack of sleep and stress from work. Her arms and back were covered in red bumps and she had bumps on her legs and face as well. The same night we got home, she went to the emergency room. The ER doctor told her it was from bed bugs. We thought it was weird how she got bitten and I didn't since we were in the same room. I read online it can take up to 8 days to react. Two days of being home, I now have red bumps all over and they are very, very itchy. When we opened the hotel room door a few times, we could smell something which was like sour milk or orange juice. I read online that when there are a lot of bed bugs in one area, they produce a sweet, sickly smell. Again, at that time we didn't think much of it since our hotel room was beside two washrooms.Overall, the hotel was OK. I would not stay here again and would not recommend it unless they get rid of the bug problem.

When I read all the bugs stories in the reviews after my stay was booked I was horrified. So maybe I just got lucky and got a bugless room but I found the Belnord was a great budget hotel. Ive been to a lot of hotels of the same category in NY and the Belnord was definitely the best one. The hotel was modern, the room looked pretty new and was very clean. There were plenty of bathrooms in the hallway and they were all sparkling. The location is fine too, close to a subway station and Central park. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

My wife and I spent 3 nights in an "Executive double room" for $136/night. The room was quite small, but it is New York City, and it was all we needed for our stay. We opted for a room with a private bathroom, which we found to be very clean. The room had a TV, a desk and chair, a nightstand, and the bed. The staff was friendly and fairly helpful. The location was good, W 84th between Amsterdam and Broadway, a block away from a subway station. Overall, we liked the hotel and thought it was a good value for the money. We would definitely stay there again.

Just got back from a 5 day stay. We were on the 5th floor, no bugs at all, in fact the place was quite clean. I had not read the reviews prior to leaving or probably would have had the creeps! I stayed at a four star hotel in Boston last year, and three days later a five star hotel in Dallas, and came home with the itches described about bedbugs. Had no idea what was wrong with me, went to doctor, and found out. I did a lot of research on bedbugs after that, and now check when i check into a hotel. Did not have this problem.It is indeed a walk up so the flights of stairs are indeed good exercise (To get to floor 2, is 10 steps, turn, then 8), third floor (and every other floor (9 steps, turn then 8) ..yes I counted. Did not realize it was a walkup when I booked but I would have booked anyway.A staff member helped my fellow traveller with her suitcase.They do have a working ice machine---but you want to get a bag at reception, because you will not want to walk all the way up to the fifth floor to get the ice bucket, then down to fill it, then up again. The staff at the desk always accomodated us with a cellophane bag before we went upstairs.One block from 86th and Broadway subway station (did not know this when we first arrived and we took the Central Park West line and got off on 86th), a lot longer walk.Great 24 hour bread and bagel place around the corner.We went here for a fast and cheap vacation, since Jet Blue from Texas was 79 each way!We were amazed at how high hotels have gotten as it has been several years since I was in NY and used to be able to stay at the Days' Inn for 100-150, we found nothing below 250 when we internet searched several sites, so we took the Belnord at 99 for 4 nights and 79 for the last night (a Monday)Very small room (that's what I mean by european, it reminded me very much of the small rooms I have stayed in in Spain), tv worked, shared bathrooms really clean. They only give you two bath towels and one handtowel for two in a room. The maid one day stopped me and said "propina"...I have no idea what that meant...she took out a dollar bill and rubbed it together in her hand---i surmised she wanted a tip, which I would have left upon check out....but I figured she thought she could get it if she did that. I have never had anyone do that before, and I suppose you could play the same game as she did (don't understand the language), and ignore the request if you wanted to. She was attentive to our room, so it didn't really bother me to do it, just the request was a bit forward, i thought.One of the reception clerks was rude to one of the people I travelled with, but the rest were very professioanl and urbane. Professionally dressed, well groomed, and polite. I had no problems that way. I felt safe at this hotel, and slept incredibly well. I thought the acoustics were great. I heard there was a sick baby near us that was crying in the hall one night---I never heard a thing,a nd I was awake at the time that happened.Again, not fancy AT ALL, and if you get a bug free room as we did, this is a good value for a great location.

We are two international exchange students in Chicago, and we really wanted to see New York during Spring Break, but couldn't afford something expensive to sleep in. So we checked on the web and found the Belnord, who offered GREAT rebates : $45 per night for two people !!!! We didn't even hesitate and booked a room right away !Then....we saw the reviews...and we were kind of....worried ! The "bedbugs" problem scared us actually, and we could not cancel.Finally, everything was perfectly ok. It is perfectly situated, clean, very simple. The staff is very civil, we asked them to wake us up early and they did it exactly at the time we wanted. There is no lift, but we didn't have heavy luggage, so it was not a big deal for us. The room was cleaned everyday, and we could even go on the internet on the lower level. And No bedbugs ! We checked very carefully every night, it was ok. I recommend this hotel to those who want to save money and spend it on something else. If you expect somthing above the top, don't go there. It isn't a place to hang out, even if you have the tv.But if you are here to take sights and go places, it is perfect !!!!! Especially the location, one block away from the subway. For this, the hotel worths its 4 stars....

I got to the hotel at 4pm. The men who worked there were foreign and didn't speak good English. They told me they were full (I had made a reservation 6 weeks in advance and paid extra for a better room) and that they would put me up in their "other" hotel. They acted like they couldn't understand me when I told them I didn't want to go anywhere else. I felt like I had no choice but to move. The "other" hotel was like an apt. bldg for lower income tennants. The only plus was a refrigerator in the room. It seemed clean enought, but I found live roaches crawling around in the dresser drawers.

Me and my boyfriend were there for a April week-end. The check-in wasn't to be made untill 2h00pm but they had a room where we could leave our luggages and a washroom that we could use for the time being, which was appreciated. The staff was okay. Nothing special, respectful and neutral. The rooms were a little small but then again, you're in New York! You're not going to spend your days in the room. ;-) The bathrooms were -very- clean. They sure did a great job! As for the bedbugs mentionned in the other posts, there wasn't any in our bed. And I'm guessing that even the best hotels got them... so there you go. No worries about it. The high point of this place is it's location. Next to Central Park and to a Metro lane. It's only a walk away from the Metropolitain Museum of art. And not to mention that Broadway is a couple of streets after with some good restaurants. (I highly reccomend "City Dinner" on Broadway and the 90th avenue which offer a 24hour casual restaurant service! Very appreciated after you've seen a musical!:-) )Other than that, we enjoyed our little stay. It is perfect for budget-minded travellers and for young couples who happens to also be budget-minded. ;-)

It looks it's hit or miss with this place, but unfortunately I was hit. I thought I had escaped unscathed until I returned home and have been dealing with bug bites for the last week. My buddy who stayed in the next bed over is apparently fine. It's too bad, because the location and price were great, and I am generally fine staying in a hotel without all the amenities. I would stay again in the same area, but pay a little more for a safer hotel. It can happen anywhere, but doesn't seem to be a fluke at this place.
Small rooms (I mean small), clean bathrooms, amazing location, moderate night noise, no bed bugs (in our room), average staff. We just use hotels for sleeping, so we actually enjoyed it.

OK here's the scoop. My mom and I received this trip to NYC as a gift from my dad. The Belnord was where we were to stay. When I found these reviews and shared with my mom, we were terrified of what we'd find. We decided to brave it so we wouldn't hurt my dad's feelings.We stayed from March 17-20. The location of The Belnord was good. Just off of Broadway with lots of shops and places to eat. One block from the subway and very close to Central Park.We had a room with 2 beds and a private bath. We were on the first floor, so didn't have to lug our stuff up the stairs. I highly recommend getting a "bigger and better" room. The room was small, but met our needs easily. Had a window with a view and the heating system, TV worked fine. The room and bathroom were spotless and were kept that way each day. The shared bathrooms sparkled as well, and I never noticed a line. It seemed there were plenty of them. The staff was friendly and helpful and got everything we needed and included smiles and manners. Now what you REALLY want to know. The bedbugs. When we arrived on Friday we thoroughly examined the bed and room with no signs of the bugs. Each night when I'd happen to wake up, I would check the bed to make sure and no bugs. We were convinced that after staying three nights, there were no bugs, atleast in our room.That was until the last morning. When my mom got up from her bed, there sure enough was a bedbug! Talk about disappointing. Very creepy. Only glad that we hadn't seen this when we first got there-it would have been impossible to stay there had we known for sure.This review is hard to write, as I feel that for the price it is overall a great place to stay. It was really perfect for our needs. They just really need to get this bug problem under control. Though if you research bedbugs, you will find that even some of the finer hotels experience them.

Alright heres the breakdown of this hotel. I read every review of this hotel before we stayed here and I was really nervous about it and didn't know what to expect. This was a quick 3 night trip with my wife that we booked at the last minute. We just wanted to see some Broadway shows and we had tickets to Letterman(great time by the way), and we wanted to go cheap this time. We went to NY in July with our daughter and stayed at the Edison. We absolutly loved the Edison and it was perfect for the 3 of us. Of course we paid $160 a night and spent about $3000 all together for a week long trip. For the Belnord we only spent $48 a night. The hotel was not nearly as nice, but it was servicable and fit our needs perfectly. First, the room was the smallest room i've ever stayed in. We booked a shared bath (a private bath was twice as much), which was inconvient but not intolerable. The shared bathrooms were always clean and there were enough of them that we never had to wait in line or anything. We only used the room for sleeping in, as we got up early and came in late. Second, the staff. The staff was unfriendly and acted like we were bothering them whenever we needed anything(i.e. extra towels, hair dryer, wake up call), but our needs were minimal and this wasn't much of a problem. Last, location. Last time we came to NY we stayed in Times Square close to the theatre district. I was a bit leary of staying on the upper west side were the Belnord is located because I didn't want to spend a lot of money on transportation and I wanted to be able to get around easily. This location was excellent. We were a block away from the subway that ran up and down Broadway. We saw 4 plays and it took us an average of 15 minutes to get from our hotel to the theatre. It's also within walking distance to central park. Overall for a quick cheap trip the Belnord worked out really well.Prosvalue priced,great location,clean, no bedbugs!, luggage storage for late flights, several good restaurants close by(Carmine's is awsome), cable tv, easy to get a cab, safe neighborhoodConsno elevator, shared baths, noisy rooms, very small rooms, staff not very accomodating, rooms often coldWe would probably stay here again, just not with our daughter. I wouldn't reccomend it for families, but it's good for couples, singles, or friends.

I stayed at the Belnord for just 4 days at the end of February 2006. I paid around US$70 per night, as there was a special on for the winter season. Overall I was satisfied with what I received. My room was quite small, cosy, with a small television and a narrow wardrobe. There was also no elevator but it's not like everyday you have to tote luggage up the flight of stairs. As it was winter and freezing outside, I spent a lot of time indoors. I had no complaints about the heating, shared bathrooms (which were always clean), or the traffic outside (I was on the 3rd floor and I didn't even hear it). My only complaint - & thinking back it could have been a serious one - was the heater which make a loud noise at times, sometimes late at night, and made me wake up a few times. Had I planned to spend a longer time, I would have asked for a change of rooms. On the upside, I found the staff to be very friendly and willing, even those who had trouble speaking English. These are mainly the maids and handymen. If you're a student looking for an economical place located within easy access to the heart of the what makes New York, New York, this could be the place for you.

Im a pretty easy going person. Ive stayed at a lot of hostels around the world and non were half as bad as this hotel. The tiny room barely fit a full size bed. It was about as large as my walk in closet!).The room was cold and The tv was broken - the only way of turning it off was unplugging it-So just image how relaxing that was.Around 6am the showers started in the shared bathroom next to the room so needless to say that ended my relaxing tossing and turning for the night. When I got the chance to use the bathroom it was all wet and full of soaked towels and ugly scum. I did not take a shower that day of course. The last straw was to find out I had slept with an army of bed bugs under me. My body starts itching every time I remember. When I complained I got offered to change rooms but I was Done with that place and called a cab. I had booked it thru Woogle (no clue)so it was impossible to get my money back. Please avoid this one. I ended up in a hotel in Chelsea for the same price. I really think they should close that place. It's really a shame that the reviews show any good ratings - It's the worst place I have ever been to!

I stayed here from 26th-30th December with my girlfriend. The room was reasonably priced for the time of year ($150 a night, compared with $100 for a private room at a youth hostel!). The private bathroom was small, with occasionally tempremental hot water, but clean. There were no bed bugs, and the room was cleaned every day, even when we left late late morning. There was no view, but then as others have said if you are staying in New York you are not going to be staying in your hotel room all the time. The room was on the ground floor, so we weren't affected by the lack of an elevator. Staff were competent and helpful. Heating/air con worked fine.I'm puzzled by how the reviews for this hotel can be so mixed! Personally I would recommend it as a great place to stay for a budget conscious couple.

Are you one of those people thinking: "It can't be that bad hotel as the worst reviews are saying- surely I'll find it good enough for my needs". Tick tock, it's about time to change that way of thinking at least when it comes to Belnord. I've stayed in dozens of hotels in USA and this is the worst I have come across. I'm not into luxury and usually am entertained what comes to problems with hotels- but Belnord makes even all the hotel comedy series look lame and definitely boring. The question is will you be ready to pay for this fun?I booked via ---- for six nights in January 2006 and paid in advance so there was a little risk of finding the hotel unbearable. Opening the room door convinced me already of troubles. After putting the lights on I lowered the window blinds just to find out they were not long enough to cover the long windows even if you tried adjusting them. There goes the privacy. The other window had been fixed with tape to keep it in place while the upper part of it had a broomstick put across to prevent opening it from the other side. There goes the safety. The view from the window included a tall brick wall and garbage containers. By this time I had also noticed the loud noise which reminded me of a truck parked right on the backyard with its motor running. The sound of traffic I can take but this sound of something much louder than any air conditioning system was very irritating. It stopped after the midnight but just for some hours. There goes the peace.Then came the cold. I come from Finland where temperatures go easily down to minus degrees but never in my life have I felt such an intense cold as in my room. The heating unit wouldn't work and when I explained the situation in the reception a spanish speaking man came to see about it. I tried telling him I've been working on the heater for hours but he said couldn't understand english at all. First he asked for ten minutes so I patiently waited for a miracle to happen. Then the man suddenly stood up claiming the AC unit was hot which it wasn't. For this simple word "hot" I had something to say back "not hot or even warm". The man looked careless about the whole thing and simply mumbled "I'm sorry". We walked back to the reception area but the hotel staff only wanted to hear what the man had to say- of which I didn't understand a word as it was all in spanish. I got an extra blanket- I almost caught a flu too on the following night. Six nights- such a long time when returning to the hotel was almost undesirable. I would go there for just to sleep and then get off first thing in the morning. I don't like writing in a bad --- style like this but every hotel is only as good as the worst it has to offer to its customers. Ruining or even harming somebody's business is not my intention but finding something good about Belnord is quite impossible. Belnord makes sleeping on the street a good option. You have been warned- I didn't believe the worst things people came up with but maybe you should.

My husband and I stayed at the belnord from dec. 28-Jan.1. We thought the hotel was perfect for the amount of money. The bathrooms were always clean and I never even saw anyone else using them. The staff was very helpful and the location is very convenient. The subway stop that it is nearest to is one of the main lines that goes through manhattan. The only complaint we had was that the rooms were very very very small. It was not that big of problem as we were only there to sleep. We will definately stay at this hotel on our next trip to New York.

No bedbugs and helpful staff. OK there is no elevator, so we did have to carry our bags up 5 floors - however they had offered to help. Bathroom clean, great location. Couldn't ask for a better hotel at this price.

My mother and I stayed at this hotel from Dec 2-6 2005. Right before we arrived at the hotel we saw the reviews that there were bed bugs and had only hoped that they had taken care of the problem before we checked in. We were totally wrong the first night we were there we found one on the bed and went down to the office and asked for a new room but they acted like they didn't even know they had the bed bugs! I mean after the 10 reviews of people saying they complained about bed bugs how could they not know. So then they offered to give me another room on the 4th floor without a private bathroom eventhough I paid for one with a private bathroom. So when i said they would have to refund the difference they said we'll see what we can do. So before I carried all of our luggage up to the 4th floor since there is no elevator i asked my mom to go up and check the room. When she turned on the light she immidiately found a huge bedbug on the bed and brought it down to the front desk and they still did not offer any assistance.  We went to NY on one of the busiest weeks and there were no other vacancies so we were forced to sleep there! We bought a plastic cover for the bed, moved the bed to the middle of the room, and slept with the lights on every night. We felt like we were on "SURVIVOR" taking turns sleeping. The bathroom was clean but the room was run down and there were bed bug egg shells everywhere. Everynight we killed at least 2 that were on the carpet and on the walls. Rude staff who didn't know anything. Nice location but they need to close this hotel down for about a month and exterminate they have an infestation! If i could rate this hotel with no stars i would but that option is not available! Sleep outside with the bugs and save your money, if you are going to stay here!

Ok, let's be frank here, the Belnord is NOT the Waldorf-Astoria or the Plaza.My wife and I usually stay in properties closer to Times Square but $450+ per night prices post-Thanksgiving just were not in the budget. I'd read a few reviews of this hotel prior to booking and had a few reservations about my reservations but those were pretty much erased upon arrival. The Belnord is in a very nice "Upper West Side" location and super convenient to the subway and bus*. ONLY WARNING: NO ELEVATORS! Suitcases up narrow stairs to fifth floor was our exercise for the weekend!! Our (private bath) room was "cozy" but fine as we were only there to lay our heads. (You're in New York! You don't stay in your rooms to watch TV!) Neighhood has several decent small restaurants and a full-service CVS Pharmacy is a block away. *Bus M86 is cross-town (through Central Park) and drops you right beside Metropolitan Museum of Art. We would stay there again if prices mid-town were out-of-budget.

When I have seen the reviews on the site, i was affraid to go to this Hotel! Everyone talk about Bedbugs....I have stayed in the hotel in the end of November and it was a great hotel! It was a very nice room, not very big, but it was okay! A great bathroom. We had everything for ourself! The rooms were every morning clean up! We have go every morning in to New York City and in the evening we get back! The Staff was very nice and friendly!So for everyone, stay in this hotel, it's very great!!!!!! :D:D

My wife and I usually like to stay in midtown Manhattan, but holiday prices can break the budget. We shared a bath, some were full bathrooms others were powder rooms. The bathrooms were very clean. Contrary to what other have written, I had a good experience. The room was small, but the only thing we used it for was sleeping. Very nice neighborhood. There is no elevator so be prepared to use the stairs. I will stay here again.

The location wss great but for November the rooms were cold because the heating was not on. I asked when it would be on and was told it would come on automatically when the weather got cold. My room was cold throughout my stay of 7 days.My travel bag went missing from the room I stored it in after checking out and before leaving for the airport. When I returned to collect my bag and found it missing the staff just said there was nothing they could do about it. I would have thought if another guest had taken it by mistake that when that person returned to get the correct bag the staff would at least have enquired as to whether my bag had been taken in error. There was no offer to do that or anything to help me. I left without my bag and have not seen it since. As it contained all the purchases I had made in New York it was a disaster and a very sad end to what was otherwise a lovely holiday.

The hotel staff were rude, didn't even have us booked in to the hotel when we arrived. We were given a tiny room we did not pay for, no view out of the window except for a brick wall. Only 2 bathrooms per whole floor. There were bed bugs found in the bed. I have read other cases, and i too had itchy lumps on my legs and arms for over 2 weeks. Please don't waste your money here, it's not worth it.
Great little gem in the Upper West Side! The price is very affordable, room was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. Will definitely stay again.

We needed urgently a room in Manhattan, and we came across by the Belnord Hotel. It is a nice and small hotel just near Central Park on the 87th Street.You get what you paid for - it's not Hilton but also not a dump - it's an average hotel in Manhattan which offered us a cleaned room with new towels and sheets and a private bathroom.My wife and I had to use the stairs (there is no lift in the hotel) every morning when we went to the park for jogging.We enjoied to stay at Belnord hotel, and got fair value to our money.

WARNING WARNING WARNING WARNING I was a bedbug feast. I thought it was a spider and complained. The clerk agreed it must be a spider. The next day I had more bites and didn't know they were bedbugs until the 3rd day. By then I was covered, hands, head, arms upper body. Disgusting and the clerk told me maybe it was mosquitos although the temp outside was in the 40's. (so they lie, too) Thank goodness we left and found another hotel once I knew what was happening. But its been a week and I'm still itching and allergic to the bites so I'm breaking out in hives, too. No fun. DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL!! YOU WILL BE SORRY AND THEY DO NOT CARE. IT WAS HORRIBLE.

This is one of the most reasonably priced hotels that we found. We got the room with its own bathroom. It was pretty quiet & the area is safe. The room is very small. There was little room from the edges of the bed to the walls and the TV was on a stand hanging from the ceiling. We didn't see any bugs, though. There are no elevators in the hotel so we had to walk up 5 floors (that's where they put us) everytime we came in and out of the room. BUT it met our needs and it was well within our budget. So we got to spend more money on food, gifts, etc. And we were out and about most of the time. We really only came back to shower & sleep. The customer service that we received from the helpdesk was not good. But they did hold our luggage after checkout for a few hours while we went out to eat.It took us about 10-15 minutes to get to time square from the time we left our hotel door to the time we got to time sq. So if you plan to spend lots of time in the room (which I hope you don't if you are on a personal vacation because there are lots of things to do), then you may get frustrated with the small space and poor customer service.

There is a bedbug problem....even if the place is quiet and clean no one wants unexpected visitors of this kind. It has a great location being only a block from a subway stop. The private and public bathrooms were spotless but the bug problem makes this a place to avoid. Sad as my room looked like it had recently been refurbhished and was the cleanest hotel room I have ever seen. For the money it would have been a great deal but because of the bug problem this place must be avoided.

i read some of these reviews so i was a little afraid when i first got to the belnord. Although small, the rooms were very clean and no bed bugs in my room. The bathrooms were clean and kept that way our entire stay. I had a great time in New York and this place is so close to everything. I would definitely stay here again and recommend to friends.

Beware!, there are definately bed bugs in this hotel, lots and lots and lots of them. If you don't mind being feast on by bed bugs, this would be a great hotel to stay in. The bathrooms are clean and it is really near the subway, only 1 block away. However, the bed bugs are terrible. 1 week after checking out of the hotel, I am still itching from the bites. Even though the hotel is fairly cheap, it is not worth it. Paying a bit more for another hotel is much better than being eaten alive while you are getting your night's rest.

A week after our stay in the Belnord Hotel, I'm fighting against bedbugs at home. Yes, they do travel home with you and it is such a nuisance to get rid of those buggers - not to mention the antibiotics I have to take as the bites have infected... I got bitten on our last two nights there, and now that I brought them home, they are having a feast.The bedbugs epidemic is very unfortunate, because othwerwise we would have been very happy with Belnord: it's amazingly reasonably priced for a NYC hotel, location is good, our room (twin with private bath) was comfortable and quite spacious, and we found the personnel to be friendly.So I truly hope they will get rid of the bugs!!!

i kind of feel for this hotel as i think they know they have bedbugs, i mean the beds aren't very old - at least mine wasn't - but they're in the fabric of that place. i didn't actually ask to be moved as i killed a bug on my first morning (so full of my blood it wasn't moving very fast across the bed - so engorged it just exploded into a blood spot on impact!) and i hoped maybe that was my bed bug. but i killed another the day after! in fact, check out ur sheets and u'll see small washed out blood spot stains on them.actually i don't know why i feel for this hotel because their idea of cleaning is to dowse the place with shake'n'vac (or maybe it's bug killer and i breathed it in for 3 nights) and hoover it up again. the bathroom was clean enough - and a communal one too. but considering i have backpacked around asia and this is the worst place i've stayed in, i think that says a lot. it smelled of wee and brasso and was cell like and i just felt like i breathed no fresh air the whole time i was in there.i will say one thing - i complained to hotels and they gave me some financial compensation - maybe it was cos i offered to send them one of the bugs i'd preserved in sellotape! so thumbs up to hotels and thumbs down to the belnord.

Within 24 hours we had been allocated 3 different rooms. We had to sleep in the first room for one night as they did not have one available with a bathroom, although that is what we had paid for. On the second night in a different room, while lying on the bed, my husband was bitten by bedbugs on his hands, wrists and shoulders, which caused large swellings and blisters. He immediately went down to reception to complain and was given keys for a third room, and so we had to gather all our belongings and move again. No one seemed at all concerned and at no time were we offered an apology or any recompense. Altogether staying at this hotel was a dreadful experience and quite ruined our holiday. We would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Belnord is a modest but reasonably priced hotel. The rooms were clean and well maintained. Our room contained a bathroom including shower and bathtub. The room also contained a TV and phone. There is no elevator, which can be a problem if you are carrying a lot of luggage. Hotel staff were pleasant. Hotel lobby contains an internet kiosk, phones, vending machines. There is no internet wireless, which is advertised on some sites. Belnord is located near subways, restaurants and shops. I would recommend it to travellers looking for a hotel, which is affordable and centrally located.

when we arrived the air conditioning was broken, and the window would not open, which made the room like a sauna. It took three requests to get the air conditioning fixed. However after that it was fine. Luckily we stayed on the ground floor - no elevator. Slightly odd smell in the rooms. The room was very small but fine, with a wardobe and bed side table. The shared bathrooms were always clean and as half the rooms had their own bathrooms anyway, there were very few to share with and there was never a que. The reception desk were not overly friendly, but have said they will send back my coat which I left (wait and c!)Sheets were always changed and I didnt get bitten by any bed bugs.It was a good location, on a fairly quiet street, but only ten minutes on the tube to times square.Good value for money.

I spent a week at the Belnord hotel and I had the worst experience in my life.First the hotel seems right except some little things(no lift..) but on the last two nights I was biten by the bugs at least 50 times.My arms, my neck, legs were full of bites.IT'S NOT A JOKE SO AVOID THIS HOTEL IF YOU WANT TO ENJOY YOUR TRIP.

Called hotel to reconfirm day before arrival. No record of reservation made with Hotels. Several phone calls to Belnord and Hotels and 30 minutes later it was confirmed. Don't know who was at fault, but my guess would be Belnord. They are very confused group.We arrived at hotel at 1PM. Naturally, room not ready, left luggage in unsecure room (they give key to everyone to just go and pick up their luggage). Returned at 6:45 hoping for quick check-in, shower and leave for theater by 7:30. Key card did not work. Back to desk. Person #1 came to see what was wrong. Did not work. Back to desk. Person #2 came to check it out. Did not work. Person #3 came to check it out. Did not work. Back to desk. Call maintenance man for real key. Maintenance man said room no good - it was a storage room. Back to desk. New room. Card did not work. Maintenance man used key, but room was occupied -- good thing -- a/c barely working. New room -- 4th floor -- no elevator - but key card worked. Whole procedure took 40 minutes. No apology.Room acceptable, a/c okay, bathroom acceptable (toilet needed to be flushed from inside tank -- reported first night and still broken 2 days later).Not a bug in sight.

I spent one night at this hotel and had the worst experience. I booked a single room with a private bath and woke in the middle of the night with my bed full of bedbugs. I was transferred to a tiny room with no bathroom, still full of insects. Of course, although I spent the night in a room cheaper than the one I had paid for, the hotel staff did not give me any reimbursement or solution. I would only recommend this hotel if you are fond of sleeping with bedbugs!

We found this place online 2 days prior to visiting NYC as we ran into an unexpected need for a hotel. The hotel is perfectly situated between Amsterdam and Broadway on 87th Street within walking distance of some great restaurants and bars as well as shopping and, of course, the metro line. The rooms were small...I mean small with a small bathroom, but everything was very clean. As you don't visit NYC to stay in your hotel room, it was a perfect place to throw down the bags and get some rest at night. Beds were comfy, TV worked fine...no complaints. The service was fine. One drawback and only because we had a lot of luggage...no elevator. But a little exercise never hurt anyone! Save money for other expensive NYC stuff...great place!

I recommend this hotel to people that are looking for a rather cheap place in NY. I didn't find bed bugs in my bed, and they changed linens every morning. The rooms are small but clean, they have TV and air conditioned (a bit noisy but useful!). The bathrooms were very clean and I never had to wait to use them. Definitely a nice place in a nice area of NY.

I am a low maintenance traveler. This is a low cost hotel. What that means is don't expect any frills. This hotel is very clean, located in a good neighborhood, restaurants nearby, and close to the subway. The rooms are very small. We had a double bedroom and it was very small with a shared bathroom. The bathrooms were very clean and we never had to wait for them. There is no elevator. If you need service or want someone to wait on you this is not the place. However, if you are looking for a low cost, clean place to sleep then this is a good choice.

i was a single white female traveling to nyc for the 1st time for my birthday. I felt very relieved when I arrived at hotel afetr reading so many bad reviews of places in nyc. YES IT WAS SMALL!!!! but was very clean sharing a bathroom was no problem at all either. also clean. I got no bed bugs. subway was close a little far for taxi rides from everthing but i would definetly stay here again. I am a restaurant g.m. so I am not trash and I found this to be a great place, hey your in nyc for the sites not the hotel spend your $$$ on souvineers!!!!

The Belnord is very satisfactory for the price. Our room was very small but clean. Linens were changed evry day, and there were ample soap and towels. AC and TV worked fine. We never had to wait for the bathroom, and there was plenty of hot water. Staff was courteous. Neighborhood is clean and safe. Good access to bus and subway. Only problems: Despite what is on Expedia's site, the high speed internet is not functional. The system is there and running, but it was left by the previous tenant (NY Institute of Technology), and the hotel has no passwords. The "business services" consist only of a pay-as-you-go Internet kiosk.

Also didn't mind the digs. Didn't read this review below either. Now I know. Bed bugs, bed bugs, bed bugs! I am now worried that I am going to be the vector to a Los Angeles infestation since they seem to have tagged along for the ride.Stay away from this place at any price!!!

I feel victim to this dump. I travel frequently to different cities, and book through hotels. I have probaly stayed in NYC a dozen or more times this year. Hotels usually puts me at a decent location. Being that I am usually in town for 2-3 days max and working outside of my room, i tend to not want to pay over $200 per night. This time around, my regular spots were fully booked. So when the representative from Hotels offered this "hotel" i accepted. I booked my room with a queen ( i am 6'6) and requested a private bath as i usually do. I even called the "hotel" myself 30 minutes later to confirm my reservations. All was good, or so i thought. Four days later, on a friday night, i get to NYC and head to the Belnord. Instantly i got a real funny feeling. The sidewalk filthy, drunks sitting around rapping and the place looked more like a ran down apartment building. There was about 10 people in the "lobby" which made it crowed. I check in with the rude "front desk" person who after about 10 mins of talking on this cellphone finally gives me my key card and point me to my room. Room was a dump, nasty looking sheets, white towels turn brown sitting on the bed, no private bath and a single window pluged with an AC older than my grandmom which is right next to the bed. Oh, and did i say there was a twin bed in the room?The "closet" could not even fit my suit bag. The place was so nasty i was afriad to put my bags on the floor. I have seen elevators that look and smell better than this place. If there were a fire, two people couldn't walk side-by-side in theses hallways. I go out to the desk to explain there might be an error and ask to be moved, and without saying a word he points to a hand written sign that says "No vacancy." And you bet he was on his cellphone. My guess is i was a disruption to his conversation. So at this point, i am fuming. I call hotels and they call the "hotel." I get the " we had to move him because the bathroom in his room isn't working story" and they are willing to reduce my rate if i would stay for the night and then be moved into another dump in the AM. Considering the "service i had gotten thus far, my answer was " give me back my money!" I checked out within 25 mins of coming in, and found a differnt hotel right over the river in NJ. I paid less, and it was 10x bigger and better. Stay away from this place. It is Bad news!

Yes, bedbugs--and the staff are very unhelpful. One told me it had been "a long time" since they'd had bedbugs, but I see from other reviews that it probably isn't true. No one was willing to do the least bit to correct the problem. Now I have to bake all my clothes and throw away my suitcase to try to avoid bringing the bugs home. They are disgusting. Be careful. Don't stay here--it's worth paying double for clean, decent lodgings.

My daughter and I stayed at the Belnord for 2 nights: May 27, 28. Althought the room was tiny we could not beat the price. Shared bathrooms was not a problem. The bathrooms were clean and we never had to wait. We actually never saw another person on our floor. The location was awesome. The subway was convenient and the hotel was surrounded by very nice shops and restaurants. The hotel staff was extremely polite and helpful. We were able to check our bags before and after checkout. All in all our trip to NYC was great and we would definately stay at the Belnord again - it's the best deal in town!

I stayed at the Belnord the nights of May 15 and 16, 2005. Through Hotels.com I booked a double with a private bath, although it was just myself (private bath appears to be an option only for doubles). The room was clean and small but not claustrophobic (thanks to the very high ceilings); the bathroom was small and spotless. It would have been okay for two people, although the double bed was in a corner, so one person would've been sleeping against the wall. There was no view, as it was on an airshaft, but that made it nice and quiet (no street noise!). The weather was mild while I was there, so I didn't need heating or cooling, but I did turn on the fan-only setting of the window heating/cooling unit for air circulation. The fan was relatively quiet and provided white noise for extra noise insulation. My room was on the ground floor, which was convenient, but I wouldn't have minded a room on an upper floor because I had only one small bag with me. The gentleman at the desk when I checked in and again when I checked out was very friendly. I had no experience afterwards of rashes or any other potentially bug-related symptoms as some other reviewers have mentioned. (I wonder whether they perhaps reacted to detergents or other cleaning agents?)The location was great for me because I was visiting a friend who was staying on East 86th, and the hotel (which is on West 87th almost at the intersection with Broadway) is very close to the 86th Street crosstown bus, which made it convenient for us to meet up with each other. It is a very basic, no-frills hotel, but I found it perfectly acceptable and would consider staying there again should I be in need of inexpensive (for New York City :-) ) accommodations.

Stayed from May 8-13. On the second day, I noticed some red welts and bumps all over my stomach and legs that were incredibly itchy. Should've checked this site before I booked. Apparently, bed bugs are not uncommon at the Belnord. At the time, I just needed a cheap hotel to sleep in.It is now May 15, I checked out two days ago and the itching has gotten worse. I counted over 50 bites on my body and fear that the bugs may have gotten into my luggage, came home with me, and have now infested my house and clothing. These bugs are not easy to get rid of.Do not stay here, even with the cheap rates. The troubles don't end when you check out. This type of problem follows you home and requires professional extermination. Spend a little more at another hotel so you can have peace of mind. You've been warned.

We just came back from NYC, we stayed at Belnord in a double room on 4th floor. The room was very clean, tiny but had a TV, a small closet and A/C. There was a sparkling clean bathroom across the room and only once I had to wait for it. The location is great, 2 minutes from the subway and close to Central Park.I recommend it to students and everybody who plans to do a lot of sightseeing and won't need a room service.

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Belnord, the check in and out was done in seconds. My girlfriend and I had a room with private bath which was very comfortable for two people. The bed was large and comfortable and the bedding was changed daily, as were the towels in the bathroom. the bathroom itself had a shower, basin and W/C and the size was more than adequate. There was a built in wardrobe, desk and t.v. in the room and also an air conditioning unit. The hotel also has vending machines, ice dispensers, payphones and a pay-as-you-go internet station.The location of the hotel is ideal, the 1/9 subway line is at the next street down broadway and only takes 2 minutes to get to and from there it is only a 7 minute ride to times square. the area is loaded with lots of great places to eat, each with their own cuisines and budget. The city diner on 91st/Broadway is great for cheap genuine NYC food and the diner experience. There are places with prices from $5 to $40 and up per person so you are certain to find somewhere to suit your pallette and wallet.The area around the hotel is very safe and well lit throughout, I was apprehensive of the dangers of crime in a big city like New York but these fears were soon put to rest when I got to the area. It is only about a 10-15 minute walk to central park also which is very convienient.I would recommend the Belnord to anybody who wants to come to New York but is working on a budget. the hotel has everything it needs to have and is an ideal base to travel from when seeing all the sights that NYC has to offer. I shall glady be staying at the Belnord on my next visit to the amazing city of New York.

I stayed at the Belnord twice before and this was my third stay. The hotel is excellent for the price. The rooms are small but very clean. I never had a problem with bugs or roaches. The staff is friendly and very helpful. I read some reviews stating that there are college students living there. Upon check in, I asked if this was true because I was afraid it would be noisy. The front desk clerk called the manager and she explained that the room is quiet and clean. She told me that college students are living there but as of next month they won’t be there anymore. I felt very assured and happy to hear this because the Belnord is perfect for my budget and I’d like to return when I visit New York again. Well, my trip was fantastic. I had a quiet room, and once again enjoyed my stay. I highly recommend this hotel for someone with a small budget. It’s definitely worth the money.

We stayed here for a week last year, and we found the hotel very pleasant. It is an inexpensive hotel with few amenities, but it does what it does very well. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. There was more than enough closet space and a refrigerator. While the bathrooms were shared, they were always very clean, and were unoccupied all but once in the entire week. It is right on the subway, so all of New York is within easy reach, and Central Park is within walking distance as well. The only problem we had was that the room keys seemed to keep needing to be recharged, but the staff was very polite about replacing them.Overall, I highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for an inexpensive hotel in New York City.

This hotel is a JOKE!!! I wouldnt even advise my worst enemy to come and stay here, thats how bad it is.We came to the hotel at 11pm on a Friday night, exhausted after a 9 hour journey, and wanted to check in. So the man asked us to fill out all the paperwork (room was already paid for as booked online) and was hoping to get to our room next. But oh no, after this, the man who works there tells us there is a flood in our room so we cant stay there, so he says we can either get a room with a shared bathroom, or he can send us to another hotel. I've never liked the idea of sharing my bathroom with strangers so I asked, will u pay for the cab if we go to the other hotel. Oh yea sure he says, the manager at the other hotel will be there tomorrow morning, just give him the receipt then and he will refund you. So we decide to go...We get to the address we were given, and it doesnt even have a sign that says HOTEL outside, so I get a really bad feeling...We get in there and it looks like a sorry excuse for a hotel...It seemed to be one of these places that people who cant get an appartment live in...But because it was so late we couldnt be bothered with anything else...I ask the guy at this new hotel (Devon hotel they called it) when the manager would be there, he says 8am tomorrow morning.Following morning I wake up, take a shower and am going to see the manager, only there is no manager there, and the guy refuses to refund us our cab money (it wasnt alot, only like $5, but it was the principle of the whole thing) SO I ask the guy to call Belnord for me so I can straighten things out, the guy im talking to on the phone puts me on hold for ages, so i hang up and call again. Then he asks me to hang around for 15-20 mins while he tries to get ahold of the manager but I've had enough, so I go over to belnord instead and there I tell the guy (who ended up being very friendly and helpful) the story and he tells us he has a twin room with a private bath (we had wanted a double bed) so we take it...But I say we still want to talk to the manager and we are advised that she will be there Monday AM...Monday AM comes and no manager in site, apparently she has had an accident (yea right)...Basically it was one excuse and lie after another and I still havent heard from a manager about a refund after everything we went through. I would say AVOID THIS HOTEL!!!!!!!

as mentioned is the other reviews, generally its ok for the price, but no free meals:small roomsno elevatorsomewhat of a mazeon the other hand - a good location in a quiet area, near the park and the museum.

When I was at The Belnord it seemed adequate, even though we had no storage space. However, I got home a few days ago and am covered in bed bug bites from head to toe. Do not stay here unless you like bed bugs!!

My new wife and I were travelling the States for 2 months for our honeymoon and were after a cheap hotel in Manhatten for 5 nights. We had a standard room, and weren't expecting too much. To our great surprise, though not huge, the room had a tv, fridge and tallboy, and had a nice, clean bathroom attached. Great location, close to subway and a fantastic place to crash after long days siteseeing of this amazing city. Highly recommended.

We stayed at the Belnord Nov 2004. Very clean. Helpful staff. One minute walk to subway. Small rooms but sufficient for the budget minded traveller. Close to many restaurants. Minutes from beautiful area of Central Park. Recommended!

I stayed there during September 2004. Forget about an Elevator or a bell boy. You have to carry your own luggage up the stairs. The rooms are very small. It's the size of a dorm room. Everything is cramped together. Some students do dorm there. It's great if you're not planning to spend much time there. It's very clean, and not once did we have to wait for a restroom. Great location, minutes from a subway and taxi access. I recommend this hotel if you're trying to save money and planning to just SLEEP and shower. Make sure you get the right amount of beds!! They're twin!

We've just got back from a six-night stay in NY and stayed at the Belnord. It's in the most perfect location - right near a subway that takes you to all the main attractions in minutes and has some good shops and places to eat nearby (try the Hot and Crusty Deli - it has the best coffee and cheesecakes!) The hotel itself was a bit fusty - we stayed in a room that was tiny but had a tv with good channels and the maid made the bed and gave us fresh towels everyday. We didn't see one cockroach (we were on the second floor) and no bedbug bites so far! The sheets were a bit itchy but the bed was comfortable (ask for an extra pillow as soon as you get there). We has a shared bathroom but didn't have to wait for it once and it was cleaned every morning. All in all I would probably try and get a bigger room when I go back to NY but I would stay there again. If you're going to spend all your time in your hotel room then don't stay there but if you're not too fussy then it's recommended.

This hotel is FULL of bedbugs and cockroaches!! Our daughter is attending college and this is were she lives. We witnessed first hand the "bug problem" while we were there visting. It is TERRIBLE!!! If your staying for any amount of time I would advice you to not have any mail sent there as it is lost constantly by the very unorganized front desk. I would strongly advice anyone that is looking for a place to stay to keep looking as you just may have nightmares if you stay in cockroach and begbugville!

Rates were very reasonable. Facility was clean. Staff was polite.Room was quite small, but big enough for two people to stay in. You might not want to stay here if you were going to be in the room all the time, but you should be able to find enough going on in New York city to occupy your waking hours....Bathrooms were shared, but there were four on the floor we were staying and we never had problems getting into one.Be advised the hotel does not have an elevator.

On the 22nd November I got back from a 5 day stay at the Belnord; a brithday trip to new york. My partner paid for both flights and the accomodation so understandably he had a tight budget for our hotel.Secretly I was dreading our stay at the Belnord, however I was kinda relieved when we arrived to find that it was fairly presentable from the street. Inside was ok too i thought - more of a hostel than a hotel, but ok. We had an en suite bathroom and a double bed. The bedroom was tiny and once we'd shopped there was barely any floor space (we probably only had 5 or 6 shopping bags) but it didn't matter really! The window didn't open which was supposedly made up for by the aircon machine...it wasn't, the room was hot and the aircon was old and noisy, but again, who cared, we were hardly there. As a big plus, our bathroom was very clean and there was a tv (ideal for checking out the weather as the window faced a brick wall and the climate indoors was misleadingly tropical!). Basically we didn't mind the more negative aspects of the hotel because the location was excellent! Upper west between Amsterdam and Broadway and minutes from central park. The route is on one of the main subway lines and the walk is not too far into the centre or over to the east side. It's safe and there's a calm feeling to the area.
